loans.name: Merline Nadege

texts.fr:
Merline est une cliente de Hope Congo âgée de 35 ans; célibataire avec un enfant a sa charge.

Il ya bientôt 7 ans qu'elle s'est lancée dans le commerce de poisson sale a l'arrêt de ses études 

Ayant déjà bénéficie de deux cycles de prêts a Hope, elle a rembourse sans difficultés et a des énormes épargnes 
Avec le troisième prêt elle veut élargir son activité en achetant des cartons de poissons sales comme la morue, le thon , la sole , capitaine, et ses intentions c'est commencer déjà a faire la vente en demi gros et détails.

A la longue , elle veut ouvrir un dépôt de poisson sale pour être grossiste et avec ses bénéfices elle compte améliorer les conditions de vie de sa famille et aussi amener son enfant a faire des études universitaires .
texts.en:
Merline is 35 years old, has a child in her care and is a client of Congo Hope.
Almost seven years ago she got into the salted fish business, after completing her education.
She already received two loans from Hope Congo, that she was able to fully repay and could also make some saving. 
With this third loan she wants to expand her business by buying cartons of salted fish like cod, tuna, sole, captain and her intention is to get into whole sale as well as retail.
In the long term, she would like to start a wholesale business of salted fish and with her profits she expects to improve the life condition of her family and also to be able to pay for college education for her child.

loans.use: to purchase boxes of salted fish, such as cod, tuna, sole, captain

loans.name: Ana Cecilia

texts.es: Ana tiene 28 años de edad y es madre soltera. Tiene dos hijos de menor de la edad de 7 años. Reside en casa de sus padres en la ciudad de Chiclayo, la capital de la región de Lambayeque. Gana la vida vendiendo ropa y sandalias. Cuenta con experiencia de 3 años en este negocio. Vende sus productos en el Mercado Moshoqueque, un mercado grande, conocido y con mucho movimiento comercial. Es muy conocida en el mercado y tiene clientela ya establecida. Desea aumentar su mercadería con la compra de mas ropa y sandalias. Por ello, ha creido conveniente solicitar un préstamo de 1000 nuevos soles a Edpyme Alternativa. Con esta inversión, podrá aumentar sus ingresos y seguir solventado sus gastos familiares.
texts.en: Ana is 28 years old and is a single mother.  She has two children younger than 7 years old.  She lives with her parents in the city of Chiclayo, the capital of the Lambayeque region.  She makes a living selling clothing and sandals.  She has three years of experience in this business.  She sells her products at the Moshoqueque market, a large, well known market with a lot of commercial traffic.  She is very well known in the market and has an established group of customers.  She wants to increase her merchandise inventory by buying more clothing and sandals,  For this reason she is requesting the loan of 1000 new soles from Edpyme Alternativa.  With this investment she will be able to increase her income and continue to cover her household expenses.

loans.use: to increase her inventory by purchasing more clothing and sandals.

loans.name: Harriet

texts.en:
Harriet N. lives in the Lubaga Road neighborhood, in the city of Kampala, Uganda. She is married and has 4 children, none of whom are in school.  

Harriet has a business of selling old shoes. She has been in this business for less than one year, and she works 6 days out of every week. Harriet sells her products at the market, by means of retail. She has requested a loan in the amount of 1,300,000 Ugandan Shillings from MCDT SACCO, which she will use to buy more bales of shoes. She also generates additional income through roasting maize and green bananas.

The main business challenge(s) for Harriet include seasonality and defaulters. Her goals and aspirations for her business are to start selling by wholesale only and also to build her own house. Harriet lives in a home that she rents; she has access to electricity, but doesn't have access to piped water. Her major monthly expenses include food and rent.

loans.use: To buy more bales of second-hand shoes.

loans.name: Anari Group

texts.es:
La A.C. “ANARI” iniciará su primer ciclo en Pro Mujer, como parte del Centro Villa Exaltación, está compuesta por ocho integrantes y está dirigida por una mesa directiva, en esta ocación una jefa de grupo realizó la entrevista, ella es señora Lourdez. Los negocios que las integrantes de la asociación comunal llevan adelante son variados entre ellos tenemos: Tienda, venta de verduras, sembradío de verduras, confección de deportivos, venta de café.
 
La señora Lourdez,  indica que hace cinco años atrás trabajaba con Pro Mujer, posteriormente se retiró, ahora vuelve a trabajar en la institución por invitación de unas amigas. En la actualidad ella tiene un negocio de venta de verduras, que viene trabajando hace diez años atrás aprendiendo el mismo de sus papás..

El crédito que ahora sacará es para aumentar su capital de trabajo (compra de verduras), que compra de la calle Rodríguez (calle comercial de la Cuidad de LA Paz) y los vende todos los días en la riel de Villa Dolores, desde las 5:30 hasta las 14:30. Esta forma de trabajo le permite generar recursos para apoyar en lo posible a su familia, pues ella es casada y tiene dos hijos.  

Cuando se le consulta qué le gusta de Pro Mujer, ella responde que le gusta salud.
texts.en:
The ANARI Community Group will complete its first loan cycle with Pro Mujer as part of the Centro Villa Exaltación. It is made up of eight members and directed by a group of leaders. In this instance, a head of the group interviewed for the loan. She is Mrs. Lourdez. The members' businesses are varied and include: a store, vegetable sales, planting vegetables, sports equipment, and coffee sales.

Mrs. Lourdez shared that she began working with Pro Mujer five years ago. She retired and now has returned after some friends invited her. She currently has a business selling vegetables and has been working at it for ten years after having learned the business from her parents.

The loan will be used to buy more vegetables on Rodríguez Street (a commercial street in the city of La Paz) and she will then sell them every day at the railroad in Villa Dolores every day form 5:30 am until 2:30 pm. This job lets her earn money to help support her family. She is married and has two children.

When asked what she most likes about Pro Mujer, she resonded that she likes the health education and resources.

loans.use: buy vegetables

loans.name: Lorenzo

texts.es:
Lorenzo tiene 48 años de edad, está casado y tiene 2 hijas a su cargo. Esta familia vive en casa propia en una comunidad rural pequeña perteneciente al distrito de Tambogrande – Piura. 

Lorenzo se dedica a la crianza de ganado ovino, porcino y aves de corral. Actualmente cuenta con 10 ovejas, 4 porcinos y 20 pavos. Lorenzo también es agricultor y  tiene un terreno agrícola en el cual ha sembrando mango, para su comercialización. Además, él labora como peón en un trabajo estable en un fundo de su zona donde se siembra mango.

Lorenzo solicita a Edpyme Alternativa un préstamo de 500 nuevos soles que destinará en la compra de de alimento balanceado para sus animales. Así como para la  compra de fertilizantes y agroquímicos para su sembrío de mango.

Lorenzo goza de buenas referencias personales y laborales y este crédito le sería de gran utilidad.
texts.en:
Lorenzo, 48, is married and has two daughters in his care.  This family lives in their own house in a small, rural community belonging to Tambogrande-Piura District.

Lorenzo raises sheep, pigs and barnyard fowl.  He currently has ten sheep, four pigs and twenty turkeys.  Lorenzo’s also a farmer.  He has a field where he grows mangoes to sell.  In addition, he works as a laborer at a regular job at a local large farming complex that grows mangoes.

Lorenzo is asking Edpyme Alternativa for a 500 new sol loan to buy nutritionally balanced animal feed as well as fertilizer and farming chemicals for his mango crops.

Lorenzo has good personal and work related references and this loan would be of great use to him.

loans.use: to buy animal feed and crop fertilizer.

loans.name: Rose

texts.en:
Rose is 53 years old and lives in Silang, Cavite, Philippines. Her husband Andres is a machine operator, and they have several children, all of whom are working. She makes a living by running a variety store and a food stall. She also rents video karaoke machines and earns at least PHP 624 a day.

She is applying for a loan for PHP 21,000 loan to buy groceries, toiletries and beverages to expand her product inventory, and to maintain her video karaoke machines. She expects to increase her income as she expands her business. She faithfully meets up with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of her work every week and draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God she studies.

* All CCT community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and repay loans.

loans.use: to restock her variety store.

loans.name: Florence

texts.en: Florence is a mother of nine children who are ages 7-22 years old. She is married to a house construction laborer in their village. Florence has a small supermarket in which she sells different items such as milk, juice, and fruits. She has been doing this business for the past three years. Her business is doing well and has enabled her feed her family and pay school fees for her family. Florence needs a loan to buy more supermarket items in order to make more profits. With the profits she plans to expand her business.

loans.use: to pay for milk, juice, fruits, and other goods that she will sell in her store

loans.name: Mujeres Con Desición (Cuenca) Group

texts.es:
El banco comunal Mujeres con Decisión está formado por 12 mujeres trabajadoras, luchadoras y con un gran carisma, laboran en diferentes actividades, las mismas que les permiten aportar a la economía del hogar y sacar adelante a sus familias. Viven en diferentes lugares de la ciudad de Cuenca, esta ciudad es la tercera ciudad más importante  del país, su gente mantiene su cultura y tradiciones, son muy amables y cordiales.

Una de las socias es la Señora Rosa, vive por los alrededores de la ciudad de Cuenca. Tiene 57 años, es casada y en su unión conyugal ha concebido 8 hijos,  6 son casados e independientes,  su penúltimo hijo trabaja para sus gastos personales y su ultima hija   estudia en una academia de corte y confección. Su esposo es comerciante, no tienen casa propia por lo que vive en casa de una de sus hijas.
 
Doña Rosa es comerciante y se dedica a la venta de granos, esta actividad la desempeña hace 10 años y solo los fines de semana. En su casa se dedica a la cría de pollos, gallinas y cuyes que son para su consumo y para la venta.
 
Es socia del banco comunal hace 4 años y su nuevo crédito lo va a invertir en la compra de cerdos y  alimento para sus animales.
 
Su meta es crecer con el criadero de animales.

Las fotos pequeñas adjuntas es de dos socias que por motivos de trabajo no pudieron estar presentes cuando se tomó la foto del grupo.
texts.en:
The communal bank "Mujeres con Decisión" is comprised of 12 hard-working, charismatic women who work in different business activities to contribute to their household economy and help their families get ahead.  They live in different parts of the city of Cuenca, which is the third largest in the country.  Its people maintain the culture and traditions, and are kind and agreeable.

One of the members is Mrs. Rosa who lives on the outskirts of the city of Cuenca.  She is 57, married and has eight children, six of whom are married and independent.  The next to the last son works to cover his own expenses and the youngest daughter is studying at an academy to be a seamstress.  Her husband is a merchant and they live with one of their daughters.

Rosa sells grains for a living.  She has been in business for ten years, working only on the weekends.  jAt home she raises chickens and guinea pigs for family consumption and to sell.

She has been in the communal bank for four years and plans to use this new loan to buy pigs and animal feed.

Her goal is to expand her animal raising business.

The small photos are of the two members who could not be present in the group photo for work reasons.

loans.use: To buy pigs and animal feed.

loans.name: Karen Maria

texts.es: Karen Maria tiene 37 años, su actividad es la venta de cosméticos. Hace más de 7 años que tiene el negocio,  es una persona muy abnegada pues siempre está pendiente de lo que sus clientes le solicitan. Ella tiene 2 hijos menores de edad a su cargo, Karen tiene que alistarse temprano todos los días para alistar su bolso y salir a ofrecer polvos, lápiz labial, brillos, cremas, shampoo y perfumes. Es por eso que solicita este crédito para la compra de estos productos. Sueña con establecer una pequeña tienda en donde quiere aumentar su inventario.
texts.en: Karen María, 37, sells cosmetics.  She’s had this business for over 7 years.  She is a very self-sacrificing person for she is always watchful of her customers’ requests.  She has two minor children in her care.  Karen must get ready early every day to arrange her bag and go out to sell compacts, lipsticks, glitter, creams, shampoo and perfume.  She is asking for the loan to buy these products.  She dreams with setting up a small store where she wants to increase her stock inventory.

loans.use: to buy cosmetics and beauty supplies.

loans.name: Porvenir Group

texts.es:
El comité Porvenir es D. la ciudad D. San Lorenzo, ellas son señoras muy luchadoras y unidas, que trabajan por la obtención D. mayores ingresos para sus familias, para que D. esa forma puedan tener una vida digna y decorosa. Actualmente el comité se halla conformado por 17 mujeres, quienes trabajan en un ambiente D. respeto y mutua cooperación.
La Señora Maria se dedica a las ventas desD. hace ya mucho tiempo, venD. todo tipo D. artículos, como ser frazadas, cubiertos, abrigos, zapatos y demás. Gracias a su trabajo pueD. sobrellevar los gastos D. la casa y también pueD. darle una vida mejor a sus familiares quienes D. ella dependen. Comenta que uno D. sus mayores sueños es poder abrir un local propio donD. pueda ofrecer sus productos a sus clientes.
Ella solicita el crédito para la compra D. frazadas, zapatos, abrigos y demás con lo que podrá abastecerse y así satisfacer la demanda D. sus clientes.
texts.en:
The "Porvenir" (Future) group is in the city of San Lorenzo. They are a group of very determined and united women, working to earn more income for their families, so that they can have a decent and dignified life.  Currently, the group is maD. up of 17 women, who work in an atmosphere of respect and mutual cooperation. 

Maria has been working in retail sales for many years now. She sells all types of articles such as blankets, cutlery, coats, shoes, and other items. Thanks to her hard work, she is able to meet household expenses, and also give a decent life to her family members who depend on her.

She says that one of her greatest dreams us to be able to open her own store, where she can sell her products. She is applying for a loan to stock up on blankets, shoes, jackets, and other things. In this way, she can satisfy the needs of her customers.

loans.use: compra de zapatos, sabanas, frazadas y demás para la posterior venta.

loans.name: Sopheap

texts.en:
Sopheap (in the photo) is 58 years old. Her husband, Brach, is 60 years old. They live on an island in the Mekong River about 15 kilometers from Phnom Penh City. They been married since 1980 and have two daughters. 

Sopheap is a weaver, while her husband is a farmer. She is asking for a loan of $200 to help with her husband’s farming business by buying seeds, fertilizer and pesticide to maintain his farm.

loans.use: To help with her husband’s farming business by buying seeds, fertilizer and pesticide to maintain his farm.

loans.name: Shishikara Group

texts.fr:
Adelaïde est une commerçante âgée de 32ans qui habite le quartier Kanyosha de la Mairie de Bujumbura. Elle fait le commerce de produits alimentaires (huile, riz, bière industrielle) depuis 2ans. Elle a fait ses études jusqu’en 10e année de l’école secondaire. Elle est mariée a Julien et ont ensemble 3 enfants dont 1 étudie. Elle prend aussi en charge 2 autres enfants de la parente proche.
 Le crédit Kiva  de 100,000 francs burundais qu’elle obtient lui permet d’augmenter son capital pour acheter beaucoup de produits alimentaires (huile, riz, bière industrielle) a revendre pour réaliser de grands bénéfices. 

Elle est membre  du groupe  communautaire« SHISHIKARA».
texts.en:
Adelaïde is a 32 year old storekeeper who lives in the Kanyosha neighbourhood of the municipality of Bujumbura. She has sold food products (oil, rice, industrial beer) for 2 years. She attended school until the tenth year of secondary school. She is married to Julien and they have 3 children of whom 1 goes to school. She also takes care of the 2 children of a close member of the family.
Her 100,000 Burundi franc Kiva loan will enable her to increase her capital to purchase a large quantity of food products (oil, rice, industrial beer) for resale to make a big profit.

She is a member of the « SHISHIKARA» community group.

loans.use: to increase her means to buy a large quantity of food products (oil,rice,industrial beer) for resale to make a big profit.

loans.name: Gulmira

texts.ru: Гульмире 50 лет, разведена и имеет одного сына. В 1991 году Гульмира начала свой бизнес в животноводстве с начальной суммой 12,000 сом (KGS). На сегодняшний день, благодаря упорству и настойчивости Гульмиры, ее хозяйство приносит доход в сумме около 8,000 сом (KGS) в месяц.  Для снижения расходов на корм, летом Гульмира отправляет скот на пастбище, а осенью продает откормленный скот на местных рынках. Для дальнейшего развития бизнеса, Гульмира  обратилась в компанию «Бай – Тушум и Партнеры» за кредитом в сумме 50,000 сом на покупку скота. В будущем, Гульмира планирует также увеличить свое хозяйство за счет покупки жеребят  и бычков.
texts.en: Gulmira is 50 years old, divorced and has one son.  Gulmira started her animal husbandry business in 1991 with a capital of 12,000 som (KGS).  Today, thanks to her persistence and diligence, her farms brings in an income of about 8,000 som (KGS) per month.  To reduce her animal feed expenses, Gulmira sends livestock to a pasture during the summer and sells fattened-up livestock at local markets during autumn.  To further develop her business, Gulmira requested a loan in the sum of 50,000 som from the "Bai-Tushum and Partners" company to buy livestock.  She plans to also expand her farm by buying foals and calves.

loans.use: to purchase livestock

loans.name: Umoja Shg Group

texts.en:
Greetings from Western Kenya and the farmers of Umoja SHG group!  Vitalis is the facilitator of the Umoja SHG group. Vitalis and his group joined One Acre Fund in the year 2011 and will re-enroll in the 2012 program.

With this loan, One Acre Fund will purchase fertilizer, seeds, and other important inputs to distribute to Vitalis and his group during Kenya’s next planting season in February 2012. The distribution of farming inputs is part of One Acre Fund’s integrated agriculture package, which includes training, reliable input supply (such as fertilizer and seeds), credit and insurance.

Vitalis takes care of eight children at home. He joined One Acre Fund due to One Acre Fund’s best prices and in order to ensure food security for his family, and to have additional profit for school fees.  In the recent 2011 season, Vitalis had an excellent maize yield, harvesting 12 ½ bags on ½ an acre of land. Before joining One Acre Fund,  Vitalis was only able to harvest 3 ½ bags of maize on ½  acre of land.

With income from maize sales, Vitalis will educate his children, and make improvements upon his house.

In 2012, the members of Umoja SHG group will each plant between ½ and 2 acres of maize.

In the photograph above, Vitalis is pictured with his group members.

loans.use: To source farming inputs, such as seeds and fertilizer, at low prices for the 2012 planting season.

loans.name: Francisco Jose

texts.es: Francisco José tiene 32 años, su actividad es brindar el servicio de tricitaxi. Hace más de 8 años que tiene este negocio, a pesar de tener dificultades de salud con su esposa Francisco ha logrado mejorar las condiciones de su familia. El motivo del crédito que solicita es para la compra de llantas, plástico, pedales, cadenas entre otros productos. Sueña con terminar de remodelar su vivienda y obtener más ingresos día a día para obtener el pan de cada dia.
texts.en: Francisco José is 32 years old. He works as a tricycle taxi driver. He has been doing this for more than 8 years. Despite his wife's health issues, Francisco has managed to improve his family's living conditions. The reason for the loan he is asking for is to buy tyres, plastic, pedals, chains and other products. He dreams of finishing remodeling his home and obtaining more income every day so as to make their daily bread.

loans.use: to purchase tyres, plastic, pedals, chains and other products

loans.name: Rosa Alpina

texts.es: Rosa Alpina se dedica a la venta de ropa hace más de 3 que posee este negocio. Este no es el primer financiamiento que realiza pues han sido de gran ayuda los que ha realizado para su negocio. Rosa tiene 1 hijo de cuatro años a su cargo, ella ofrece sus productos de manera ambulante y en su vivienda pues ciertos clientes conocen la buena calidad que ofrece en productos. Sueña con terminar de realizar un cuarto en su vivienda para su hija. El motivo del crédito es para la compra pantalones, camisas, faldas, trajes y ropa para niños.
texts.en: Rosa Alpina has been selling clothes for more than 3 years.  This is not her first loan for they have been of great use for her business.  Rosa has a 4-year-old son in her care.  She is a street vendor and also sells her wares at home because her customers know the good quality of products she offers.  She dreams with finishing a bedroom for her child.  The reason for the loan is to buy pants, shirts, skirts, suits and children’s clothes.

loans.use: to buy clothes.

loans.name: Maria Beatriz

texts.es: La Sra. María es cliente antigua, ella conformaba anteriormente un grupo solidario, desde hace dos años ella trabaja con crédito individual, la actividad que tiene es la atención de una pensión de comida, ella diariamente prepara entre 80 a 100 almuerzos, la venta la realiza a las tiendas que se encuentran a su alrededor y otros clientes pensionados, la señora María se separo hace años de su esposo, ella vive con sus dos hijos que son jóvenes, quienes le colaboran especialmente en la hora del almuerzo en la atención a los comensales, ambos hijos cursan estudios superiores, la mamá los educo y crio desde pequeños y conforman una familia unida, siendo ella la cabeza del hogar es una persona muy responsable y trabajadora, el destino del crédito es la compra de refrescos para su restaurante y también para la compra de insumos para la elaboración de sus platillos.
texts.en:
María is a longstanding client.  She used to be part of a communal bank but has been working with individual loans for the last two years.  She has a catering business; she prepares between 80 and 100 meals daily that she sells to nearby stores and to some customers who are retirees.  

María separated from her husband years ago and lives with her two children who are young and help her out especially at lunch time to take care of customers.  Both children attend to higher education classes.  Their mother educated them since childhood and they are a very united family; she’s the head of household and is a very responsible, hardworking person.  

The loan will be used to buy soft-drinks for the restaurant and also to buy ingredients for her meal preparation.

loans.use: to buy soft-drinks and supplies for her business.

loans.name: Mary

texts.en:
Mary is a 50-year-old dairy farmer. She is a single mother of one and a grandmother of two orphan children. She has been in dairy rearing as the primary business and poultry rearing as the secondary for the past 12 years, with a monthly income of KES 10,000, which she uses to support her family.

She is applying for her seventh loan term from KADET LTD after repaying the previous loans successfully. Mary will use the loan to buy animal feeds and poultry feeds. 

With the anticipated profit from the business, she will educate her grandchildren. Her hope and dream is go open a butchery shop, which will cater to her grandchildren’s needs.

loans.use: To buy animal feed and poultry feed

loans.name: Virgen De La Misericordia Group

texts.es:
Virgen de la Misericordia se denomina el excelente grupo de mujeres conformado en la ciudad de Itá, son mujeres muy unidas y trabajadoras. Ellas diariamente luchan por darle a sus hijos y familiares las condiciones mínimas para que tengan una vida digna y decorosa.
La señora Maria trabaja diariamente desde muy tempranas hora y regresa a su casa ya muy entrada la noche. Nos comenta que tiene una peluquería modesta pero bien equipada, allí ella puede generar los ingresos necesarios para ayudar a su familia y darles un mejor futuro.
Ella solicita el crédito para la compra de peines, tijeras, gel, acondicionadores, shampoo y demás insumos necesarios para su salón.
texts.en:
“Virgen de la Misericordia” is the name of this excellent group of women from the city of Itá; they are very united, hardworking women.  Every day the struggle to provide their children and family members the minimum conditions needed to have a proper, dignified life.

María starts work very early and returns home quite late at night.  She comments that she has a modest, but well-equipped, beauty salon where she’s able to earn the necessary income to help her family and give them a better future.

She requests the loan to buy combs, scissors, gel, conditioner, shampoo and other supplies needed in her beauty salon.

loans.use: to buy supplies for her beauty salon.

loans.name: Saranjav

texts.en: Mrs. Saranjav is 39 years old and earns a living by making the covers for the traditional Mongolian nomadic tents which are known as gers. She has been in this line of work for eight years and sells her goods to wholesalers. She lives with her husband and her daughters in a ger in Ulaanbaatar, the capital of Mongolia. All of her daughters are in secondary school. Her goal for the future is to earns more money by increasing her sales volume. She is in a good business for doing this, because gers are seen as essential items in Mongolia.

loans.use: to buy more wool for making ger covers.

loans.name: Laon

texts.en:
Laon is 40-year-old married woman with five children, four of whom are in school. For three years, she has made a business of selling foodstuffs in Bor, South Sudan.

Laon is requesting this loan through BRAC South Sudan to purchase sugar and oil. She will use the extra income from this loan to pay her children's school fees.

loans.use: to purchase sugar and oil to sell.

loans.name: Las Azucenas Group

texts.es:
El grupo la Azucenas está conformado por seis personas trabajadoras y emprendedoras. La coordinadora del grupo  es María del Socorro de 24 años quien se dedica a la venta de carne y hueso desde hace 5 años junto a su hermana. Ella invertirá el crédito en carne, hueso, hígado, corazón…etc.
Las otras integrantes son Ana María  de 39 años quien se dedica a la venta de tortilla y leña desde hace 4 años, Consuelo de 56 años comenzó realizando tortillas ahora vende arroz de leche y cajetas, Dielka vende nacatamales, Esmeralda tiene una tortillería y Urania vende ropa.
texts.en: The communal bank "Las Azucenas" is comprised of 6 hardworking and enterprising individuals.  The coordinator for this group is María del Socorro, 24, who has had a business selling meat and bones with her sister for 5 years.  She will invest this loan in meat, bones, and offal such as cow heart and liver.  The other members of this group are Ana Maria, 39, who's had a business selling tortillas and firewood for 4 years, Consuelo, 56, who started out making tortillas and now sells rice pudding and caramel, Dielka, who sells nacatamales (traditional, large Nicaraguan tamales), Esmeralda, who makes tortillas, and Urania, who sells clothing.

loans.use: to buy meat and bones

loans.name: Rusbel

texts.es: Rusbel de 23 años es un joven emprendedor vive en casa de sus padres, y lo que mas desea en la vida es sobresalir adelante para tener un buen futuro. Rusbel, es un joven muy activo, con mucho esfuerzo desde muy temprano se va a trabajar en obras de construcción. Agradece a los maestros de construcción por darles un trabajo como obrero y así aprovechar juntar su dinero para poder abrir un negocio en la cual pueda estar mucho mejor. Hace 02 años que lleva trabajando en esta actividad. Lo que mas le gusta de su trabajo es poder conversar y compartir ideas entre compañeros de trabajo y considera que lo mas difícil es permanecer cargando tierra, cemento, entre otros para elaborar la construcción pues es muy cansado. Es por ello que acude a los financistas de MFP para solicitar un préstamo en la cual pueda invertir abriendo una tienda de ropa exclusiva. Este será el primer crédito con MFP, por ende necesita el apoyo de los financistas para seguir creciendo. En su banco comunal agradece a sus compañeros por permitirles ser parte de ello. Con los 1,000 nuevos soles, podrá comprar ropa exclusivas de la zona para tener un trabajo mas seguro.
texts.en: Rusbel, at 23 years old, is an entreprising young man.  He lives at home with his parents and what he desires most in life is to excel and be successful, in order to have a good future.  Rusbel is a very active young man and with a lot of effort, he leaves very early in the morning to work in construction.  He is grateful to the construction experts for giving him work as a laborer and in this way allowing him to take advantage of saving his money so that he could open a business which can be much better.  He has been working at this business for 2 years.  What he likes most about his work is that he can converse and share ideas among co-workers and he considers the most difficult part to be carrying dirt and cement, among other things used in construction and that's very tiring.  It is for this reason, that he responded to the financial officers at MFP to request a loan which he can invest in opening an exclusive clothing store.  This will be his first loan with MFP, therefore, he needs the support of financers in order to continue growing.  In his communal bank, he thanks the other members for allowing him to be a part of the group.  With the 1,000 nuevos soles, he will be able to purchase exclusive clothing of the region in order to have a more secure job.

loans.use: to purchase clothes to start a new business.

loans.name: Salima

texts.en:
Salima is a married woman with three children who are all grown up. She owns a house with electricity and piped water. Her greatest monthly expense is food for her family. 

Salima has operated a rental house business for the past 10 years; her potential clients are the local area residents. She faces a major challenge of delays in rent payment from her tenants. She dreams of owning more rental houses.

With the 20,000 Kenyan shillings, she wants to purchase ceiling boards and paint, and to pay some laborers to renovate her rental house. She decided to join Yehu because they offer quality financial services.

loans.use: To purchase ceiling boards and paint, and to pay some laborers to renovate her rental house.

loans.name: Sandra Marlen

texts.en:
I have been making decorative baskets for two years. I have a small studio where my daughters and two helpers I have hired prepare the baskets with me. We sell the baskets to stores in the city. The profits from this have helped me support my family. I have an increase of sales during the Christmas month since the baskets are given as gifts filled with candy, coffee and other treats. I need this loan to improve and expand my business.

Loan Use: Purchase wire, tape, thread, glue, lime, soap and other supplies

Tengo dos años de dedicarme a elaborar canastas y las adorno, tengo un pequeño taller donde 2 muchachas que contrate me ayudan, y mis hijas decoran las canastas para venderlas en tiendas de la ciudad. Los ingresos que percibo me han ayudado a mejorar el presupuesto familiar, en este momento por epoca navideña mis canastas se venden mas, ya que las personas las regalan llenas de confites, cafe, u otras cositas, es por eso que necesito invertir mas para que la produccion mejore y por ende mis ingresos.

loans.use: Compra de alambre, cinta, hilo, pegamento, cal, jabon y otros.

loans.name: Vida

texts.en: Madam Vida lives in Abokobi, Accra, Ghana and owns a shop in which she sells candies, beverages, biscuits, toiletries, tins of rice and other goods. She wishes to expand her operation and is seeking a loan of $900.00 so she can grow her business.

loans.use: working capital

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Teresia would like to buy a pig

loans.name: Angélica

texts.es:
My son and I have been selling groceries for more than five years to support our family, including my elderly mother. With the Lord's blessing our business has been successful, but at this time we are running low on merchandise and need to stock up. That's why I'm asking for this $1000 loan.

Translated by Kiva volunteer

Tenemos ya mas de 5 años que empezamos en el negocio de abarrotes en el trabajamos mi hijo y yo este ha sido el ingreso familiar. Bajo mi responsabilidad tengo a mi madre que es una persono ya mayor de edad. Gracias a dios el negocio a salido adelante pero me esta asiendo falta mercancía. Solicito $1,000.00 dlls para la compra de mercancía y así tener más inventario y más ventas.

loans.use: To restock a grocery store.

loans.name: Felipe Gregorio

texts.es:
Felipe is a hard working, responsible man, married and father of six children, ranging from 10 to 26 years of age. They used to live in México state but, in search for better opportunities for his family, decided to move to Monclava, Coahuila. There, faced with the difficulty of finding a job and the need to make a living for his family, he started his own business selling seasonal fruits. He initially sold them on street intersections but, with the help of his children, has managed to make his business grow and prosper.

In order to increase sales, Felipe needs a $1075 loan, which he’ll invest in the purchase of tuna fruits and oranges. He has committed to repaying this loan in six months. The well-being of this family is in your hands. Contribute to the growth of his business and they will be grateful.

Translated from Spanish by Leticia Britos, Kiva Volunteer.

Felipe es un hombre muy trabajador y responsable, está casado y tiene seis hijos, entre 10 y 26 años de edad. Anteriormente vivían en el estado de México pero, en busca de mejores oportunidades para su familia, decidieron mudarse a Monclava, Coahuila, donde, ante la dificultad de encontrar un empleo y la necesidad de obtener los recursos que necesitaba su familia, inició su propio negocio con la venta de frutas de temporada. Comenzó vendiendo en los cruceros de algunas avenidas, pero con ayuda de sus hijos, ha logrado sacar adelante su negocio y hacerlo crecer.

Para poder incrementar sus ventas, Felipe necesita de un préstamo de $ 1,075 dólares, que empleará en la compra de tunas y naranjas. Se compromete a devolver esta cantidad en 6 meses. En tus manos está el bienestar de esta familia. Contribuye al crecimiento de su negocio y ellos te lo agradecerán.

loans.use: Purchase of merchandise

loans.name: Rena

texts.en: Rena is an Internally Displaced Person from the Fizuli region located in the south-east part of Azerbaijan.  She, the family of her husband and her four children were relocated to Baku as a result of the Armenian-Azerbaijan military conflict over Garabakh.  She runs a construction materials shop together with her husband.  They have been in this business since 1993.  Since then she has developed the business, but now she is a bit short on inventory to be sold.  She wants to increase the number and variety of inventory.  She has applied for a loan in the amount of $700.  This is her second loan from Normicro Baku branch.

loans.use: To buy more inventory to grow her construction materials business

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy an assortment of cosmetics and hair products.

loans.name: Mohammad Ajmal

texts.en: Mohammad Ajmal lives in district 6 of Kabul, Afghanistan. He is single and he still lives together with his parents. He has a carpet shop. He is a very talented young man who started this business only last year. Still, he has attracted a good number of customers during this one year. Now he wants to further develop his business, so he has requested a small loan to  expand his inventory so as to make a better monthly income to help his family and also to make a better future for himself.

loans.use: To expand his inventory

loans.name: Identity

texts.en:
The entrepreneur is 25 years old. He has one child who was born two months ago. His elderly mother and father are living with him. He has a small store where he sells electric home supplies. He applied to borrow $1200 to purchase new electric supplies. He also wants to improve the store by painting it and make some advertising to increase his income and improve his project. He wants to save for a better life for his family.

Disclaimer: This entrepreneur is from a volatile region where the security situation remains unsettled. Lenders to this business should be aware that this loan may represent a higher risk and accept this additional risk in making their loan.

Note: Personally identifiable attributes of this entrepreneur have been altered to protect him or her (i.e. blacking out portions of the entrepreneur in his/her picture, altering his/her first or last name, etc.).

loans.use: Purchase new electric supplies

loans.name: Theresia

texts.en:
Mambo from Dar es Salaam, Tanzania! This is 32 year-old Theresia M., who is married with four children, aged 4, 8, 13, and 15.
In 2007 Theresia established a seamstress business, and now requests a loan of $275  in order to purchase additional stocks of material in bulk. She thanks you for your support.

loans.use: To purchase additional stocks of material in bulk for her seamstress business.

loans.name: Silvia Guadalupe

texts.es:
Silvia Pérez is married and has five children. More than three years ago she realized that her husband’s salary was insufficient, and the family was always lacking money. When her husband lost his job Silvia decided to start her own business, one that would not cause her to neglect her duties at home. Her family helped her buy supplies and she converted part of her home into a store, selling school and office supplies. Her husband is now working, but Silvia continues to run her business.

Silvia is asking for $250 to for merchandise, which she will pay back in three months. With your contribution, Silvia will prosper and provide a better quality of life for her family.

Translated from Spanish by Sarah Bishop, Kiva Volunteer.

Silvia Pérez es casada y madre de cinco hijos, hace mas de 3 años con apoyo de su familia quienes le ayudaron a comprar algo de material puso una papelería en su casa, esto cuando se dio cuenta de que el sueldo de su esposo era insuficiente y siempre tenían carencia y falta de de dinero, ya que no completaba, después su esposo se quedo sin trabajo, y ella decidió empelarse por su cuenta, en algo que no descuidara su casa. Actualmente su esposo trabaja en una empresa pero ella continua con el negocio.

Ahora solicita un crédito por US $250 que pagara en 3 meses para comprar mercancía para su negocio. Con tus contribuciones Silvia prosperara y dará mejor calidad de vida a su familia.

loans.use: Purchase merchandise

loans.name: Benkoma Iii Group

texts.en: Mohamed Makie J. is the leader of Benkoma group.  He is 57 years old and married with more than 7 children.  He is well respected in the community for his efforts to encourage youth to engage in agricultural production.  The group members are also the members of the village bank.  To increase their rice production, the group is requesting a loan of Le.2,500,000 for farm inputs.

loans.use: The Benkoma III group is wanting to increase their production of rice this coming season and need additonal capital in order to do so.

loans.name: Raïmatou

texts.fr:
Born around 1970 in Porto Novo, the political capital of Bénin, Mrs. Raïmatou G. is married to a health worker and is the mother of four children, two of whom she still looks after, the other two being married. As a result of her 15 years’ experience, Mrs. G. has become the main supplier to local residents. She generally buys her supplies at Cotonou’s Dantokpa market at least once a week. She is requesting this loan to set up as a wholesaler in order to make her business more profitable.

Translated from French by Sarah Llewellyn, Kiva Volunteer.

Née vers 1970 à Porto Novo la capitale politique du Bénin, dame G. Raïmatou est mariée à un agent de santé et est mère de 04 enfants dont 02 sont encore à sa charge, les 02 autres s'étant déjà marié. Du haut de ses quinze années d'expérience dame G. Raïmatou est devenue la principale fournisseur des habitants de son quartier. Elle s'approvisionne généralement au marché DANTOKPA de Cotonou au moins une fois dans la semaine. Elle sollicite ce crédit pour se lancer dans la vente en gros afin de rentabiliser son commerce.

loans.use: To buy 20 trays of fresh eggs, 50 liters of vegetable oil, 5 baskets of fresh tomatoes and 5 baskets of onions.

loans.name: Khaled

texts.en: Khaled is 55 years old, married and has one child. He lives with his family in the suburbs of Saida in south Lebanon. Khaled repairs cars for a living. In order to earn more money for his family, he also works as a taxi driver. He needs a loan of $1,000 to buy new equipment that will help him expand his car-repair shop. Khaled has been client with Al Majmoua for the past four years and always repays his loans on-time.

loans.use: To buy new equipment for a car-repair shop

loans.name: Lightness's Muungano Group

texts.en:
Lightness, a 30-year-old married mother with a five-year-old child, owns a small general store which she started in 2006. She works daily from 7 a.m. to 10 p.m., earning a monthly profit of about $25 from her sales.

Lightness now hopes for a loan to buy more items for her business. She will share this loan with her subgroup member, who has a business selling maize.

loans.use: To increase her inventory.

loans.name: Maria

texts.es:
Maria has worked selling shoes as a street vendor for more than 25 years. However, two months ago she left that activity because she is tired. Now she works with her daughter in the general store she has in her home.

Maria has also been renting out her house for the past two years.

Most of the loans she has received have been invested in her previous shoe selling business, but now she is requesting money to expand the inventory of her general store with more products.

Translated from Spanish by Eliana Colunga, Kiva volunteer.

María ha trabajado vendiendo zapatos de forma ambulatoria por más de 25 años. Sin Embargo, hace 2 meses ha dejado esta actividad, ya que está cansada. Ahora, solo se dedica a trabajar con su hija en la tienda que esta tiene en su casa.

María también alquila su casa desde hace 2 años.

La mayoría de préstamos que ha recibido los ha invertido en su anterior negocio de venta de zapatos, sin embargo, ahora está solicitando para surtir la tienda con más productos.

loans.use: stock her general store with more products

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: To purchase merchandise such as perfumes, pants and other goods for her small business.

loans.name: Agatha

texts.en:
Agatha F. is married and has 2 children. She has received no formal education. Her husband is a commercial driver.

Since 2000, Agatha has been buying rice, sugar, gari, and other food items in bulk, bringing them to her house, and then measuring them into smaller, more affordable quantities to sell to her customers. Her business is doing well at Bronibima near Elmina. She is responsible for feeding her family and paying the utility bills.

Agatha is requesting a loan to increase her capital to buy the food items she sells in larger quantities. She plans to reinvest her new profits into the business to increase sales and thereby increase her income.

loans.use: To buy food items in larger quantities for resale.

loans.name: Cira Cecilia

texts.es:
La señora Cira tiene 61 años D. edad, pertenece al Grupo Solidario  Santa Lucia y vive en la calle Elías Aguirre 486, distrito D. Moche, provincia D. Trujillo, departamento D. La Libertad, Perú.
Estudió hasta el cuarto ciclo D. la especialidad D. Educación, pero ya no continuó estudiando debido a que se casó. Tiene 4 hijos D. los cuales uno depenD. D. ella porque es estudiante.
Actualmente tiene una bodega en su casa,  en la cual venD. artículos D. primera necesidad, golosinas y cerveza para llevar.
Con el primer crédito D. S/. 300 que canceló en 4 cuotas, invirtió en la tienda.
Con este crédito D. S/. 700 , el cual será cancelado en 4 cuotas, invertirá en artículos D. primera necesidad.
Cira Cecilia sueña con tener un Mini Mercado.
texts.en:
Cira is 61 years old. She belongs to the Grupo Solidario Santa Lucia and lives on Elías Aguirre Street in the Moche district of the Trujillo province in La Libertad, Perú. She studied education at the university for four semesters but did not continue because she got married. She has 4 children, one of whom is dependent on her because she is a student. At present, she runs a grocery store out of her home, where she sells basic necessary items, sweets and beer. With her first loan of S/. 300, which she paid back in 4 installments, she invested money in the store. With this loan of S/. 700, which she also plans on repaying in 4 installments, she will invest in the purchase of basic necessary goods. Cira Cecilia dreams of one day owning a mini grocery store.

Translated from Spanish by Priya Bapat, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Invest in the purchase of basic necessary items

loans.name: Rosa Alvina

texts.es:
La señora Rosa pertenece al Banco Comunal “Loreto”, ubicado en el Jr. Loreto Nº 241, distrito D. Callería, provincia D. Coronel Portillo, departamento D. Ucayali. Tiene 59 años D. edad, es madre D. 6 hijos mayores D. edad, es casada y su esposo trabaja como profesor D. Educación Secundaria. 

Con el primer préstamo que recibió D. Manuela Ramos D. S/. 300 deciD. invertir en la venta D. ropa. Tiene 7 años trabajando con el banco comunal.

En la actualidad cuenta con una motokar como herramienta D. trabajo. Se dedica a su hogar y a la administración D. su movilidad.

Con este préstamo D. S/ 1,100, el cual será pagado en 5 meses, comprará 2 llantas, focos, etc., también arreglará el motor y tapizará los asientos. 

Rosa se siente contenta por el apoyo que le brinda el banco comunal y agradece a Dios por permitirle estar un día más con su familia.
texts.en:
Rosa belongs to the cooperative bank “Loreto”, located on Loreto Street in the Callería district of Ucayali. She is 59 years old and the mother of six grown children. She is married, and her husband works as a secondary school teacher. With the first loan of 300.00 Peruvian soles that she received from Manuela Ramos, she invested in clothing sales. She has been working with the cooperative bank for seven years. Currently, she uses a motocar as her tool of traD.. She dedicates herself to tending to her home, and to administering her transportation business. With this loan of 1,100.00 Peruvian soles, which she will repay in five months, she will purchase tires, headlights, etc., and will also make repairs to the engine and upholster the seats. Rosa feels very content for having the support of the cooperative bank, and gives thanks to God for allowing her to spend another day with her family.

Translated from Spanish by Mary Lynn Malaby, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase two tires, headlights, etc., and also to make engine repairs and upholster the seats of her motocar.

loans.name: Cicilia

texts.en:
Cicilia P. sells bread and tea at a restaurant and is requesting a loan to expand her business. Cicilia is 34 years old and is married. Her husband is a businessman. They have five children, all of whom attend school. With the extra profits from her loan, she hopes to build a small shop.

BRAC's holistic approach to poverty alleviation and empowerment of the poor encompasses a range of core programs in economic and social development; health; education; and human rights and legal services which are delivered through an extensive network of village organizations. BRAC has become one of the world's largest NGOs as measured by the scale and diversity of its interventions.  In 2007, BRAC started operations in southern Sudan. The microfinance program, which is targeted towards returning war refugees, has already formed 418 village organizations with more than 14,000 women members.

loans.use: To build a small shop

loans.name: Oscar Augusto

texts.es: El señor Oscar Agusto M. tiene la edad de 40 años, habita en La Concepción , junto a su esposa la cual trabaja como conserje en una casa privada , para ayudarle con los gastos del hogar . Los planes hacia su familia es mejorar las condiciones de vida ya que con sus propios esfuerzos han logrado establecer piña. Desde hace 10 años se dedica a cultivar sus tierras la mayor dificultad que se le presenta es la falta de financiamiento. Lo cual espera con este crédito poder comprar fertilizantes, para mejorar los cultivos y poder vender a buen precio en el M. la cosecha.
texts.en:
Mr. Oscar Agusto M. is 40 years old and lives in La Concepción with his wife, who works as a caretaker in a private household in order to help him with household expenses. They plan to improve their living conditions and they have started to grow pineapple with their own efforts. For 10 years he has been cultivating his land, and finances are the largest hardship. He hopes to buy fertilizar with this loan, in order to improve his crops and to be able to sell at good prices in the market when the harvest comes.

Translated from Spanish by Caitlin Brooks, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy feritlizers to improve production

loans.name: Tarcila

texts.en:
Tarcila U., 60, married and blessed with two children, is living in Tumpagon, Cagayan de Oro City Southern Philippines. One of her children is in 4th year high school. Every day, she works hard to support the needs of her family. She was engaged in running a variety store (sari-sari store) but unfortunately, it failed.

Tarcila didn't lose hope. She attended one of the seminars regarding basic business management conducted by HSPFI. Having that knowledge, she wants to start a new store and needs the loan amount of PHP 11,000 to purchase grocery items to open up her store. Tarcila thanks you for funding her new store.

loans.use: to purchase grocery items for her store

location.town: Tumpagon, Cagayan de Oro, Misamis Oriental

loans.name: Nguyen Thi

texts.vi: Chị Nguyễn Thị Sỹ, 50 tuổi ở Quảng Xương, Thanh Hóa, làm nghề dệt chiếu. Gia đình chị có hai con đều đã lớn và đã đi làm, chồng chị là thợ sửa xe máy. Chị tham gia Quỹ từ năm 2005, với việc làm ăn hiệu quả kinh tế gia đình chị đang ngày càng ổn định hơn. Hiện nay, thu nhập trung bình của gia đình chị là 175.000/ngày. Vòng vốn tới chị mong muốn được vay thêm 8.000.000 để đầu tư mở rộng cửa hàng sửa chữa xe máy của chồng.
texts.en:
Mrs. Nguyen Thi Si, 50 years old, lives in Quang Xuong, Thanh Hoa. She weaves sleeping mats. She has two grown-up children who are working. Her husband repairs motorcycles. She joined TYM Fund in 2005, and with the effective use of loans, the economic condition of the family has been improved. Currently, the average income of the family is VND 175,000 per day.

In this loan cycle, she wishes to borrow VND8,000,000 to expand the motorcycle repair workshop.

Translated from Vietnamese by Tu Duong, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: expand the motorcycle repair workshop.

loans.name: Medcilyne

texts.en:
Medcilyne G. is a 36-year-old mother of seven. Her husband Manuel is a carpenter. They live in the beautiful town of Bugasong, Antique, on the island of Panay. The town is located in the central part of a sea-horse-shaped province on the Philippine map. The common livelihood is farming and fishing, however, due to scarcity of capital, Medcilyne's husband does not farm or fish; he chooses to do carpentry, for this job does not require capitalization. 

Before she joined ASHI (Ahon Sa Hirap, Inc.) she bought and re-sold whatever goods she could just to have an income, on irregular days of the week. She applied for this loan to get capital to buy one pig for fattening, to buy 10 chickens to raise, and buy assorted ingredients to start up food vending. She will utilize the loan properly so as to get another loan in the future to expand her business and to increase her income for the education of her children who are now going to finish their secondary school. She dreams of earning more confidence in venturing into a bigger business that ASHI and KIVA will support in fulfilling her dreams.

loans.use: To buy one piglet, 10 chickens, and ingedients for food vending

loans.name: Marguba

texts.en:
Marguba is a lovely 32-year-old woman who lives with her two children. She runs a small fabric-selling business at the local market, where she offers a variety of fabrics for different tastes and ages. Marguba is asking for a loan to buy more goods. The extra capital will enable her to expand her merchandise, thus improve her business and increase her profits. She dreams of having her own large store someday; but, most importantly, she envisages a better future for her children, one where they can continue to study at the university, become professionals, and lead healthy and comfortable lives. Marguba thanks you for your support!

More about Tajikistan and IMON International

Tajikistan is known for its rich history, which includes a key post along the Silk Road and the end of Alexander the Great's rule. It has also produced great thinkers, philosophers, scientists and poets, including Rudaki, Avicenna, Ferdowsi, Omar Khayyam, Jomi, and Rumi. The country is home to communities that still speak the ancient Sogdian language, epic mountain passes, and a civilization that dates back to the 4th millennium BC. And, even today, it is a complex mixture of the Islamic faith, Soviet culture, New West culture and Central Asian traditions.
But Tajikistan is also the poorest of the former Soviet republics. The civil war, which ignited soon after its independence from the U.S.S.R., further damaged the already weak economy. In addition, 93% of the country is mountainous and only 7% of the land is arable. These conditions have resulted in high levels of unemployment and have forced hundreds of thousands to seek work in other countries, mainly Russia. While the people of Tajikistan are working to improve its agricultural production and manufacturing sector, nearly two-thirds of the population still live in abject poverty.

IMON's History

Since December 2007, IMON International has worked closely with Kiva and Kiva lenders to ensure that poor and low income clients represent a viable business proposition. Funds raised through Kiva have already been distributed to thousands of IMON International's clients and will continue to provide thousands more with permanent access to the varied financial services they need. To learn more about IMON International's work, please visit: www.imon.tj

loans.use: Purchasing new fabrics for increasing range of goods

loans.name: Judith Del Carmen

texts.es: Judith Del Carmen P. T. vive en Ahuachapán, El trabajo y perseverancia de Judith  la han hecho triunfar en su negocio empezó con un inventario muy pequeño de venta de pollo y tras 10 años de estar dedicándose al mismo negocio ahora es muy conocida en mercado por sus fieles clientes que la prefieren por sus precios y amabilidad, pero Judith no deja sus sueños y es por ello que solicita un crédito quiere comprar más pollos para incrementar su inventario al igual que su ventas.
texts.en:
Judith Del Carmen P. T. lives in Ahuachapán. Judith’s work and perseverance has made her succeed in her business, which she began with a small inventory in the sale of chickens. She has dedicated herself to this business for the past 10 years and now is well known in the market by her loyal clients who prefer her prices and her kindness. Judith has not abandoned her dreams and because of that she is requesting a credit to purchase more chickens to increase her inventory and her sales.

Translated from Spanish by Mariela Cedeno, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase chickens for her business.

loans.name: Yolita

texts.es:
YOLITA A. D. T., pertenece al Banco Comunal “LAS GEMAS II”, con domicilio ubicado en el Asentamiento Humano LAS MERCEDES Mz.6. Lt.9, D. la ciudad D. Pucallpa, tiene 44 años D. edad,. Se dedica a la costura, tiene 5 hijos, dos D. ellos menores.  Su esposo se dedica a la fabricación D. botes.

             Ella tiene casi dos años en Manuela Ramos y el primer préstamo que obtuvo fue D. S/ 300 Nuevos Soles, lo utilizó para el mantenimiento D. su máquina D. coser y poder seguir desarrollando su pequeño negocio. 

           Actualmente, continua con la costura y con el préstamo D. S/ 1,000. Nuevos Soles, comprará materiales para confeccionar y diseñar todo tipo D. ropa, sabanas (telas, hilos, etc.).

           Se encuentra agradecida con Manuela Ramos, porque nunca alguna entidad financiera le otorgó un crédito; mientras que Manuela Ramos sin tanto papeleo,  confió en ella y la motiva a ser responsable en sus pagos.
texts.en:
YOLITA A. D. T., a client of the Community Bank “LAS GEMAS II”, lives in the Las Mercedes Mz. 6 Lt.9 neighborhood in the city of Pucallpa. She is 44 years old, and devotes herself to sewing. She has 5 children, two of whom are still minors. Her husband manufactures boats.

Yolita has been with Manuela Ramos for nearly two years, and the first loan she received was for S/ 300 Nuevos Soles. She used it to maintain her sewing machine and to continue to develop her small business.

Currently, Yolita continues sewing, and with a loan of S/ 1,000. Nuevos Soles, she will purchase material to design and complete all types of clothing, sheets (fabric, thread, etc.).

Yolita is grateful to Manuela Ramos, because no other financial institution every granted her credit; whereas Manuela Ramos, without a lot of red tape, trusted her, and this motivated her to be responsible in making her payments.

Translated from Spanish by Elizabeth Novesky, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase materials (fabric, thread) to manufacture clothing.

loans.name: Manzura

texts.en:
E. Manzura is 47 years old and has raised three children. She has been raising cattle for three years, and the business income allows her to provide for the basic needs of her family. Her husband and children all take part in the farm work and help Manzura pour water and cut grass for the animals. Manzura has been delighted with the recent growth in her cattle farm and is enthusiastic about investing further. She is seeking a loan to buy more young cattle in order to expand her business and earn more.

More about Tajikistan and IMON International Tajikistan is perhaps best known for its rich history, which includes: its role as a key post along the Silk Road; the end of Alexander the Great's rule; and its famous great thinkers, philosophers, scientists and poets including Rudaki, Ibn Sina (Avicenna), Firdousi, Omar Haiyam, Jomi, Mavlavi Rumi and many others. The country is home to communities that still speak the ancient Sogdian language, epic mountain passes, and a civilization that dates back to the 4th millennium BC. Even today, it is a complex mixture of the Islamic faith, Soviet culture, New West culture and Central Asian traditions.

However, Tajikistan is also the poorest of the former Soviet republics. The civil war, which ignited soon after its independence from the U.S.S.R., further damaged the already weak economy. In addition, 93% of the country is mountainous, and only 7% of the land is arable. These conditions have resulted in high levels of unemployment, forcing hundreds of thousands to seek work in other countries, mainly Russia. While the people of Tajikistan are working to improve its agricultural production and manufacturing sector, nearly two-thirds of the population still live in abject poverty.

IMON's History

Since December 2007, IMON International has worked closely with Kiva and Kiva lenders to ensure that poor and low income clients represent a viable business proposition. Funds raised through Kiva have already been distributed to thousands of IMON International's clients and will continue to provide thousands more with permanent access to the varied financial services they need. To learn more about IMON International's work, please visit: www.imon.tj

loans.use: To purchasee young cattle to expand the business.

loans.name: Nellie

texts.en:
Nellie Y. is from the village of Kinangay Norte, Clarin, Misamis Occidental. She is 53 years old. Nellie is married and has four adult children. To make a living, Nellie owns & operates a business making & selling food. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from selling specialty food products in the local community. Nellie has been engaged in her business for over one year and earns approximately 1000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2005, Nellie joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Nellie has successfully repaid a previous loan from GDMPC. Nellie is requesting a new loan of 5000 PHP, which will be used to expand the business. This loan will be the second loan taken out by Nellie from GDMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family. 

About GDMPC:

GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines. It has four branches and three unit offices covering the provinces of Zamboanga del Sur, Lanao del Norte and Misamis Occidental. Its membership is composed mostly of farmers, fisher folks and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To expand her business

loans.name: Ngozi

texts.en: Ngozi sells cooked foods and drinks. She has been in this business since 2009. She is 38 years and married with 3 children. Ngozi lives in Lagos and she is requesting for the loan of N100,000 to purchase more drinks and foodstuffs to sell. She thanks you.

loans.use: To purchase of more foodstuffs and drinks

loans.name: Yoen

texts.en:
Mrs. Yoen S., 45, and her husband, Mr. Sun Sam, 47, were married in 1989 and have three children: one son who is a garment factory worker and two daughters. The family lives in a suburb of Phnom Penh.

Yoen has been a farmer for 30 years growing rice. Her husband raises cows at home and assists his wife in farming as well.

Yoen wants to build an addition on her house which will make it better for her family members to live in. So, she is requesting her first loan of $500 to use for this purpose.

loans.use: To build an addition on her house

loans.name: Ekoué

texts.fr: Cet homme n’est pas marié. Il a appris le métier de couture mais il n’a pas trouvé d’argent pour ouvrir sa boutique  et exercer son métier. C’est pour cela qu’il a décidé en 2007 de se lancer dans la vente de produits d’alimentation générale et d’autres produits. Il a ouvert sa boutique de vente dans la quartier Hédzranawoé à Lomé. Il sollicite alors un prêt de WAGES pour acheter des boîtes le lait, de tomates, de sardines, des savons pour peau et en poudre pour cuisines, et bien d’autres produits.
texts.en:
This man is not married. He learned to be a tailor but did not manage to find enough money to open a shop where he could work at his trade. For that reason he decided in 2007 to go into selling foodstuffs and such. He opened his shop in the Hédzranawoé district in Lomé. He is therefore asking WAGES for a loan to buy tins of milk, tomatoes, and sardines, handsoaps and powdered soap for the kitchen, and many other products.

Translated from French by Teresa Kramer, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: purchase of foodstuffs and various products for resale

loans.name: Nanette

texts.en:
Nanette L. is from the village of Mambajao, Camiguin. She is 27 years old. Nanette is married and has one school-aged child. To make a living, Nanette owns & operates a business providing multicab services for transporting passengers in the local community. Nanette has been engaged in her business for over 14 years and earns approximately 5000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2009, Nanette joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Nanette is requesting a new loan of 5000 PHP, which will be used to purchase materials needed to expand the services she provides. This loan will be the first loan taken out by Nanette from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand her business. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of the accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase materials needed to expand services

loans.name: Dedan

texts.en:
Dedan W. is 26 years old and has been selling secondhand clothes in Naivasha (about 50 miles northwest of Nairobi) for the last three years. He was introduced to KADET by his friend. This will be his second loan, and he plans to buy more secondhand clothes to sell. He paid off his first loan on time and used his profits to increase his stock.

Currently Dedan operates his business out in the open air, but in the future he plans to move to a more permanent place.

About KADET:

The Kenya Agency for the Development of Enterprise and Technology (KADET) is dedicated to economically empowering its clients by providing financial services to improve living conditions of micro-entrepreneurs and their children across Kenya. KADET is the microfinance subsidiary of World Vision Kenya. Obtain more information on KADET at: www.kadet.co.ke

loans.use: To buy more secondhand clothes to sell

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To expand her business.

loans.name: Mildred

texts.en:
Mildred A. runs a small-scale retail general store. She is married and the mother of 1 son and 2 daughters. She started her retail business in the year 2000. Before this, she says she was a practicing housewife. Her future dream is to buy a parcel of land and build a few rental houses. This, she says, would also go along way in proving that a woman can live her dream even in a male-dominated society.

Currently, her immediate dream is to expand her retail shop into wholesale, and that is why she needs this loan. Mildred says she requires a loan of Kshs. 40,000 to achieve this.

loans.use: Expand her retail shop

loans.name: Tamuyu Group

texts.en:
Here are the members of the Tamuyu group. They are small-scale businesspeople based in Makeni city. Business has been growing at a very slow pace for these entrepreneurs because they lack capital. That is why they have applied to SMT/Kiva for a loan of Le 500,000 to help expand their businesses.

Abdul K. (left) is the leader of this group. He was born in Makeni, is 29 years old and married to a  businesswoman. They have one child who is not yet of school age. Abdul makes a living selling items such as mints, biscuits, batteries, candles and soap. He has been a businessman since his childhood days.

loans.use: To buy additional supplies of soap, batteries, biscuits, and other items to sell at a busy location

loans.name: Diénaba

texts.fr: Diénaba BÂ est âgée de 37 ans, elle est mariée et mère de quatre enfants. Elle est propriétaire d'un restaurant qu'elle gère elle-même, son crédit lui permettra de mieux le développer et accroître ses revenus afin de pourvoir faire face aux besoins familiaux.
texts.en:
Diénaba Bâ, aged 37, is married and the mother of four children. She owns a restaurant which she runs by herself. This loan will enable her to further develop her restaurant and increase her income, which she will use to provide for her family.

Translated from French by Robert Mouris, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To strengthen the financial situation of her business

loans.name: Sosor

texts.en:
Sosor B. is 31 years old and lives with his wife in a house in Khovd province in western Mongolia. He operates a business making wooden products in his town with the help of his wife. B. designs and crafts all of the products and his wife paints and decorates them. He started his business in 2005 after learning how to make wooden products from his relatives. For most of the year, during the spring and summer, B. produces and sells his products. However, due to a lack of a proper working space, he purchases other people's products to sell during the colder months. B. has found success in his trade and his earnings have enabled him to expand his home. He is focused on the future and is always looking for ways to expand his business. This coming spring he hopes to start a new business and open a small grocery shop. He says, “I need to continue to grow and improve my businesses. ” He is requesting a 3,500,000 tugrug (~2,500 USD) loan to purchase wooden products to sell this winter. About XacBank: XacBank was founded in 2001, and listed its first loan on Kiva in January 2009. It is the largest microfinance organization in Mongolia, but also has mainstream commercial operations. XacBank has the vision, scale and innovation to develop and implement new solutions to poverty. It is currently utilizing Kiva’s 0% lending interest rate to return 9% of interest paid from borrowers to them in the form of a savings account at the end of their loans. This not only allows borrowers to gain financially, but also encourages them to save.
To get regular updates from XacBank, please join our lending team.
To lend to more Mongolian borrowers, please click here.

loans.use: To purchase wooden products to sell this winter

loans.name: Vicente Orlando

texts.es:
Vicente H. L. de 24 años de edad vive en casa de sus padres junto con su esposa y su hijo de meses de nacido en P.J. Nueva Esperanza – Ica.
El jóven tiene una mototaxi que la dá en alquiler diariamente y tambien se dedica a la musica. De  jueves a domingos trabaja en diferentes restaurantes y los demás días apoya a su esposa en su negocio de ambientadores y loceria.
El negocio queda ubicado en el mercado Modelo – Cercado de Ica.
Ellos gozan de buenas referencias y desean el financiamiento para poder adquirir otro instrumento que le permitira mejorar su pequeño grupo musical y asi poder aprovechar estas fechas donde hay bastante promociones y fiestas.
texts.en:
Vicente H. L. is 24 years old and lives in his parents’ house together with his wife and his newborn son; they live in P.J. Nueva Esperanza, Ica. The young man has a moto-taxi that he rents daily; he is also a musician. From Thursday to Sunday, he works in different restaurants and the rest of the days he supports his wife in her business of air fresheners and china sets. The business is located in the Modelo market, in Cercado de Ica. They have good references and want the loan to buy another musical instrument that would allow him to improve his musical group and take advantage of the holiday season when there are plenty of events and parties.

Translated from Spanish by Carlos Morales, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Invest in musical instrument for Christmas Season

loans.name: Georgette

texts.fr: D. Georgette est née en 1954 à Cotonou, capitale économique du Bénin. Il y a près de 32 ans que Georgette vit à Sodjèatinmè à Cotonou. C’est une veuve, ayant à sa charge six enfants, dont quatre sont ses propres enfants. Tous les enfants de Georgette sont scolarisés. Georgette vit seule avec ses enfants et supporte seule les charges de la famille. Georgette n’a fréquenté que l’école primaire. Georgette vend du pétrole, des pièces de rechange à son domicile. C’est à Dantokpa, marché international du Bénin, que Georgette s’approvisionne. Georgette a déjà obtenu trois crédits auprès de ALIDé, crédits qui ont été bien remboursés. L'activité de Georgette lui génère de revenus et lui permet de faire face aux charges de sa famille. Mais faute de moyens financiers pour s’approvisionner à temps afin de répondre efficacement à la demande des clients, Georgette perd ses clients. C'est pourquoi Georgette sollicite un quatrième crédit pour renforcer son activité et garder sa clientèle.
texts.en:
Georgette D. was born in 1954 in Cotonou, the economic capital of Benin. Georgette has been living in the Sodjèatinmè area of Cotonou for the past 32 years. She is a widow, with six children under her care, of which four are her own. All of Georgette’s children are educated. Georgette lives alone with her children and is the sole provider for her family needs. Georgette has only attended primary school. Georgette sells petroleum gas and spare parts from her home. She gets her supplies from Dantokpa, Benin’s international marketplace. Georgette has already been granted three loans from ALIDé, all of which have been fully reimbursed. Georgette’s activity generates enough income to meet her household expenses. However she is losing customers, because lacking sufficient financial resources, she is unable to get supplies in time and respond efficiently to customer demands. For this reason, Georgette is requesting a fourth loan to reinforce her business and keep her customer base.

Translated from French by René McConnell, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy 25-liter jerrycans of petroleum gas

loans.name: Isidro

texts.es:
El señor Isidro C. se dedica a la actividad agropecuaria en el municipio de Somotillo donde a diario da lugar al trabajo de la crianza de animales como lo son las vacas para luego proceder a extraerle la leche cuando es el tiempo necesario y así comercializar este producto en el municipio donde él vive.
Él es padre de cuatro hijos en edades escolares por lo que debe de brindarles las condiciones para que ellos se desarrollen en sus estudios. El crédito lo está solicitando para la compra de 2 vaquillas para proceder a su crianza y así sacarles el máximo provecho a ambas.
texts.en:
Isidro C. is a cattleman in Somotillo. He works daily raising animals, such as dairy cows, in order to extract milk at the right time to sell in the town where he lives. He is the father of four, school-age, children for whom he must provide the proper conditions for their development in their studies. The loan will be used to buy two young heifers to raise in order to maximize both their value.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy two young heifers.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Purchase weaving materials

loans.name: Mariatu

texts.en:
Mariatu T. owns a beauty salon in the Wilberforce area of Freetown. She also operates a rental service in her shop. She rents out wedding gowns to intending brides. Mariatu is a 31-year-old married woman. She has two sons: the first is in secondary school and the last is in primary school. She has been in business for over 12 years. 

Mariatu has obtained three previous loans from LAPOSL. With her previous loans she expanded her business by purchasing more beauty products like shampoos, cosmetics, weavons, conditioners, attachments and some styling products. As a result, her business has increased in size. With this loan she will open a shop in another area. One day, she hopes to realise her dream of having a business network all over Freetown.

loans.use: To purchase cosmetics, shampoos, conditioners, weavons, attachments and styling products

loans.name: Armando

texts.es:
Don Armando, tiene 48 años, se caracteriza por ser un hombre emprendedor y justo. Junto a él esta su esposa Esperanza de 47 años, con quien tiene 4 hijos y solo dos ellos, lo menores, viven en su domicilio propio. Dedicado a la agricultura desde hace 30 años y gracias al esfuerzo y dedicación de esta actividad es que ha logrado que sus hijos mayores sean ahora unos profesionales. Paralelamente a este trabajo, se dedica al transporte interprovincial, debido a que cuenta con dos vehículos, por el que  lleva 15 años en esta actividad, siendo la administradora, su hija mayor. 
En tanto, lo trabajos agrícolas, tiene el apoyo de operarios, que vigilan y cuidan el desarrollo y producción de sus cultivos. Mientras que su esposa de dedica al preparado diario de la comida, llevando luego el almuerzo a las chacras. Lo que más le gusta de su trabajo, es sembrar maíz y alfalfa por los verdes que se mantienen hasta el momento de su cosecha, además que le es rentable, por lo que pudo comprar sus vehículos, generándole  buenas utilidades adicionales, a la venta de producción de maíz y verduras, en el mercado central de su ciudad. En el futuro desea emprender una pequeña empresa de transporte interprovincial, ya que sabe que mas adelante no podrá continuar en la agricultura. Este es su décimo crédito con MFP, además se siente orgulloso de continuar trabajando con los integrantes de su grupo comunal, que son personas muy solidarias, unidos y sobretodo responsables. En tanto solicita, mil quinientos nuevos soles para comprar una lata de semilla de alfalfa, además pagar a un operario más, que le ayude a preparar el terreno y comprar también sacos de abono.
texts.en:
Armando is 48 years old. He is known for being an entrepreneurial and fair man. Alongside him is his wife Esperanza who is 47 and with whom he has four children. Only two of them, the youngest ones, live in his home. He has been dedicated to farming for thirty years and thanks to effort and dedication to this activity he has achieved that his older children are now professionals. Parallel to this work, he is dedicated to interprovincial transportation since he has two vehicles. He has 15 years experience with this activity. The manager is his eldest daughter.
