Meanwhile, the farming work is performed by operators who watch over and take care of the development and production of their crops. His wife is dedicated to the daily preparation of food then she brings lunch to the farms. What he likes most about his work is to sow maize and alfalfa greens which he takes care of until harvest time. It is also profitable so he could buy their vehicles, generating good additional income from the sale of maize and produce in the central market of their city. In the future, he wishes to start a small interprovincial transportation company since he knows that, in the future, he won't be able to continue farming. This is his tenth loan with MFP. Additionally, he feels proud to continue working with the members of his community group who are very cooperative people, united and above all responsible. In all, he has requested 1,500 soles to buy a can of alfalfa seeds and pay for one more operator who can help prepare the earth and buy bags of fertilizer.

Translated from Spanish by Kate Divjak, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy alfalfa seeds, fertilizer and hire more farm hands to help with sowing.

loans.name: El Eden 3 Group

texts.en:
Ana is the coordinator of her group El Eden (Eden), and her story is representative of her group and of Esperanza's Haitian and Dominican clients generally (many of whom recently emigrated to the DR from Haiti). Her group is located in the rural areas surrounding Hato Mayor, an area where the economy is centered around agriculture and where running water (none of which is potable) and electricity are unreliable. She makes her home here in a simple structure as a single mother with her three children.

Ana is excited to be taking her third loan with Esperanza after having successfully repaid her previous loan and grown her business. She plans to use this loan to invest in her business selling jewelry by purchasing a large quantity of silver from which to make her jewelry. She will use the profits to invest in her children by purchasing school supplies for them and investing in her home by finishing the construction (which will include a small area to house her shop). She thanks you all for your support.

loans.use: To purchase silver

loans.name: Baasanhuu

texts.en:
Baasanhuu, age 46, operates a clothing and consumer goods trading business in his town. He started out by manufacturing winter hats to sell, and since 2000 his business has expanded to include variety of clothing and accessories including hats, scarves, and sunglasses. He sells these to his many customers at a rental counter at the local market. He has gained much experience over the years and has been planning to further expand his business. Baasanhuu is focused on the future and says, “My dream is one day to open my own trading center.” 

He is requesting a 1,000,000 tugrug loan to purchase a large assortment of hats, scarves, and sunglasses for summer, spring and autumn in Ereen, a Chinese border town. He will resell these for a profit at market.			

Baasanhuu lives with his mother in Zavhan province in a "ger," the traditional Mongolian nomadic tent dwelling. His mother operates a vegetable trading business on her own plot of land.

loans.use: To purchase inventory

loans.name: Laila

texts.en:
Laila S. is a 45-year-old Palestinian woman from Ramallah. She owns a clothing and accessories store in Ramallah, where she sells women's wear and accessories. The store is well known in the neighborhood and has its own clientele.

Laila took a $3000 loan from FATEN to start selling a different type of goods in her store in addition to the women wear and accessories. Laila wants to add toys and dolls for children, as well as children's wear, to her store. She believes this will increase demand for what she sells and yield a better income.

Laila stands in her store in the photo above.

loans.use: Add new goods to women's clothing store

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to purchase livestock feed & other supplies

loans.name: José Luis

texts.es:
José Luis es un padre de familia de 25 años de edad que vive junto a su esposa y a su hijo en casa de sus padres ubicada en el sector Santa Rosa Baja, una zona rural del distrito de Cayaltí, distrito agrícola que se encuentra ubicado a una hora de la ciudad de Chiclayo.

El cuenta con una mototaxi (vehículo motorizado consistente en una motocicleta que lleva anexada una cabina para transportar pasajeros y carga) con la que brinda servicio de transporte publico desde hace siete meses en el distrito de Cayaltí y en las zonas aledañas. Este negocio es su única fuente de ingresos y se vale de el para sustentar la economía de su familia.

El contínuo uso otorgado a su unidad móvil y el estado accidentado de los caminos de la zona han hecho que su vehículo empiece a sufrir algunas fallas que requieren de urgente reparación para garantizar su correcto funcionamiento, por ello ha solicitado por primera vez a Edpyme Alternativa un crédito de 500 nuevos soles.

José Luis es una persona trabajadora y con muchas ganas de superación, su mayor anhelo es poder construir su propia casa para vivir junto a su familia de un modo mas estable.
texts.en:
José Luis is a 25 year old father who lives with his wife and child in the house of his parents, which is located in the Santa Rosa Baja division, a rural area in the district of Cayaltí. This agricultural district is located an hour away from the city of Chiclayo.

José Luis owns a motorcycle taxi (a motorized vehicle that consists of a motorcycle and an attached cabin for transporting passengers and cargo). He has been providing public transportation services for six months in the distirct of Cayaltí and the surrounding areas. This business is his only source of income by which he supports his family financially.

The continued use of his vehicle combined with the ragged state of the local roads has caused defects in his vehicle that require urgent repairs. To ensure that his vehicle functions properly, he is requesting his first loan from Edpyme Alternativa in the amount of 500 PEN.

José Luis is a hardworking person who has tremendous desire to succeed. His greatest wish is to build his own house so that he and his family can live together in a more stable environment.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Vehicle repairs & maintenance

loans.name: Carmen Rosa

texts.es:
Carmen Rosa es socia del bancomunal Ccori Soncco, tiene 27 años, es casada y madre de 2 hijos, la mayor tiene 3 años y la segunda es pequeñita tiene 2 semanas de nacida.
Carmen Rosa tiene una tienda donde vende productos para regalos como son peluches, relojes, cuadros, porta fotos, globos y flores.
La dificultad que tuvo fue cuando comenzó su negocio los 2 primeros meses no tenia mucha venta, pero ella fue persistente  y desde el tercer mes empezó a vender más. el prestamo que solicita lo utilizará en la compra de productos para su tienda.
Carmen Rosa menciona que desde que esta en FINCA ella es más puntual y mas organizada en sus quehaceres. su sueño es poder construir su casa y tener un local propio para poder vender y así obtener mas ganancias.
texts.en:
Carmen Rosa is a member of the communal bank "Ccori Soncco" [which means "Heart of Gold" in Quechua]. She is 27 years old, married, and the mother of two children. Her older daughter is 3 years old and the second is very young, born just two weeks ago. Carmen Rosa has a business where she sells gift items like stuffed animals, watches, pictures, photo frames, balloons, and flowers. She had some difficulty when she started her business, as she did not make many sales in the first two months. However, she was persistent and since the third month she has started to sell more. The loan she is requesting will be used to purchase products for her store. Carmen Rosa mentioned that since she joined FINCA, she is more punctual and organized with her tasks. Her dream is to be able to build herself a house and to have her own store to sell from, and to thereby increase her income.

Translated from Spanish by Katie Kavanagh, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy products to sell at her gift store

loans.name: Mrs. Oeun Bun Village Bank Group

texts.en:
Seventeen people who live in Slab Ta Aon village in Kandal province make up this village bank loan. Mrs. Oeun B., 60 years old, is village bank president.

She is a vegetable seller and her husband, Mr. Bech Hem, is a construction worker who also earns a small salary to support the family. They have one daughter who is a seamstress in a garment factory.

Since her business is going well she wants to expand. So Mrs. Oeun B. is asking for a loan to buy more vegetables to resell.

loans.use: To buy more vegetables to sell.

loans.name: Concordio

texts.en:
Concordio T. is from the village of Iniawon, Kadingilan, Bukidnon. He is 48 years old. Concordio is married and has eight adult children. To make a living, Concordio raises livestock. The main source of income for his business comes primarily from raising pigs for sale. Concordio has been engaged in his business for more than 20 years and earns approximately 8000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2009, Concordio joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve his living situation and his ability to engage in business activities. Concordio has successfully repaid a previous loan of 7000 PHP from HSPFI. This previous loan was used to purchase baby livestock to raise and sell in the future. Concordio is requesting a new loan of 8000 PHP, which will be used to purchase additional animals. This loan will be the third loan taken out by Concordio from HSPFI. He plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand his business. 

About HSPFI:
HSPFI is one of the accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional animals

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: expanding store inventory

loans.name: Basilia

texts.en:
Basilia G., a 57 year old married woman, supports her family by operating 3 business ventures: fruit vending, pig fattening and carpentry. She lives in Manan-ao, Barangay Ticad, Bantayan, Cebu City. She has been a member of NWTF-Project Dungganon since 2000 and has improved her living conditions with the help of her loans from NWTF and through her own efforts. By working hard in her fruit vending, pig fattening and carpentry businesses, she is gradually making her family more economically stable. She now earns an average monthly income of PHP 5000. Basilia is now borrowing PHP 17000 so that she can purchase more stocks to sell. This will be her 12th loan from NWTF-Project Dungganon. Her previous loan of PHP 14000, which she paid off well within its term, was just another step in her journey toward economic freedom. Basilia aspires to elevate her family's living conditions and to ensure their future well-being by following the Dungganon way. 

About NWTF: In a world full of challenges, Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation (NWTF), is making a difference in the lives of thousands of women through Project Dungganon (a Hiligaynon word that means Honorable). Through the alleviation program, NWTF is empowering these women to progress from earning less than $1 a day to achieving realities that surpass even their dreams. They have taken a life path that will ultimately make them Dungganon - a title of esteem that is bestowed to a member of a community who has earned the respect through a lifetime of hard and honest work. Help NWTF continue its mission to help the poorest in the Philippines by clicking the link to the NWTF Kiva lending team on Kiva.org to join our team.

loans.use: Purchase of more stocks to sell.

loans.name: Claudia Maria

texts.es: Claudia Maria desde hace 8 años, que se dedica es la venta de ropa. Ella tiene 2  hijos menores de edad a su cargo. Por lo que siempre busca la forma de mejorar sus ingresos, ella es una mujer muy responsable, lo que hace la diferencia es que siempre está al pendiente con sus clientes le solicitan. Ella solicita un nuevo crédito para comprar ropa interior, pantalones, camisas, faldas y trajes. Lo que más le gusta de su negocio es que tiene la posibilidad de interactuar con sus clientes.
texts.en:
Claudia Maria has been selling clothes for a living for the past 8 years. She has two young children for whom she is responsible. This is why she always looks for a way to improve her income. She is a very responsible woman and what makes the difference is that she is always waiting for her customers’ requests. She is requesting a new loan to purchase underwear, pants, shirts, skirts, and suits. What she likes most about her business is that it gives her the opportunity to interact with her customers.

Translated from Spanish by Kathleen O'Connell, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Working capital

loans.name: Soknak

texts.en: Mrs. Soknak N. is a widow with two sons and a daughter. She lives on an island in the Mekong River, about fifteen kilometers from Phnom Penh City. Mrs. Soknak N. is a silk weaver. She also buys silk products from weavers in her village and transports them to sell in another province far from her house. She is asking for a loan of $800 to continue her business by purchasing silk and cotton fabrics to sell and to replace an old untrustworthy motorbike.

loans.use: To purchase cotton and silk fabrics and to purchase a motorbike

loans.name: Marivic

texts.en:
Marivic R. is from the village of Villa Felipa, Gingoog City. She is 45 years old. Marivic is married and has 5 adult children. To make a living, Marivic owns & operates a specialized retail store. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes from buying and selling bananas in the local community. Marivic has been engaged in her business for over 5 years and earns approximately 3000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2005, Marivic joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Marivic has successfully repaid a previous loan of 5000 PHP from HSPFI. This previous loan was used to to purchase additional bananas to sell. Marivic is requesting a new loan of 6000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional inventory and as working capital. This will be the 2nd loan taken out by Marivic from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand her business. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is an accredited partner of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and reaches out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase additional inventory and as working capital

location.town: Villa Felipa, Gingoog City, Misamis Oriental

loans.name: Santisima Trinidad Group

texts.es: Este grupo se llama SANTISIMA TRINIDAD se encuentra ubicado en Puebla México. El grupo está conformado  por 11 personas. La foto fue tomada en la casa de la Sra. María M. D. integrante del grupo. En la foto podemos observar un triciclo, medio de desplazamiento que utiliza para la venta de su nieve o helado. Ella tiene 36 años de edad, no estudió y se dedica a la elaboración y venta de nieve. En total tiene 3 hijos varones. Lleva 18 años dedicándose a la venta de nieve. Solicita el préstamo para invertir en las materias primas que ocupa, así como en la fruta de temporada, sus clientes la prefieren porque su elaboración de nieve o helado es  100% natural. Al momento de solicitar este crédito se siente muy contenta al igual que sus clientes que son los niños. También espera vender en otras comunidades cercanas.
texts.en: This group is named Santisima Trinidad (Holy Trinity) and is located in Puebla, Mexico.  This group is made up of 11 persons.  The picture was taken in the home of Mrs. María M. D., a member of the group.  We can see in the photograph the three wheeled vehicle that she uses in the sale of shaved ice and ice cream.  She is 36 years old, has not gone to school and makes a living producing and selling shaved ice.  She has 3 sons.  She has been in the sale of shaved ice for 18 years.  She is requesting a loan to invest in raw materials, such as seasonal fruit.  Her customers favor her because her ices and ice creams are 100% natural.  At the time of the loan request she is feeling very happy as do her customers who are children.  She also plans to sell in other nearby communities.

loans.use: To invest in the business.

loans.name: Paul

texts.en: Paul is a 35-year-old married man with four children living in their own house in Fort Portal, Uganda. His family dream is to educate his children and improve his household income. He is a special hire driver. For the last six years, he has been able to buy land. Paul is faced with the challenge of fluctuating fuel prices but this hasn’t stopped him from hoping for the best. This being the season of grasshoppers when many people make some good income, Paul intends to use the credit facility to buy lights and iron sheets for catching grasshoppers to sell.

loans.use: To buy lights and iron sheets to catch grasshoppers to sell

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: Purchase of fertilizer and labor

loans.name: Pascal Nzioki

texts.en:
Pascal, age 38, is married and together he and his wife have four children, between the ages of five and eight years old. He owns and runs a retail shop where he sells cereals, detergent, flour, milk, and other foodstuffs. Pascal was introduced to Kadet by a friend who was already a member. Pascal has been running this business for 11 years .With this loan, he plans to add more stock to the shop and and also invest in livestock trading. 

With the proceeds of this loan, he intends to diversify his business and improve the lives of his family members.

loans.use: buy more stock for Kshs 20,000 and invest in livestock trading for Kshs 10,000

loans.name: Milka

texts.en: Milka is a 50-year-old married woman who is blessed with six children. She runs a cafeteria to earn a living. She has been operating the business for three years with four employees. She also depends on her husband for financial support. She has requested a loan of 40,000 KES  to buy cooking oil, a microwave, a television and a water dispenser.

loans.use: to buy cooking oil, a microwave, a television and a water dispenser

loans.name: Mirasol

texts.en:
Mirasol is from the town of Plaridel. She is 34 years old and married. To make a living, she owns and operates a fishing business, harvesting and selling ocean-caught fish in the local community. She has been engaged in her business for over two years and earns approximately $163 a month for these activities.

In 2008, Mirasol joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. She has successfully repaid a previous loan of 20,000 PHP from PMPC. This previous loan was used to purchase fishing equipment including hooks and nets. 

Mirasol is requesting a new loan of 30,000 PHP, which will be used to invest in expanding the business. This will be her 5th loan from PMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family. 

About PMPC:

Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC) is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to invest in expanding the business

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Increasing operating capital for his business

loans.name: Orlando Arturo

texts.es:
Orlando es un hombre dedicado, al trabajo, responsable, con el amor de apoyar siempre  a sus padres. Hoy en día,  labora en una empresa privada, laborando como supervisor de estudios económico, ya que lo han promovido, ya que anteriormente estaba en contabilidad,  logrando mantenerse fijo en la misma empresa.
Atreves de los prestamos en Afodenic ha logrado hacer mejoras  a su casa, lo que ha sido de beneficio para la familia, ha venido trabajando con la institución durante seis ciclos, en donde todos lo ha invertido en la vivienda. Con el crédito anterior cambio el techo, ahora con este nuevo préstamo comenzara un cuarto como segundo piso  elaborado de playsem, lo que comprara materiales como: láminas de zinc, perlines, golosos, soldadura, para comenzar, siendo posible gracias a  estos financiamientos.
texts.en: Orlando is a dedicated, responsible man with the love and support of his parents always.  Nowadays, he works in a private enterprise as the supervisor of economic studies, since they have promoted him.  Previously he was in accounting, managing to remain in the same business.  Because of the loans from Afodenic he has managed to make improvements to his house, which has been of benefit to the family.. He has been working with the institution during six loan cycles, investing them all in the dwelling.  With the previous loan he replaced the ceiling.  Now with this new loan he will began a room on the second story.  He will buy materials such as sheets of zinc, perlines, and solder to begin, which is possible thanks to this financing.

loans.use: Comprara materiales de construccion para hacer un cuarto de segundo piso.

loans.name: Juana Antonia

texts.en: Juana is married and has four children, one of which is currently in school. Juana went to school through primary before she began to work. She currently works in clothing production and has been in the business for three years. She is requesting a loan to increase her work capital so that she may increase her revenues. In time she hopes to develop her career and one day own her machines and run a larger, more successful business.

loans.use: Working capital

loans.name: Marleni

texts.es:
La socia pertenece al banco comunal” SEÑOR DE LOS MILAGROS DE CHIMPAHUAYLLA”; El banco está ubicado en el distrito de San Jerónimo,  perteneciente a la provincia de Cusco y departamento de Cusco.

La socia es la Sra. Marleni; la socia tiene 42 años de edad, casada y tiene 4 hijos; la socia se dedica  al negocio de tienda de abarrotes ella vende productos de primera necesidad entre otros mas, a la vez la socia también se dedica a la venta de ladrillos y tejas materiales de construcción ella trabaja conjuntamente con su esposo, la socia está feliz ya que mediante estos negocios que ella tiene puede sacar a su familia adelante.

La socia solicita el préstamo para la compra de mercadería para su tienda de abarrotes arroz, azúcar, leche, huevos, golosinas, gaseosas entre otros más.

La socia está feliz por el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con los pagos de su cuota.
texts.en:
This member belongs to the "Señor de los Milagros de Chimpahuaylla" community bank, located in San Jerónimo district in the province and department of Cusco.

Marleni is 42 years old, married, and has four children. She runs a grocery store that sells basic goods and home products. She also sells bricks and produces construction materials together with her husband. Marleni is happy with her work because through her businesses she is able to take provide for her family.

She is requesting a loan to buy products for her grocery store, such as rice, sugar, milk, eggs, candy, and soda, among other things. Marleni is happy to have this loan opportunity and is committed to making her repayments on time.

loans.use: To purchase merchandise for grocery store, including rice, sugar, milk, eggs, candy, soda, etc.

loans.name: Chea

texts.en:
Chea B., age 49, is the mother of eight children, six of whom are single, while the other two are married and live independently. Her husband is a carpenter who works in their community building wooden houses.

Chea grows cashews on her farmland to raise money. She gets great results from her cashew plants almost every year and makes around 2 USD in profit each day. She is asking for a loan to hire a few domestic laborers to plow her land for her next cashew crop.

loans.use: To hire a few laborers to plow her land

loans.name: Mom

texts.en:
Mrs. Mom is a farmer who owns a .5-hectare plot of land where she grows rice. She sells part of the rice and with the rest of the rice she feeds her family. Her husband, Mr. Vanna, is a construction worker and he also sells traditional medicine. Although they try to work hard, they earn only a small income. 

To improve this situation, Mrs. Mom is applying for a loan to buy a cow for breeding to start a new business. She is the mother of three children, one of whom is employed in a garment factory, while the others are studying in a local public school.

loans.use: to buy a cow

loans.name: Nataliya

texts.en:
Nataliya is married with 2 sons. She lives in Uzhgorod, Western Ukraine. She sells sportswear and footwear in a local marketplace called ‘Krasnodontsiv’. Nataliya has a good vending facility and her own clientele. She has been running the business for 12 years. Presently, her net profit is over 4,300 Grivnyas a month.  

Nataliya boasts an impeccable reputation among her fellow market vendors. They all speak highly of her hard work, financial consciousness and persistence in business endeavors. Nataliya is requesting a loan of 10,000 Grivnyas to purchase spring/summer sportswear inventory and footwear. As temperatures go up in Ukraine and with summer just around the corner, Nataliya is hoping to re-stock her merchandise to be able to better serve her customers and meet their seasonal demand.

loans.use: to purchase seasonal clothing and footwear for retail

loans.name: Johnny Braulio

texts.es: El sr. Johnny  vive en la zona de barrio municipal tiene su esposa y tres hijos en edad escolar, el trabaja con su movilidad en la línea de taxi trufis que va en la ruta de  centro  a la zona sur y su esposa trabaja en una guardería de niños ambos bastante trabajadores son clientes antiguos de nuestra institución, necesita este crédito para la reparación del vehículo ya que es su medio subsistencia de la familia  y compra de llantas para el mismo razón por la que se solicita el financiamiento, el deseo del Sr. Johnny es el poder comprar un terreno para hacer construir su casita y así brindar mayor comodidad a su familia, el es una persona muy trabajadora agradecido con la institución por el apoyo brindado.
texts.en:
Johnny lives in the Barrio Municipal zone.  He has a wife and three school age children.  He works with his vehicle in a cooperative taxi route that goes from downtown to the southern zone.  His wife works at a children’s daycare center.  Both are quite hard working and longstanding clients of our institution.

He needs this loan to repair his vehicle since it’s his means to support his family and to buy tires for it; this is the reason behind the loan request.

Johnny’s wish is to be able to buy a piece of property to build his house and provide his family with more comfort.  He is a very hard working person who is grateful to the institution for the support provided.

loans.use: to repair his vehicle and to buy tires.

loans.name: Abdul A.'s Group

texts.en:
These are teachers of the Wandor Islamic Secondary School in Blama, near Kenema city. This school was founded in 1985 by the National Islamic Mission in Kenama to improve the educational standard of children in the community. This school is currently staffed with 13 teachers and has an enrollment of 510 pupils.

This is the first time that teachers of the Wandor Islamic Secondary School will benefit from SMT/Kiva lenders. They have requested a loan of SLL 6,500,000 to buy or invest in something that they cannot afford with their salaries.

Abdul A. is the leader of the group. He was born in the small town of Lunsar, in northern Sierra Leone. Abdul is 47 years old, married and has 2 children – 1 in primary school and 1 in secondary school. He has been a teacher for 22 years. He is going to use his share of the loan to buy house building materials such as cement, corrugated iron rods, etc.

loans.use: to buy house building materials such as cement, corrugated iron rods, etc.

loans.name: Lucila Giralda

texts.es:
Lucila Giralda tiene 53 años, Es soltera vive los hijos, vive en el Cantón Ventanas Provincia de los Ríos. 

Los miembros de la V.R.C. LA UNION se encuentra ubicada en el Recinto Aguas Frías de Medellín, perteneciente al Cantón Ventanas, esta ventanilla se dedica labores agrícolas de ciclo corto siembra de maíz, arroz, frejol gandul.

Lucila se dedica a la agricultura la siembra de maíz desde hace 15 años, las compras las realiza en Ventanas y las vende en las ferias de todos los días en especial  la de los domingos.

Solicita el crédito para la compra de semillas, fertilizantes y abonos.  Con el apoyo del crédito le ayudaría económicamente para suplir sus necesidades. Enfrentar desafíos es la competencia y la variación del clima. Su sueño es compara casa para la familia.

Le gusta cocinar.
texts.en:
Lucila Giralda is 53 years old, single and lives with her children in the Ventanas Canton, Los Rios Province.

The members of the V.R.C. "La Union" are located in the enclosure Aguas Frías de Medellín, which is part of the Ventanas Canton.  This group is involved in short rotation farming, and planting corn, rice, pigeon peas.

Lucila has been planting corn for 15 years.  Her purchases are made ​​in Ventanas and she sells in the markets every day, especially on Sundays.

She is requesting a loan to purchase seeds and fertilizers. This loan would help financially meet her needs.  Lucila faces challenges such as competition and climate change. Her dream is to buy a house for her family.  She also likes to cook.

loans.use: to buy seeds and fertilizers.

loans.name: Fatuma

texts.en:
Fatuma is a married woman with one child who attend school. She owns a house that has electricity but not piped water. Her greatest monthly expense is food for the family.

For the past five years, she has operated a natural fruit juice making business, selling from home to her neighbours and passersby. Fatuma also sells snacks  as her other source of income. She faces a major challenge of seasonality in her business. Her dream is to establish a restaurant business in the future.

With the Kshs 50,000 she wants to purchase a fridge, flavours for juice making and potatoes. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: To purchase a fridge, flavours for juice making, and potatoes.

loans.name: Narine

texts.en: Narine trades in clothing from a rented booth in the city market. Narine would like to increase the variety of clothing to meet her clients’ demands. With the requested loan, she plans to purchase more clothing to sale. Narine will increase her working capital and develop her business further. Additional income will help Narine to pay for her student son’s education. Narine lives together with her pensioner mother, husband and son.

loans.use: to buy more clothing to sell

loans.name: Rosa Aurentina

texts.es:
En Mejía localizada a unos pocos kilómetros de la ciudad de Portoviejo se reúnen cada quince días el Banco Comunal Las Divinas De Mejía. Ciudad de gente dedicada en gran parte a la agricultura y al cultivo y venta de cocos.

En este lugar conocimos a la señora Rosa, tiene 50 años de edad y mantiene una relación de unión libre de la cual tiene 6 hijos, todos son mayores de edad, el menor de ellos aun vive en su casa.  El marido es comerciante. Esta desde el inicio en el Banco Comunal y le gusta ya que gracias a los créditos ella puede ganarse algo propio.

Ella es una muy buena ama de casa, tiene una granja en la cual cría pollos, nos cuenta que por temporadas tiene hasta 200 pollos los mismos que cuando están grandes y con un peso adecuado los entrega a comerciantes en el mercado de la ciudad de Portoviejo y también en tiendas de su localidad. Ella empezó este negocio hace un año y  fue gracias a uno de los créditos que pudo construir su granja la cual le permite ganarse el sustento y así ayudar a su marido con los gastos del hogar.

Este crédito es para comprar pollos, alimentos y medicinas para que tengan un buen desarrollo. 

Sus sueños son tener buena salud y seguir adelante.
texts.en:
The town of Mejía is located a few kilometers away from the city of Portoviejo. It is here that the Communal Bank “Las Divinas de Mejía” meets every 15 days. Most of the people in this town engage in agriculture, growing and selling coconuts.

It is in this place that one can meet Sra. Rosa. She is 50 years old, in a common-law marriage, and has six grown children. The youngest one still lives at home. Her husband is a merchant. Rosa has been with the Communal Bank from the beginning. She enjoys being a member because the loans have allowed her to earn her own income.

Rosa is an excellent homemaker and has a poultry farm where she raises chickens. She says that in a given season she can have up to 200 chickens. When the birds are grown and have reached an adequate weight, she delivers them to merchants at the market in the city of Portoviejo and to stores in her area. Rosa began her business a year ago and thanks to one of her loans she was able to build her poultry farm so that she could generate an income and help her husband with the household expenses.

This loan will be used to buy chickens, feed, and medicines so that the birds will develop properly. Her dreams are to experience good health and to move forward.

loans.use: to purchase chickens, poultry feed, and medicines.

loans.name: Kory

texts.fr: L'emprunteur est un commerçant établi dans le marché central de sa localité ou il gère une boutique de vente de produits alimentaires et de consommation courante.Il est marié et père d'un enfant.Il s'occupe avec son commerce des dépenses d'alimentation, de santé, d'habillement, de consommation d'électricité de sa famille. La position de sa boutique, située au cœur du marché lui a permis d'attirer de plus en plus de clientèle et de faire des bénéfices consistants.Pour satisfaire la demande qui ne cesse d'augmenter, il sollicite un crédit de 500 000F afin d'augmenter son stock de marchandises.Ainsi, il compte acheter 20 sacs de riz, 05 barils d'huile, 50 caisses d sucre, 30 caisses de lait, 10 sacs d'aliment bétail et des produits divers. Les bénéfices générés par la vente de ces produits lui serviront à la prise en charge de sa petite famille. Il ambitionne d'ouvrir un magasin de vente de produits alimentaires .
texts.en:
This borrower is an established merchant at the central market in his town where he runs a shop selling grocery items and typical consumables. He is married and the father of one child. With his business, he covers the cost of food, health care, clothing, and electrical use for his family. His shop, located in the heart of the market, enables him to attract more and more customers and to make substantial profits. 

To satisfy the ever-increasing demand, he is requesting a loan of 500,000 francs to increase his stock of merchandise. Thus, he intends to buy 20 sacks of rice, 5 barrels of oil, 50 cases of sugar, 30 cases of milk, 10 sacks of animal feed, and various products. 

The profits generated by the sale of these goods will serve to support his small family. His ambition is to open a store for selling grocery items.

loans.use: to buy 20 sacks of rice, f barrels of oil, 50 cases of sugar, 30  cases of milk, 10 sacks of of animal feed, and various goods

loans.name: Leeya

texts.en: Leeya is a 49-year-old married woman with six children living in her own semi-permanent house in Fort Portal, Uganda. Her main dream is to construct a permanent house for her family and to educate her children to higher levels of learning. She operates a saloon, hires out chairs, provides catering services and is a farmer. She has a challenge of high operational costs involved in the other businesses and her dream is to specialize in farming. Leeya needs the loan to pay the laborers who are clearing land for the next season.

loans.use: To pay laborers to clear the land for the next season.

loans.name: Joseph

texts.en: Joseph is a budding 42-year-old businessman. He is married and blessed with four children between 10 and 20 years old. For the last 12 years, he has been selling motor vehicle spare parts to make a living. He wants in the next five years to have moved into a permanent premise.  His dream is to be importing spare parts. He is requesting a loan of 60,000 Kenya shillings to buy wipers, bolts, bearings and brake oil. Thanks to Faulu Kenya, he has been able to expand his business.

loans.use: to buy wipers, bolts, bearings and brake oil

loans.name: Florence

texts.en: Florence is a 50-year-old widow with five children who owns a house in Kasese, Uganda. Ever since her husband died, she has been solely taking care of her children and her desire is to see them employed or setting up income generating activities. She has been in the stationery business for 17 years in which she acquired capital from her late husband's pension. Her hardship is bad debtors and her vision is to set up at least two more stationery shops. Florence needs the loan facility to buy books, pens, papers, files, gift cards and success cards to sell.

loans.use: To buy books, pens, papers, files, gift cards and success cards to sell

loans.name: Bernard

texts.en:
Bernard is 42 years old, married, and has two children.  He earns a living from his taxi business.  He has operated the business for six years and has employed one person.  He is also employed as a tour guide.  He was previously employed as a driver.  

Bernard works hard in his business so as to provide for his children.  Since he joined Faulu Kenya, he has learnt how to save his money and manage his business.

Bernard hopes to open a tour company in the future.  He has requested 100,000 Kenya shillings to buy a car for his taxi business.

loans.use: To buy a car for taxi business.

loans.name: Edgar

texts.es: Edgar de 33 años, está casado con Reina, su esposa. Hace poco unió su vida frente a Dios y en unión familiar viven en su casa propia ubicada en la comunidad de Sanchirio (selva central peruana). Este increíble hombre, siente que su vida se lleno de mucha alegría y amor, pues ahora quiere formar una familia a base de trabajo y mucha dedicación. Y reflejo de ello son sus 4 años consagrándose a la noble labor de la agricultura, donde sus principales cultivos constan de; café y plátano, los que todas las madrugadas cuida, fertiliza y limpia, para posteriormente comercializarlos a los compradores que constantemente visitan la zona. Lo que más le gusta es cosechar plátanos, pues recibe ingresos constantemente. Edgar ya es conocido entre los intermediarios, por ello más adelante quiere comprar más terrenos agrícolas para sembrar en mayores cantidades y de esa manera generar más ingresos para educar y alimentar a sus futuros hijos. Él pertenece al banco comunal “Buenos Aires” y este es el cuarto crédito con MFP, donde se siente satisfecho del apoyo mutuo que recibe, porque gracias a ello puede trabajar con más tranquilidad. Además promete ser puntual con el pago de sus cuotas. Edgar de recibir su apoyo; invertirá el dinero solicitado en la compra de fertilizantes naturales y si el dinero le alcanza, contratará personal para que quite la maleza de su campo de cultivo. Ya que después de la cosecha creció considerablemente.
texts.en:
Edgar is 33 years old and married to his wife Reina. They recently joined their lives together before God and now live in their own home in the community of Sanchirio, which is in the central Peruvian jungle. This incredible man, whose life is full of great joy and love, now wants to start a family through work and great dedication. Reflecting this wish are the four years he has already dedicated himself to farming. His main crops consist of coffee and bananas. Every morning, Edgar cares for, fertilizes, and clears his land so that he can sell to the buyers who frequently visit the area. What he enjoys most is harvesting bananas because they generate a steady income. Edgar is already known among the brokers. In the future, he wants to buy more farmland so that he can plant in larger quantities, thus allowing him to generate more income so that he can educate and feed his future children.

Edgar is a member of the Communal Bank “Buenos Aires” and will be receiving his fourth loan from MFP. He is pleased with the mutual support he has received because it has enabled him to work with a greater peace of mind. In addition, he promises to be punctual with his loan payments. With the support he received, Edgar will invest the money he requested in the purchase of natural fertilizers. If there is money left over, he will hire workers to remove the weeds from the fields. Afterwards, his crops should grow considerably.

loans.use: to hire workers and to buy sacks of fertilizers.

loans.name: Cecilia

texts.es:
La señora Cecilia es madre soltera, con una instrucción de nivel primaria, tiene un hijo de 5 años de edad dependiente, viven con su hermana, casa propia en Colomi calle Barrientos entre Aroma más de 4 años.
La señora costura ropa deportiva (chamarras, buzos, poleras y schords) en el mismo domicilio entrega a las unidades educativas como también a los mercados de Colomi y de la ciudad de Cochabamba a la vez cuenta con una actividad curtido de cuero (curtimbre), lo cual ella vino a solicitar un crédito para comprar una maquina recta para corte de cuero así mejorar y sacar producto terminado (derivados de cuero).
texts.en:
Señora Cecilia is a single mother with a primary level education. She has one dependent, a son 5 years of age. They have lived with her sister who owns her own house in Colomi, Aroma for more than 4 years.

Señora Cecilia sews sportswear (jackets, sweatshirts, t-shirts and schords) in the same house. She sells the items to educaional institutions and at the Colomi and Cochabamba markets. She also has a tanning business (tannery) which is why she came to ask for a loan as she wants to buy a machine for cutting leather straight and so enhance and make a finished product (leather products).

loans.use: to buy a machine for cutting leather straight.

loans.name: Luis Alberto

texts.es: Luis Alberto se dedica a la producción artesanal, desde hace 9 años. Empezó este negocio debido a la familia pues con mucho sacrificio han logrado salir adelante con la actividad. El motivo del crédito es para la compra de barro, ladrillos, pagar transporte para llevar sus productos. Uno de sus desafíos ha sido el fuerte invierno que se ha presentado pues esto impide la comercialización de sus productos hasta sus clientes.
texts.en: Luis Alberto has been hand-making products for nine years.  He started this business through his family and, with a lot of sacrifice, he has been able to get ahead in this business.  He is requesting this loan to buy clay and bricks, and to pay to transport his products.  One of his challenges has been the harsh winter which has prevented him from selling his products to his customers.

loans.use: to buy clay and bricks, and to pay to transport his products

loans.name: Ishaka Group

texts.fr:
Anitha est une commerçante âgée de 34ans qui habite au Quartier Ngagara de la Mairie de Bujumbura. Elle vend des habits neufs pour enfants, femmes et vend aussi des souliers depuis 5ans. Elle a commence cette activité alors qu’elle avait un restaurant. Elle  a fait ses études jusqu’en 9e année secondaire. Elle est mariée a Eddy et ont ensemble 4 enfants qui étudient. 
Le crédit Kiva de 340,000 francs burundais qu’elle obtient lui permet d’augmenter son capital pour acheter beaucoup d’habits neufs pour femmes et enfants ainsi que des souliers à revendre  et réaliser de grands bénéfices. 

Elle est membre  du groupe  communautaire« Ishaka»
texts.en:
Anitha is a 34-year-old retail merchant who lives in the Ngagara district of the Municipality of Bujumbura. She has been selling new clothing for children and women, and also selling shoes for the past five years. She started this business when she was running a restaurant.

She went to school up to grade 9. She is married to Eddie and all four of their children attend school.

The Kiva credit loan of 340,000 Burundi francs that was granted enables her to increase her capital. She will then buy many new clothes for women and children as well as shoes for resale, and make great profits.

She is a member of the "Ishaka" community group.

loans.use: increase her capital to buy many new clothes for women and children as well as shoes to resell and make great profits

loans.name: Khocharoy

texts.ru: Хочарой проживает в районе Яван. Ей 51 год. Она замужем. У них шестеро детей. Ее муж работает в дехканском хозяйстве. Сама Хочарой занимается выращиванием овощей и посевом пшеницы. Этим видом деятельности она занимается 11 лет. Кредит берет для посева пшеницы.
texts.en: Khocharoy lives in the Yavan district.  She is 51 years old, married and has six children.  Her husband works at a dekhan farm.  Khocharoy is involved in growing vegetables and planting wheat.  She has been in this business for 11 years.  She is requesting this loan to sow wheat.

loans.use: to sow wheat

loans.name: Alchynbay

texts.ru: Алчынбай  - 46 летний фермер. Основная деятельность Алчынбая – животноводство и полеводство.  В 2003 году, в поисках источника дохода для своей  семьи, Алчынбай  организовал  собственное хозяйство и начал заниматься разведением скота и полеводством, стартовав с суммой в 18,000 сом (KGS). На сегодняшний день, хозяйство Алчынбая приносит около 12,000 сом (KGS) ежемесячно.  Для дальнейшего развития своего бизнеса, Алчынбай обратился в компанию «Бай – Тушум и Партнеры» за кредитом в сумме 80,000 сом (KGS) на покупку дополнительной скотины. В будущем, Алчынбай планирует расширять поголовье скота.
texts.en: Alchynbay is a 46 year old farmer. The main activity of Alchynbay is livestock and arable farming. In 2003 in search of a source of income for his family Alchynbay organized his own farm having started with the sum of 18,000 soms (KGS) and began raising livestock and arable farming. Today his farm brings about 12,000 som (KGS) per month. For further development of his business Alchynbay has come to Bai Tushum & Partners for a loan in the amount of 80,000 KGS to buy more cattle. In the future Alchynbay plans to expand the headcount of cattle.

loans.use: to purchase cattle.

loans.name: Nora

texts.en:
Nora is 38 years old and married with three children.

Nora works hard to provide for her family. She runs a sari-sari store in the Philippines and has requested a PHP 30,000 loan through NWTF to buy items like shampoo and groceries to sell in her sari-sari store.

Nora has borrowed and paid back eight loans from NWTF before this loan.  She has been running the sari-sari store for three years and also earns an income from pig fattening and farming sugarcane.

Nora aspires to build and expand her business to sustain her family's needs.

loans.use: to buy items to sell in her sari-sari store.

loans.name: Paz

texts.en:
This is Paz.  She is 42 years old and a resident of Tanza, Cavite City in the Philippines.  She is married and the mother of three children.  Her husband, Joey, is her business partner. Together, she and her husband manage the household while operating the business.  At this time, she is working hard to continually provide income to meet her everyday expenses. 
 
Paz operates a junk shop.  Trash is not formally sorted in the Philippines and, while waiting for local dump trucks to collect the garbage, people scavenge trash bags and garbage dumps for recyclable materials like metal, copper, plastic and paper, which they sell to junk shops like Paz’s for a profit.  The junk shops then stack, clean and gather large quantities of these materials to sell to foundries, factories and others in need of these materials.  Her regular customers are her neighbors and the local community.  She earns a minimum of 500 PHP in sales every day.

To help her continue operating her business, she is requesting a loan of 22,000 PHP. She will augment her current revolving fund used to buy recyclable materials from collectors with the funds from the loan.  She expects an increase in her income as she expands her business.  

Paz hopes her business grows more in the coming years.  She faithfully meets with her co-fellowship members both to share stories of her work every week and to draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God she studies. 

* All CCT community partners and/or clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis.  A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners.  The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital and pay Micro Finance loans.

loans.use: to pay for scrap materials to sell in her junk shop.

loans.name: Danilo

texts.en:
Danilo is a married man with four children, living in the town of Talibon, Bohol. He sells firewood for a living. Danilo has been in this kind of business for quite some time now. He also tills a parcel of land where he grows rice. Danilo's harvest is for his family's consumption.

Danilo has requested this loan to purchase fertilizers and more firewood to sell. Danilo hopes his business will grow. He also hopes to acquire a bigger piece of land for farming.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizers and more firewood to sell.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: TO BUY A VARIETY OF SEASONAL FRUITS

loans.name: Sabah

texts.en:
This borrower is from Iraq. He is 57 years old, married and has three children.

Sabah is a carpenter; he has owned since 2006 a workshop where he makes and sells furniture. He has sufficient experience in this field, a good reputation and a deep understanding of local consumer needs. He is well-known in the surrounding areas.

He is requesting a $2,400 loan in order to purchase woodworking machinery. He is aiming to gain more profits to offer him the opportunity to provide a better life for his family as a whole.

loans.use: to purchase woodworking machinery.

loans.name: Adom Nsa Group

texts.en:
Kweku who is 56 years old is  married with  5 children. His youngest child is still in senior high school. Kweku lives with his family in Abrakrampa in the Central Region of Ghana. Kweku is the leader of Adom Nsa group.
The entire group members belong to a registered local farming association that facilitates marketing of their crops and farmers' capacity building.

Kweku cultivates oil palm and oranges plantations  for a living. He has been growing oranges for the past 20 years and oil palm 8 years.  Kweku also sells local gin as a side business. However his main source of income is from the farming activities. 

Kweku finds it very difficult to attract micro loan from local financial institutions to maintain his farms. He needs a loan of GHC1,000   to hire labourers for  pruning, weeding and harvesting.   The income from his farm will help him support his son through high school. Kweku also hopes to be able to build a small house for his family in five years if he can improve his income. He thanks all his micro-lenders for their support.

loans.use: to hire labourers for weeding, pruning and harvesting.

loans.name: Christina

texts.en:
Christina is a home based tailor. She is married and has 3 children, 2 of whom are attending school. Christina's business is the main source of income for the upkeep of her children and payment of school fees.

Christina manufactures curtains, seat covers and bed sheets. Raw materials are obtained from Harare and the products have a ready market locally and in the town of Mutare. She has been in the same business since 2012. Demand for her products has increased and she is unable to meet the gap in the market. She therefore needs to obtain working capital to invest in her business. With her loan, Christina intends to purchase raw materials such as threads, foam rubbers and clothing.

loans.use: To purchase raw materials for her tailoring business

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To improve on Stock

loans.name: Pedro Antoonio

texts.en:
Hello my name is Pedro Antonio and I work primarily in the detailing and sales of shoes for all ages. I have had my business for several years and it creates enough income to cover family expenses and other necessities. Thanks to this business I can give an education to my children, who help me in their spare time since it is currently the school year. I need more material because the demand for my products has increased.

Translated from Spanish by Kiva Volunteer, Kristin Connor

Hola mi Nmbre es Pedro Antonio, mi actividad principal es la elaboracion y venta de zapatos para todas la edades tengo varios años de dedicarme a este tipo de actividad la que me genera ingresos para cubrir los gastos de mi familia y otros compromisos. gracias a este negocio puedo dar educación a mis hijos, quienes me colaboran en su tiempo libre, actualmente que es la espoca escolar necesito mas material ya que el volumen de venta es mayor.

loans.use: To purchase leather in all colors: black, red, brown, yellow, Italian made, suede,shoe sizers.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Jane would like to buy a pig

loans.name: Mohira

texts.en: During the Soviet period, she was teaching Russian language and literature to Tajik children at school. But, her earned money from teaching was not enough to live. Eight years ago she started to trade in children's clothes. She brings goods from Istaravshan, which is located 150km away from Kanibadam and from neighboring Kokand city in Uzbekistan. A year ago, she got a $160 loan from Microinvest, which she spent on renewing her circulating assets. The assortment of her goods has improved and she has increased the number of her regular customers. The market in which she was trading before was moved to another place. That’s why she wants to expand her assortment, in order to attract customers in this new place as well, and also to equip her trading place. She needs $1000 for 12 months for this.

loans.use: To expand her assortment and to equip a trading place

loans.name: Hai

texts.en:
The 5 members of this family live with the grandmother (85 years old). The parents and their 4 children work is day laborers and the youngest daughter is in the 10th class. The mother has strum, a gland disease.

Thanks to their last loan, they earned $70 profit, and now their average income is $12.5 (previously $7.3). They want to have a new loan of $75 to invest in their green dragon fruit orchard and will pay it back in 5 months.

loans.use: Raise green dragon fruit

loans.name: Esther

texts.en: Mrs. Esther O. sells bread to people.  She solicits a loan of $250 to buy more bread for sale. She is married with 2 children, 40 years old, and lives in Benin City. She is a dedicated LAPO client and has been in this business since 2001.

loans.use: To buy more bread for sale

loans.name: Suzana

texts.en:
Hair, hair and more hair! Suzana can sell you long hair, short hair, curly hair, straight hair, red hair, blue hair and then attach it to your head and make it look like your own. She is a funky, young entrepreneur who needs a loan of TSH 1,000,000 to expand her business by purchasing new equipment and stock. Perhaps her eight year-old daughter Jospehine will follow her into the family business!

About SELFINA
SELFINA is engaged in economic empowerment of women in Tanzania through leasing and leaseback facility as a practical way to achieve economic and social emancipation of women.

SELFINA has taken a lead role as a pioneer of micro-credit in Tanzania through Micro Leasing. Customs and traditions in Tanzania normally make it difficult for women to own land and assets, thus termed not-creditworthy by financial institutions as they lack tangible collateral assets. This leads to poor financial support hence poor access to basic needs and services for women with low incomes.

SELFINA buys and leases equipment to women. Where a client needs working capital SELFINA buys equipments from the said client extending a loan to her and then leases back the same equipment – a process called "sale and leaseback" arrangement.

loans.use: To purchase additional equipment and stock for the salon.

loans.name: Ing

texts.en: Mrs. Ing S., 58, is the mother of six children and lives with her husband in Preyveng province, Cambodia. She works renting out wedding clothes, doing make-up, etc., especially the day the wedding party is celebrated, making on average US$ 5 each day. Her husband works hulling rice  and typically makes about US$ 1 each day in profit. One of her children works with her husband; two are employed at a garment factory, two others are mechanics, and the other is a student. Mrs. Ing S. hopes to use this loan to purchase more fashionable wedding dresses to meet her clients’ needs.

loans.use: To purchase more fashionable wedding dresses to meet her clients’ needs

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy spare parts

loans.name: Rose

texts.en:
Mambo from Dar es Salaam, Tanzania! This is 31 year-old Rose L., who is married with two children, aged 4 and 6, and has one other dependent, her younger brother.
In 2001 Rose established a pharmacy business, and now requests a loan of $275 in order to add to her inventory of medicines. She thanks you for your support.

loans.use: To add to the inventory of medicines at her pharmacy.

loans.name: Lea Teresa's Group

texts.es:
This committee was formed in July of 2006. The contact with this group was carried out by Señora Lea Teresa R., who was informed about the foundation and of the enterprising womens committee program thanks to some friends that formed part of another committee.

The Committee is comprised of 17 enterprising women of the Neighborhood Mbachio of Lambaré. This system of credit helps them to work better with their capital, to save, to be supportive and, of course, to promote responsibility.

These women work in different types of activities to improve their financial incomes. Among these activities we can cite: sale of clothes, edibles, pastries, cosmetics, fruits and vegetables, natural products, beverages and ice creams, hamburgers and recycling. They also work to improve their families and to serve their roles of mother and housewife. In addition they carry out these activities, since the cost of living is very high and they come from very humble families. Their greatest desire is to give a better future to their children.

As a group they also carry out activities with the purpose of collecting funds for their savings. They request today a loan with the purpose of investing in the purchase of merchandise, supplies and necessary ingredients for their different activities.

Translated from Spanish by B, Kiva Volunteer.

Este Comité se formo en julio del 2006. El contacto con este grupo se realizo a través de la señora. Lea Teresa R., quien se enteró acerca de la fundación y del programa comité de mujeres emprendedoras gracias a unas amigas que formaban parte de otro comité.

El Comité esta integrado por 17 mujeres emprendedoras del Barrio Mbachio de Lambaré. Este sistema de crédito les ayuda a ellas a trabajar mejor su capital, a ahorrar, a ser solidarias y por supuesto, a fomentar la responsabilidad.

Estas mujeres trabajan en distintos tipos de actividades para aumentar sus ingresos financieros, entre estas actividades podemos citar: venta de ropas, comestibles, repostería, cosméticos, frutas y verduras, productos naturales, bebidas y helados, venta de hamburguesas y reciclaje. Ellas además de llevar adelante a sus familias y cumplir sus roles de madre y ama de casa, también realizan estas actividades, ya que el costo de vida es muy alto y ellas provienen de familias muy humildes; sus mayores deseos son el de dar un mejor porvenir a sus hijos. Como grupo también realizan actividades con la finalidad de recaudar fondos para sus ahorros. Ellas solicitan hoy el crédito con la finalidad de invertirlos en la compra de mercaderías, insumos e ingredientes necesarios para sus distintas actividades.

loans.use: To buy underwear (for women, men and children), ingredients for cakes and sweets such as flour, eggs, fat, yeast, sugar, gas, dulce de leche ( a carmelized milk), dulce de guayaba (a sweet made from guava), several shop supplies like hangers, spoons and knives, jugs, strainers, glasses, cups for coffee or tea, office supplies such as notebooks, ballpoint pens, colored pencils, etc. for resale

loans.name: Sarrah

texts.en:
Sarrah M. sells palm oil in outskirts of Kabala town. Sarrah is 46 years old and married with 6 children.

With her previous loan, Sarrah was able to increase her stock of palm oil. Sarrah said that, with the profit, she renovated her house and was able to pay her children’s school fees. Now, she would like to purchase 75 gallons of palm oil to increase her stock and income.

Sarrah needs to purchase an even larger quantity of palm oil to meet the demands of her customers. She needs extra capital from Kiva to do so.

loans.use: To buy palm oil to sell

loans.name: Lola

texts.ru:
Lola T. lives in the Tursun-zade area. She is 36 years old, completed her secondary education, is married, and has one child. Lola has a small stall in the local Tursun-zade city market, where she sells retail goods that she bought wholesale. Her business provides the primary source of income for the family. In total she has more than 17 years of experience in business. She would like to expand the variety of goods at her stall by adding new items. That requires monetary resources, so she decided to take out a loan, to be paid back over 12 months.

Translated from Russian by Anna Brown, Kiva Volunteer.

Тошматова Лола Хамзаевна жительница района Турсунзаде.Возраст 36 лет, замужем ,имеет 1 ребенка.Образование среднее.Лола имеет небольшую торговую точку на местном рынке города Турсунзде, где торгует . Имеет опыт в бизнесе более 17 лет. Бизнес является основным источником дохода ее семьи. Она закупаету оптовых поставщиков товар и реализует в розницу. Клиентка хочет пополнить ассортимент торговой точки свежим товаром.Для чего ей необходимы денежные средства.Поэтому она решила взять кредит сроком на 12 месяцев.

loans.use: Expanding range of products at market stall

loans.name: Nancy

texts.es:
Nancy sells clothing closures wholesale. She buys the parts and then assembles them. She also sells self-adhesives for clothing and backpacks. Her husband is responsible for distributing the closures to different Lima markets. Also, for more than 20 years, Nancy has had a sewing shop in which she provides closure repair/exchange services. Her customers are her neighbors. In summer, Nancy makes doggy accessories. They have used their previous loans to buy closures. Nancy would like to build up her business and have more capital to buy more closures in the summer when they are less expensive and have more merchandise set aside for winter when demand increases.

Translated from Spanish by Ian Harvey, Kiva Volunteer.

Nancy se dedica a la venta de cierres de ropa por mayor. Nancy arma los cierres, puesto que los compra por partes y por metraje. También vende autoadhesivos para ropa y mochilas. Su esposo se encarga de repartir los cierres en diferentes mercados de Lima. Asimismo, desde hace 20 años Nancy tiene una máquina de coser con la que se encarga de hacer servicios de cambio de cierre. Sus clientes son sus vecinos. En verano, Nancy fabrica accesorios para perros. Los préstamos que ha pedido le han servido para comprar los cierres. Ella quisiera ampliar su negocio y tener un capital más grande para poder comprar más cantidad de cierres en verano, temporada en la que los cierres se abaratan. Y así tener mercadería guardada para invierno, cuando la demanda aumenta.

loans.use: For buying clothing closures to sell

loans.name: Pili's Ufunuo Group

texts.en:
Pili N. is 28 years old. She is a married woman with a 2 year old child. She became a coconut seller in 2004. Every day she works from 9am to 6pm at her business. She can earn a monthly profit of about $175 from her sales.

Pili now hopes for a loan of $875 to buy more coconuts for her business. She will share this loan with her subgroup members who have businesses dealing with maize sales, and rice sales.

loans.use: To buy more coconut for her business.

loans.name: Mario

texts.es:
Mario D. Ocampo is single and shares his home with his partner. He has grown up children, and works primarily recycling plastic, cardboard and glass. He started all this with only a small amount of capital which grew over the years along with his customers.

Mario D. is requesting a loan to buy various merchandise for recycling, such as: plastics, cardboard, glass and other materials, mainly from people who are also in this trade but who spend their time looking amongst the rubbish and city dump..

One of his dreams is to be able to develop his business soon, in terms of equipment. His aim is to build a platform where he can store all his merchandise better, protecting it from the harshness of time. .

Translated from Spanish by Lucy Williams, Kiva volunteer

El señor Mario D. Ocampo, es soltero, vive con la pareja en su propia casa, ya tiene hijos mayores de edad, se dedica principalmente al reciclaje de plásticos, cartones y vidrios. Se inició con un pequeño capital que fue ampliando con el correr de los años ya que cuenta con una amplia clientela.

El señor Mario D., retira el préstamo para la compra de varias mercaderías para el reciclaje como ser: plásticos, cartón, vidrios y otros elementos, principalmente de personas que también se dedican a este rubro pero que se dedican a buscar entre la basura y en el vertedero municipal de la ciudad.

Uno de sus aspiraciones es poder ampliar próximamente su negocio, en lo que se refiere al equipamiento, su objetivo es construir un tinglado para poder acumular mejor sus mercaderías, resguardar de la inclemencia del tiempo y para guardar en forma más segura.

loans.use: To purchase various materials for recycling, such as plastic, cardboard, glass etc.

loans.name: Gulchehra

texts.en:
K. Gulchehra is married and has five adorable children who go to kindergarten and day school. A very responsible and hard working woman, 22 years ago she started offering her services as a seamstress to her neighbors and acquaintances, renting a sewing workshop where she produces national dresses for women.

Gulchehra's fondest wish is for her children to continue with their education, and this is the reason she needs to continue growing her business. She is asking for a loan of $1000 that will be used to buy supplies to increase her production and meet customer demand. She commits herself to repaying the loan in 12 months. From the extra money earned, she wants to fix the house and continue to pay for her children’s education.

Help this family improve their quality of life by contributing to the growth of Gulchehra’s business. They will sincerely thank you for it.

loans.use: To purchase fabrics for sewing national dresses.

loans.name: Lisseth

texts.es:
Lisseth es socia del Banco Comunal El Roble, es conviviente y tiene 2 hijos pequeños de 5 y 4 años.
Lisseth tiene su negocio de comida, vende menús, empezó hace 6 meses con este negocio, ella reparte comida a los obreros de la zona. El negocio es durante el día por eso Lisseth esta planificando tener otro negocio por las noches que es la venta de Cd´s.
Lisseth necesita un préstamo de 400 soles, dinero que será invertido en un nuevo negocio, quiere dedicarse a vender cd´s por las noches.   
Lisseth sueña con aumentar su negocio y poner un restaurante.
texts.en:
Lisseth is a member of the communal bank El Roble. She lives with her partner and has two small children ages five and four.

Lisseth has a business selling meals. She started this business six months ago. She delivers food to workers in her neighborhood. Because she works during the day she is planning on having another business in the evenings selling cds.

Lisseth needs a loan in the amount of $ 150 which she will invest in starting her new business selling cds. Lisseth dreams with increasing her business and starting a restaurant.

Translated from Spanish by Cindy Manzo, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Invest in starting a new business selling cds.

loans.name: Sinak

texts.en:
Mrs. Sinak S. is 37 years old and raises pigs. She lives in Oambeul Commune, Banteay Meanchey Province, and is married with five children, all of whom are young and still live at home. Sinak's husband, Mr. Sengly Sok, is 38 years old and makes a living as a taxi driver; he leaves very early in the morning to pick up his first passengers, and earns approximately $10 each day.

Sinak and Sengly are applying for a $500 loan so they can pay the car tax for the taxi service, so that they will not be penalized by the policemen.

loans.use: To pay the car tax

loans.name: Rebeca

texts.es: Rebeca tiene 43 años, vive con su esposo y dos de sus hijos en la casa que heredó de su madre. Hace 5 años se dedica a la venta de comida, con el apoyo económico de uno de su hijo que se fue a trabajar a otro país, desea abrir un bonito restaurante en el futuro. Esta actividad es algo que le apasiona realizar, puesto que desde muy joven ayudó a su madre en la cocina y gracias a ella, ahora puede realizar riquísimos platos de comida, su buena sazón atrae a las personas que degustan sus platillos. Pero dentro de todo, lo difícil es poder medir la cantidad que hay que preparar para el día  para no tener pérdidas. Este es su primer crédito con MFP. Rebeca desea invertir en la compra de víveres, para solventar los gastos de inversión en su negocio.
texts.en:
Rebeca is 43 years old and lives with her husband and two of her children in the home she inherited from her mother. For 5 years she has been selling food. With the financial help of one of her children who went to work in another country, she would like to open a nice restaurant in the future. She is passionate about cooking, as she began helping her mother in the kitchen from a very young age and thanks to her, now she is able to make delicious meals. Her ability to season dishes well attracts people to come taste her meals. But in all, the most difficult is knowing how much food to prepare each day so as not to have any waste. This is her first loan with MFP. Rebeca would like to invest in the purchase of food, to cover the cost of investment in her business.

Translated from Spanish by Laure Kwon, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy food to prepare

loans.name: Mary

texts.en:
Mary Agbolahor is 42 years old and married with four children. She sells foodstuffs such as melon. She hopes to give her children a quality education. She is a LAPO client.

In order to stock her shop with more products to sell, Mary is requesting a loan of N140,000 (US $975) to purchase more foodstuffs. She says thanks to all Kiva leaders for their financial support.

loans.use: To purchase more foodstuffs to sell

loans.name: Elizabeth

texts.en:
Elizabeth A., a 31-year-old married mother of two children, both in school, lives in Abofour, a busy farming community and suburb of Offinso, located in the Ashanti region of Ghana.

For the past seven years Elizabeth has being selling gari and beans with ripe plantain in Abofour’s community market. Gari and beans are enjoyed by many Ghanaians because they are both affordable and high in protein, and the success of her business is attributable both to her good customer relations and the tasty meals she cooks.

Elizabeth is requesting the loan to buy foodstuffs including gari, plantain, and beans as well as charcoal. It is her dream to develop the business to its full potential in order to ensure her children’s ongoing education.

loans.use: To buy foodstuffs such as gari, plantains and beans.

loans.name: Landy

texts.en:
Landy A. is a farmer. He grows rice to support his family. He is 49 years old and has 2 children. He is worried about getting money to sustain his 2 hectare farm business. His wife, Jerlyn A., supports him in all his decisions. Together, they work hard to raise their children well. He has been tilling the land for 15 years. Aside from being a farmer, he was also elected as a Brgy. councilor. He consequently serves the community for a 3 year term.

He is asking a loan of Php 10,000 from CEVI. He will use the loan to buy more fertilizer. The loan will allow him to have an abundant harvest.

CEVI helps farmers increase their yield. CEVI clients engaged in farming are also given credit assistance, training and insurance coverage.

loans.use: Purchasing fertilizer

loans.name: Nguyen Thi

texts.vi: Chị Nguyễn Thị Xuân ở Quảng Xương, Thanh Hóa. Năm nay chị 32 tuổi,có hai con nhỏ đang đi học. Chị tham gia Quỹ từ năm 2008. Thu nhập chính của gia đình chị hiện nay là từ dệt chiếu, chăn nuôi lợn, vịt,gà và từtiền công  chạy máy kéo của chồng 100.000/ngày. Vòng vốn tới chị mong muốn được vay thêm 9.000.000 để tu sửa máy móc và mua lác dệt chiếu.
texts.en:
Mrs. Nguyễn Thị Xuân lives in Quảng Xương district, Thanh Hóa province, and has participated in the TYM Fund since 2008. She is 32 years old and has two young children who attend school. Currently, the main sources of income for her family are weaving straw mats, raising pigs, ducks, and chickens, and wages her husband earns driving a tractor, for a total of about 100,000 VND (~6 USD) per day. In the next round of lending, she hopes to borrow 9,000,000 VND (525 USD) to repair her weaving machine and buy straw for making mats.

Translated from Vietnamese by Robert Sides, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Straw mats

loans.name: Amriddin

texts.en:
B. Amriddin is dedicated to the production of dairy cattle. With a lot of effort and sacrifice he carries out this work every day for the purpose of improving the conditions of his family and bringing the daily bread to his table. At the same time, he is saving for the improvement of his dwelling, which needs a lot of help because it is in a bad state but which, little by little, he has come to improve. His family admires him for the fact that his multiple efforts have permitted him to bring food to his home and that in addition, Amriddin has managed to keep his three children in school.

The need that this gentleman faces is to invest in the development of his business through the purchase of cows. In this he hopes that IMON International, with the help of Kiva, will offer him the loan to help him to do well along with his family.


More about Tajikistan and IMON International

Tajikistan is perhaps best known for its rich history, which includes a key post along the Silk Road; the end of Alexander the Great's rule; and for it’s famous great thinkers, philosophers, scientists and poets such as: Rudaki, Ibn Sina (Avicenna), Firdousi, Omar Haiyam, Jomi, Mavlavi Rumi and many others. The country is home to communities that still speak the ancient Sogdian language, epic mountain passes, and a civilization that dates back to the 4th millennium B.C. And, even today, it is a complex mixture of the Islamic faith, Soviet culture, New West culture and Central Asian traditions.

But, Tajikistan is also the poorest of the former Soviet republics. The civil war, which ignited soon after Tajikistan’s independence from the U.S.S.R., further damaged the already weak economy. In addition, 93% of the country is mountainous and only 7% of the land is arable. These conditions have resulted in high levels of unemployment and have forced hundreds of thousands to seek work in other countries, mainly Russia. While the people of Tajikistan are working to improve its agricultural production and manufacturing sector, nearly two-thirds of the population still live in abject poverty.

IMON's History
Since December 2007, IMON International has worked closely with Kiva and Kiva lenders to ensure that poor and low income clients represent a viable business proposition. Funds raised through Kiva have already been distributed to thousands of IMON International's clients and will continue to provide thousands more with permanent access to the varied financial services they need. To learn more about IMON International's work, please visit: www.imon.tj

loans.use: To purchase cows for his business

loans.name: Hassan

texts.en:
Hassan is a 43-year-old man who lives in Tyre, southern Lebanon, with his wife and their five children. Hassan has been working as a van driver since 1998. He requested a loan of $1,600 US dollars from Kiva's partner Al Majmoua in order to do some maintenance work on his car. This is his third cycle and he has always paid on time.

His previous loans helped him improve his business. His clients can be anybody. Hassan decided on doing his business because he wanted to have an independent job. In the future, he plans on improving his work.

loans.use: To do some maintenance work on his car

loans.name: Komlanté Anoumou

texts.fr: Ce monsieur réside dans le quartier d’amadahomé, il est marié et a 02 enfants. Il exerce comme activité le commerce de cartes de recharges téléphoniques. Il veut agrandir son commerce et gagner plus de revenu afin de mieux subvenir aux charges de sa famille, il sollicite alors de WAGES un deuxième crédit pour acheter 30 cartons de cartes de recharges.
texts.en:
This gentleman lives in the Amadahomé district. He is married and has 2 children. He sells telephone recharge cards. He wants to expand his business and earn more so as to be in a position to support his family better. For that reason, he is asking WAGES for his second loan to buy 30 cartons of rechargeable phone cards.

Translated from French by Teresa Kramer, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: purchase of rechargeable phone cards for re-sale

loans.name: Lilia

texts.en:
Lilia lives in Barangay Liwayway Diffun, Quirino which is a mountainous province. She both raises hogs and sells food items in her village. She is married to Ernesto Sr. and has nine children. Out of their nine children, seven are already married and two are still single and patiently doing their best to finish their studies.

According to Lilia, her hog raising business is doing well however, the business is too small to provide for their important necessities. She is requesting a loan amounting to PHP 7,000 as additional capital for her hog-raising business. She will use the loan to purchase more hogs and more feed so that she can sell them at a higher price.
