Lilia hopes to increase her family’s standard of living by doing her best in the business she operates.

loans.use: To purchase more hogs and more feed

loans.name: Maulyne Aketch

texts.en:
Maulyne is 27 years old and married with one child. Before her current business (paper sales), she used to run a small food kiosk in the Kisumu neighbourhood.

She and her husband are on their first loan at Kadet. Her husband had  tried to get a loan from a local commercial bank earlier, but could not meet the requirements. Through her fellow women friends, Maulyne got to know about Kadet and that she could access a loan much more easily. With this loan, Maulyne intends to expand her business by procuring more stock and, eventually, she intends to diversify into a cyber-cafe.

loans.use: To purchase new printing materials including bank papers

loans.name: Đỗ Thị

texts.en:
T. Đỗ Thị (337041136) is a 34 year-old female living in the town of Ph úc Y ên. She is married and has 2 school-aged children. To making a living, T. owns and operates a restaurant where she serves a variety of different meals to customers in the local community. T. has been engaged in this business for over 9 years and earns approximately 6500000 VND a month from these activities.

In 2004, T. joined TYM Fund to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. T. has successfully repaid a previous loan of 9000000 VND from TYM Fund. The previous loan was used to purchase food and drinks for the restaurant. T. is now requesting a new loan of 10000000 VND ($575 USD) which will be used to invest in expanding the business. This will be T.'s 5th loan from TYM Fund. T. plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand her business.

loans.use: To expand her business

loans.name: Shola

texts.en:
Shola sells sarongs. She has been in this business for the past 10 years. Shola lives in Lagos and she has been borrowing from LAPO Microfinance for the past 3 years. Shola is 38 years old and married with 2 children.

Shola is requesting the loan amount of N100,000 to purchase more sarongs to sell. She thanks all Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase more sarongs to sell

loans.name: Olga Corina

texts.es: Olga Corina C. D. C. resiD. en el departamento D. San Vicente ubicado en la zona D. occidente D. El Salvador. Olga vive con su esposo quien trabaja como motorista D. un camión y su aporte neto a la familia es D. $150.00 US mensuales, también viven con ellos sus dos  hijos Miguel D. 17 años y Carmen D. 14 años D. edad, los niños se encuentran estudiando. Olga posee su negocio ubicado en su casa es una  tienda con productos D. consumo diario la cual se encuentra ubicada en su domicilio, Olga solita un crédito para surtir su negocio y así poder brindar un excelente servicios y variedad D. productos a sus clientes.
texts.en:
Olga Corina C. D. C. lives in the San Vicente District, which is located in the western part of El Salvador. Her husband works as a truck driver, and his income brings in $150 USD each month for their family. They have two children, Miguel (age 17) and Carmen (age 14), who are both students.

Olga operates a business from her home selling daily household products. She is requesting a loan to restock her business so that she can proviD. her customers with excellent service and a wiD. variety of products.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Restock her business with more merchandise

loans.name: Queen

texts.en: Queen is 46 years old and married with six children. She bakes and sells cakes. She lives in Benin City, Edo State, Nigeria. Queen has been in this business since 1984. She hopes for the loan amount of N100,000 to purchase more baking materials to bake and sell. She says thank you to all Kiva lenders for their financial support.

loans.use: To purchase more baking material to sell

loans.name: Vith

texts.en:
C., 26, is a general doctor who learned his skills in a private school.  He owns a small clinic in his home where he sells medicine and examines patients who live nearby.  Married to Sopeap, a 24-year-old hairdresser, they are blessed with one young child who is not yet enrolled in school. Because Sopeap does not have her own salon shop, C. is requesting a loan of $1000 from Kiva through HKL to be used to build one, with the remainder being used to meet some of the requirements for his clinic. 

Note: C.'s wife is shown in the photo.

loans.use: To build a beauty salon shop and meet some of the requirements for his clinic.

loans.name: Dèli Jisèle

texts.fr: Dèli Jisèle est mariée et mère de trois enfants. Grâce au revenu de son activité, Dèli Jisèle aide son mari dans les charges du foyer. Dèli Jisèle vend en effet des poissons frais. C’est à Djassin tokpa que Dèli Jisèle achète ses produits et va les vendre au marché d’Igolo. Dèli Jisèle est une cliente d’ALIDé qui rembourse bien ses crédits. Pour mieux satisfaire sa clientèle, Dèli Jisèle demande de crédit pour renforcer son fonds de roulement.
texts.en:
Dèli Jisèle is married and the mother of three children. Thanks to the income from her activity, Dèli Jisèle helps her husband with the household expenses. Dèli Jisèle sells fresh fish. Dèli Jisèle buys her products in Djassin Tokpa and sells them at the market of Igolo. Dèli Jisèl is an ALIDé customer who always reimburses her loans. In order to meet her customers' demand, Dèli Jisèl is asking for a loan to strengthen her working capital.

Translated from French by Véronique Fourment, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of fish

loans.name: Gansukh

texts.en: S. is 28 years old and lives with his wife and two young children in the Uvurkhangai province of Mongolia. He and his family live together in a ger, a traditional Mongolian nomadic tent. His wife stays home and takes care of their children. S. operates a computer service business where he does computer repairs and maintenance. He began his business in 2005 and since then he has gained a good reputation amongst his customers. S. would like to eventually have his own computer retail store so that he can expand his customer base and his profits. He is requesting a 3,000,000 tugrug (~2100 USD) loan in order to purchase computers and computer parts for his business.

loans.use: To purchase computers and computer parts for his business

loans.name: Charlie

texts.en:
Charlie L., 27 years old, is a rice grower in Bunawan Agusan del Sur. He has this idea that people always buy rice, that is why even though many times he was down in his business, he never stops his pursuit in managing his farm to be able to support his family and buy all the basic things they need.

He is asking for a loan of Php 12,000 from Community Economic Ventures, Inc. He will use the loan to fund his farm. The loan will be put forward in paying the laborers who help prepare the soil ready for planting.

loans.use: Farm financing

loans.name: Sum's Group

texts.en:
This is a small loan request for two borrowers. The leader, Mrs. Sum S., age 49, has been selling groceries since early 2008. She lives with her child and her husband in a small family home located in Kampong Chhnang Province. To help meet the family's needs, her husband drives a motorbike taxi.

Sum S. requests a loan to use as additional capital for her grocery business.

The other borrower, Mrs. Min S., is a vegetable seller who is requesting a loan to begin a business raising pigs.

loans.use: To use as additional capital for her grocery business

loans.name: Oñondivepa Group

texts.en:
The committee "Oñondivepa" has been working with Fundacion Paraguaya for almost a year. The entrepreneurial women who are part of the group, use their loans for their individual businesses, which include: purchasing ingredients for cooking food, baked goods and pastries; purchasing milk and sugar, flour and salt, for their pantries; fruits and vegetables, such as melon, watermelon, bananas, and oranges; buying and selling second-hard clothes and shoes.

They all do this with the goal of improving their lives and that of their families.

loans.use: To buy more merchandise for their businesses

loans.name: Ikram

texts.en:
Ikram is a 46-year-old woman who lives in Beirut, the capital of Lebanon, with her husband and their two children. Ikram has owned a mobile phone business since 1996. She sells all types of new and used mobile phones and she also repairs phones. Her clients are her friends and neighbors. She requested a loan from the Kiva field partner, Al Majmoua, in order to purchase a computer for her work. This is the first time that Ikram has requested a loan from Al Majmoua.

Ikram decided to start this business because she wanted to supplement her family’s income, and she's had no difficulties with it. In the future, she plans to increase her business by opening another mobile shop.

loans.use: To purchase a computer for her work.

loans.name: Elviz Ronald

texts.es:
Elviz es un joven de 27 años, es soltero no tiene hijos, es huérfano de padre ya que cuando tenida apenas 18 meses su padre los abandono a él y a sus 6 hermanos, por lo tanto la madre tuvo que trabajar mucho para sacar adelante a sus 7 hijos, trabajando en el comedor de una universidad de cocinera. Elviz es profesional en una carrera técnica, es Analista en Sistemas, actualmente no ejerce su profesión debido al excesivo desempleo que hay en Bolivia.

Elviz vive en la ciudad de Cochabamba, y trabaja de Seguridad en el centro comercial “COLONIAL”  de lunes a viernes y el fin de semana en un restaurant, por lo tanto trabaja todos los días para poder ayudar también a su madre con los gastos de la casa.

El préstamo será destinado para la compra de una computadora, porque tiene pensado tener abrir un café Internet, y la otra parte del capital para el resto de las computadoras tiene de sus ahorros.
Entre sus metas y sueños es ayudar siempre a su madre, tener una casa propia, su deseo más grande es trabajar un una empresa en la cual pueda ejercer la carrera que ha estudiado.
texts.en:
Elviz, 27, is a single young man with no children. His father abandoned him and his six siblings when Elviz was barely 18 months old. Therefore, his mother had to work a lot to get her seven children ahead. She worked in the dining room of a cooking university. Elviz is a professional in a technical career. He is a systems analyst. He does not currently practice his profession due to the excessive unemployment in Bolivia. Elviz lives in the city of Cochabamba. He works Mondays through Fridays in security at the Colonial commercial center. On the week ends he works in a restaurant. He works everyday to be able to help his mother with the household expenses. The loan is to buy a computer because he plans to open an Internet café. He has his savings for the other part of the capital for the rest of the computers. Some of his hopes and dreams are to always help his mother and to have his own house. His biggest wish is to work in a business where he could practice the career that he has studied.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy a computer

loans.name: Dolores Del Socorro

texts.es: Dolores tiene 26 años, a pesar de ser tan joven le gusta mucho trabajar en esta actividad venta de ropa. Ella se dedica a la venta, Hace más de 5 años que inicio esta actividad cuando inicio sus estudios de carrera universitaria todo con el propósito de ayudarle a su Mama ya anteriormente también ofrecía cosméticos pero la mayoría de sus clientes eran sus compañeras pero ellas le solicitaban ropa es por eso que dedica a la venta de este productos.  Ella está muy agradecida por todas las cosas que paso para poder madurar y ayudarle a su Mama en el negocio. Y es por este motivo que solicita este financiamiento para capital de trabajo para la compra de ropa de cama, ropa para niños, para damas por lo que le permitirán diversificar mas las ofertas de sus productos y así generar un poco de ingresos. Tiene el deseo de establecer una tienda de ropa en su vivienda.
texts.en:
Dolores is 26 years old, but despite being young, she truly enjoys her job, which is the sale of clothing. She has been selling for more than 5 years, which she started at the same time that she started her college studies with the goal of helping her mother. Previously, she also sold cosmetics, mostly to her friends, but her friends started asking her for clothes, so she decided to sell those products instead. She is very grateful for everything that has happened, which has allowed her to grow and to help her Mother's business. For this reason she is seeking a loan – for working capital to buy pajamas, children's clothes, and more women's clothes in order to diversify her selection and thus generate a little more income. She would like to open a clothing store out of her home.

Translated from Spanish by Julia Kastner, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Working capital - clothing

loans.name: Célestine

texts.fr: Célestine L. est âgée de 65 ans, elle est mariée et mère de treize (13) enfants. elle est membre du Banc Villageois de Sainte ANNE1 depuis 8 ans et a eu 16 expériences avec le crédit. Elle fait du commerce de viande, elle achète l'animal sur pieds, le fait abattre et vend la viande au kilogramme. Son objectif est de renforcer son épargne et de subvenir à ses besoins personnels.
texts.en:
Célestine L. is a married, 65 year-old woman with thirteen children. She has been a member of the Sainte ANNE1 Village Bank for the past eight years and has repaid her 16 previous loans. She has a meat shop: she buys live animals, butchers them and sells the meat by the pound. Her goal is to increase her savings and provide for her personal needs.

Translated from French by Joanne Archambault, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Maintain her business activities

loans.name: Ruda

texts.en: Mrs. Ruda B. owns a sari sari store and her husband is a farmer. She is 30 years old and married with two children. They are from Poblacion Mahayag, Zamboanga del Sur. She has owned this store for more than two years and earns approximately 4,000 monthly. Ruda joined PMPC to gain access to financial support and to engage in other business activities. She has a loan of 3,000 from PMPC and this is her first loan cycle. This loan is to expand her business so that her income can satisfy their daily basic needs. The income generated from her business helps to improve the living conditions of her family. About PMPC: Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC) is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model. Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: Additional capital for her sari-sari store

loans.name: Gradus

texts.en:
Gradus O. O. is 38 years old, married and has one child. His business is located at a garage in Kariobangi, Nairobi and is well known by the name "Goodwill Trade". He sells vehicle paints to the mechanics at the garage and to his loyal customers, who are mostly from Kariobangi. He has been running this business for seven years and has two employees. He says that his business is profitable and that his main challenge is financial constraints and, therefore, reduced stock levels. Also, there are other similar businesses in the area so customers are not loyal as they are spoilt
 for choice. However, he works very hard to make sure his business continues to do well. 

He is using his loan of Kes 80,000 to buy more vehicle paints to serve a larger clientele and, thus, increase his profit margin. In the future he wants to be a distributor of paints. He is very hardworking, intelligent and focused.

loans.use: to buy stock of vehicle paints

loans.name: Leonarda

texts.es:
Leonarda tiene 45 años, vive con su pareja y padre de sus 4 hijos. Vive en una localidad en la ceja de selva ayacuchana denominada “Palmapampa”, en una casa alquilada.

Ella nunca olvidará aquellas tardes de su juventud cuando observaba a sus abuelos a remover la tierra y colocar las semillas de cacao. Es por ello de que ahí en adelante apostó por la actividad agrícola, específicamente al cultivo de cacao, para así honrar el legado de sus abuelos.
Ahora desarrolla nuevas técnicas de cultivo con el apoyo ocasional de sus familiares, pero también contrata peones en tiempo de cosecha. Este producto tiene mucha demanda a nivel nacional e internacional, es por ello que se siente satisfecha por las ganancias que recibe al vender su producto en los centros de acopio de su localidad. En adelante, piensa comprar más terrenos, para así competir de manera equitativa con sus vecinos.

Este es su décimo tercer préstamo con MFP, por lo que se compromete a cumplir con sus respectivos pagos, además está conforme con la metodología de trabajo de su banco comunal. Con el dinero que solicita invertirá en insumos y abono para su chacras, con la finalidad de mejorar la calidad de su producto para que su próxima cosecha la venda a mejor precio.
texts.en:
Leonarda is 45 years old and lives with her partner, who is the father of her four children. She lives in a rented house in a town located in the Ayacuchan jungle called Palmapampa.

Leonarda never forgot those afternoons in her youth when she watched her grandparents clear the land and plant cacao seeds. This is the reason why she chose to pursue farming, specifically growing cacao, in order to honor her grandparents’ legacy. She now develops new farming techniques with the occasional help of her relatives, but she also hires workers for the harvest season. Cacao has high demand on a national and international level. Leonarda feels satisfied with the revenue she generates from selling her product to the collection centers in her area. Later on she wants to buy more land so that she can complete on the same level as her neighbors.

This is her thirteenth loan with MFP. Leonarda commits to making her payments and conforming to the work methodology of her Communal Bank. The money she requested will be invested in supplies and organic fertilizers for her fields so that she can improve the quality of her product for the next harvest and sell it at a better price.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase organic fertilizers & farming supplies

loans.name: Jesus Esta Aqui Group

texts.en:
Hilover is the coordinator of her group, Jesus está Aquí (Jesus is Here). Her story is representative of her group and of Esperanza's Haitian and Dominican clients (many of whom recently emigrated to the DR from Haiti) generally. Her group is located in the slums that ring the capital city. Here, crime is rampant and running water (none of which is potable) and electricity are unreliable. She makes her home here in a simple structure with her long-term partner and their three children.

Hilover is excited to be taking her third loan  with Esperanza, a Kiva partner, after having successfully repaid her previous loans and grown her business. She plans to use this loan to invest in her business selling tennis shoes by purchasing two crates of tennis shoes to sell in her community. She will use the profits to invest in constructing her own home and saving toward the university education of her children. She thanks you all for your support.

loans.use: Tennis shoes to sell

loans.name: Nena's Group

texts.en:
Nena S. is from the village of Dalapang, Ozamiz city. She is 43 years old. Nena is the group leader of a 2-member group loan offered by GDMPC. While each member of the group receives an individual loan, they are both collectively responsible for paying back the loan of their fellow group member if someone is delinquent or defaults.

Nena is married and has 4 school-aged children. To make a living, Nena owns & operates a business venture in the agriculture sector, raising crops. The main source of income for the business comes from planting and harvesting rice and corn for sale. Nena has been engaged in her business for over 15 years and earns approximately 15,000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2008, Nena joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Nena has successfully repaid a previous loan of 10,000 PHP from GDMPC. Nena is requesting a new loan of 12,000 PHP which will be used to purchase fertilizers such as manure. This will be the fourth loan taken out by Nena from GDMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family. 

About GDMPC:

GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines. It has four branches and three unit offices covering the provinces of Zamboanga del Sur, Lanao del Norte and Misamis Occidental. Its membership is composed mostly of farmers, fisherfolk and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizers such as manure

loans.name: Gift Of Kasina, Kyenjojo Group

texts.en:
Very innovative, K. James went into a brick making business two years ago. Due to the high demand for bricks as building materials by many people, this has always provided a ready market for his stock.

The married father of four children has maneuvered through hard times to provide for his family but still has not lost heart. With this loan, he will be able to purchase good quality soils for making quality bricks to meet his customers’ demand. This will improve his sales and also help him with business expansion.

loans.use: To purchase quality soils for making bricks

loans.name: Adela

texts.en:
Adela B. is from the village of Agusan Canyon,  Mnaolo Fortich Bukidnon. She is 58 years old. Adela is married and has 7 adult children. To make a living, Adela owns & operates a sari-sari (variety) retail shop. The main source of income for the business comes from selling both food & daily use products in the local community. Adela has been engaged in her business for over 20 years and earns approximately 3000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2009, Adela joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Adela has successfully repaid a previous loan of 5000 PHP from HSPFI. This previous loan was used to to purchase additional products to sell. Adela is requesting a new loan of 8000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional products to sell. This will be the 2nd loan taken out by Adela from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand her business. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is an accredited partner of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and reaches out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase additional products to sell

loans.name: Lourn

texts.en: Mrs. Lourn L., age 56, is a married woman and the mother of a child who is now married and lives independently. To earn a living, she sells cake and dessert and normally earns $1 per day. In addition, Lourn L. and her husband always take the time to cultivate a rice crop for their family to eat. This couple has spent a long time in this business and are very successful. The coming rainfall season is good for growing but Lourn L. does not have the money to hire a laborer to plow her farmland or to buy any supplies to use on her field. This is the reason she has decided to seek a loan through Kiva’s field partner, HKL.

loans.use: To hire a laborer to plow the farmland and to buy supplies

loans.name: Jenny

texts.en:
Jenny P. is from the village of Poblacion, Valencia City. She is 49 years old. Jenny is married and has 1 school-aged child. To make a living, Jenny owns & operates a sari-sari (variety) retail shop, selling both food & daily use products in the local community. Jenny has been engaged in her business for over 5 years and earns approximately 5000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2010, Jenny joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities. Jenny is requesting a new loan of 5000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional products to sell. This will be the 1st loan taken out by Jenny from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve and expand her business. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional products to sell.

loans.name: Rheamar

texts.en: Rheamar O. is from the village of Wadya, Banisilan, South Cotabato. She is 36 years old. Rheamar is married and has four school-aged children. To make a living, Rheamar runs a sari-sari (variety) retail shop. The main source of income for the business comes from selling both food and daily-use products in the local community. Rheamar has been engaged in her business for more than six years and earns approximately 9,500 Philippine pesos (PHP) a month from it. In 2007, Rheamar joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Rheamar has successfully repaid a previous loan of 15,000 PHP from HSPFI. This previous loan was used to purchase additional products to sell. Rheamar is requesting a new loan of 15,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase additional inventory and working capital. This will be the seventh loan taken out by Rheamar from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand it. About HSPFI: HSPFI is one of the accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao. *Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional inventory and working capital

loans.name: Mrs. Thoy Kang Village Bank Group

texts.en: This village bank loan has nine people who are villagers in Prey Sambuor village, Takeo province. Mrs. Thoy K. is the village bank president. She was born in 1959. She was selected by the other members, who will use portions of the loan for different purposes. She and her husband, Mr. Bav Ven, are farmers who rent a small piece of land to cultivate rice to sell in order to support their family. Her husband is also a fisherman. However they try to work hard so that they can earn more income. So to improve her family's living condition, Mrs. Thoy K. is asking for a loan to buy some piglets for breeding to start a new business. She is the mother of six children, three of whom are seamstresses in a garment factory, and three of whom are attending in local school in addition to helping their parents’ businesses.

loans.use: To buy some piglets for breeding to start a new busines

loans.name: Hellen

texts.en: Hellen A.  is currently in the business of selling beans, maize flour, and pulses at the market and is requesting a loan to stock tomatoes and sweet potatoes to sell.  Hellen is 51 years old and is widowed.   She has 7 children and her children do not go to school.  With the extra profits from her loan, she hopes to be able to build a house for her children.

loans.use: Stock tomatoes and sweet potatoes to sell

loans.name: Saturnina

texts.en:
Saturnina M. is from the village of Rizal. She is 58 years old, widowed and has five adult children. To make a living, Saturnina owns and operates a business venture in the agriculture sector raising crops. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes from planting and harvesting rice for sale. Saturnina has been engaged in her business for over 35 years and earns approximately 20,000 PHP during the harvest season.

In 2007, Saturnina joined ASKI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities. She has successfully repaid a previous loan of 10,000 PHP from ASKI which was used to purchase additional seeds, seedlings and young crops to raise. Saturnina is requesting a new loan of 10,000 PHP which will be used to purchase fertilizers such as manure. This will be the eighth loan that Saturnina has taken out from ASKI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated to improve/expand her business. 

About ASKI:

ASKI is one of the most successful microfinance institutions in the Philippines. It has 29 branches covering the central and north-eastern areas. Its clients are mostly farmers, fisherfolk and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase fertilizers such as manure

loans.name: Silvia Ondina

texts.es:
la sra. Silvia Ondina C. tiene más de dos años de dedicarse a cuidar estudiantes,  ya que por la amplitud de la casa en donde vive le permite realizar este tipo de negocio.- actualmente esta cuidando ocho estudiantes a los cuales les brinda la alimentación y pensión.
La Sra. Silvia C. utilizara el credito para comprar la alimentacion y otros materiales para el aseo de los apartamentos y asi darles un mejor servicio a sus inquilinos.

La Sra. Silvia es casada, su esposo trabaja como guardia de seguridad del INA y producto del matrimonio ella dio a luz a tres hijos los que dependen económicamente de ellos, y en estos momento sus hijos están cursando su educación secundaria.
texts.en:
Silvia Ondina C. has looked after students for more than two years, as the spaciousness of the house where she lives allows her to have this type of business.- currently she is looking after eight students to whom she provides food and lodging. Silvia C. will use the loan to buy food and other materials for cleaning the apartments so that she can provide to better service to her tenants. Silvia is married, her husband works as a security guard for INA and they have had three children who depend on them financially, and currently her children are in middle school.

Translated from Spanish by Catherine Dent, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: buy food, cleaning products for apartments.

loans.name: San

texts.en:
Mr. San S. (pictured here) and his wife, Mrs. Sinoun Phal, live in a suburb of Phnom Penh City. They have been married for more than five years and have two daughters.

The couple has been operating a business raising pigs and chickens for more than three years. They have received two Kiva loans in the past. In order to continue expanding their business and improving their standard of living, San is asking for another loan of $1,000. He will use the money to purchase additional piglets and to buy food for the pigs.

loans.use: To purchase additional piglets and to buy food for pigs

loans.name: Melba

texts.en:
Melba P. is from the village of Kipaducan, Pangantucan, Bukidnon. She is 41 years old. Melba is married and has five adult-aged children. To make a living, Melba owns and operates a business running a sari-sari (variety) retail shop. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from selling both food and daily-use products in the local community. Melba has been engaged in her business for more than three years and earns approximately 5,000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2009, Melba joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Melba has successfully repaid a previous loan of 7,000 PHP from HSPFI. This previous loan was used to to purchase additional products to sell. Melba is requesting a new loan of 8,000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional inventory and as working capital. This loan will be the third loan taken out by Melba from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand her business.

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

loans.use: To purchase additional inventory and as working capital

loans.name: Jocelyn

texts.en:
Life is full of challenges and that is what makes people stronger and fonder. Like other woman, 38-year-old Jocelyn C. encounters many challenges in life brought about by poverty. Jocelyn is from Malabor, Tibiao, Antique, Philippines. She is married to Rene C., a fish vendor, and they have five children. Their eldest child is already 17 years old while the youngest is 7 years old. All of the children are still studying.

This family earns a living by buying and selling fish. They earn a small amount from the business, but sometimes their income is not enough to meet their basic needs because they do not have enough capital. Therefore, Jocelyn decided to join ASHI and borrow capital. She continued their business with capital of 5,000 Philippine pesos (PHP).

Jocelyn is always inspired to improve the business because the children are studying. The support of her husband is always there. For her second loan from ASHI, she applied for 10,000 PHP and this will be used as additional capital for fish vending. Her greatest dream in life is to brighten the future of her children by sending them to school until they get a professional degree. She also wants to build a concrete house someday.

loans.use: For a fish vending business

loans.name: Kitunga Tukore Group, Kihihi

texts.en:
T. Ivan is a married 28-year-old man. He is a patient and hardworking man with a retail shop in Kanyasti Trading centre. Ivan has been in this business for three years and his main duty is to ensure that it is well-stocked to attract more customers. 

In the beginning, Ivan got a small loan from a local savings and credit group to expand his business from tea growing to include a retail shop. His dream is to start up a wholesale shop with plans for continued development.

loans.use: Restocking his retail shop with more merchandise.

loans.name: Maria De Jesus

texts.es:
Doña María, resiD. en San Miguel, departamento D. San Miguel, tiene 60 años D. edad, administra una cafetería, vive con  su esposo, tiene tres hijos pero ya están casados y viven con sus familias.
La cafetería la atienD. desD. las 7:00am hasta 5:00pm, a veces hasta más tarD. por los clientes, su experiencia es granD. púes lleva 18 años D. atender el negocio, actualmente está solicitando un préstamo para comprar bebidas refrescantes, boquitas y materiales para panes, hamburguesas, esta inversión ella la quiere realizar porque San Miguel está D. fiesta y mucha gente visita la ciudad,  entonces ella quiere disponer D. materiales para la preparación D. sus ventas y aprovechar para tener ganancia.
Su objetivo es trabajar con fondos propios, espera algún día tener la solvencia económica para realizar sus ventas.
texts.en:
María lives in San Miguel, in the department of the same name. She is 60 years old and runs a cafeteria. She lives with her husband and has three children, but they are already married and live with their own families. 

She works in the cafeteria from 7:00 a.m. until 5:00 p.m., or sometimes later for the sake of her customers. She has a great deal of experience, since she has operated the business for 18 years. Currently, she is requesting a loan to buy soft drinks, snacks, and ingredients for rolls, hamburgers, etc. She wants to make this investment because San Miguel is having a festival, and many people are visiting the city. For this reason, she would like to have supplies to prepare for her sales and take advantage of the situation to increase her earnings. 

Her objective is to work with her own funds; she hopes one day to have the economic resources to support her sales.

loans.use: Buying soft drinks and ingredients to make hamburgers

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: To buy more crates of drinks

loans.name: Speciose

texts.en:
Speciose is 45 years old and is married with two children between the ages of 16 and 20 years old. Speciose is well known for her business of selling a variety of goods, like tomatoes, soap, toothpaste, etc. as shown in her photo. This is her tenth successful year in business and she works from 8 am until 6 pm every day.

Speciose has requested a Kiva loan via Vision Finance Company to expand her shop by purchasing a large quantity of foodstuffs, mainly rice, peas, beans, wheat, etc. With this additional business, Speciose hopes that she will earn more profits to help her family. She would like to keep reinvesting for better progress in her business.

loans.use: To buy rice, beans, wheat and other foodstuffs.

loans.name: Oksana

texts.en:
Oksana P. is married with two children. She runs a small business selling wallpaper. Her store is located at the central market and attracts many people every day.

Oksana started this business 10 years ago. Hard work and persistence helped her to develop this business well. Today she has many repeat clients. Oksana's average profit is 8,000 UAH per month.

Oksana would like to borrow 15,000 UAH to purchase more inventory. Winter time is a high season for remodeling. So there is a high demand for items like wallpaper. She is hoping to increase her sales and spend additional income for her family's needs.

loans.use: To purchase more wallpaper inventory

loans.name: Jean Claude

texts.fr: Jean Claude H. a 42 ans, il est marié, et il est né a Rwanda.  Il a 6 enfants entre 5 et 12 ans, 4 de qui vont à l’école, et il a fini 3 ans d’école post-primaire.  Il va utiliser son prêt pour renouveler sa maison ; l’achat des tôles, planches, et cloues.  Sa stratégie pour la croissance de l’affaire est de construire des annexes dans son parcelle pour avoir une autre ressource de revenue, et agrandir sa maison.  Il voudrait avoir des maisonnettes dans son parcelle à louer, renouveler sa maison, et chercher un meilleur endroit pout l’élevage des animaux.  Pour sa famille, il voudrait assurer le bien être de ses enfants, scolariser ses enfants, et élever le niveau de vie de son famille.
texts.en:
Born in Rwanda, Jean Claude H. is a 42-year-old married man. He has six children from 5 to 12 years of age who attend school. He has completed three years of primary school. Jean Claude is going to use his loan for renovating his house and for buying corrugated metal sheets, wooden boards, and some nails. His strategy for business growth is to build additions on his parcel of land in order to have another source of revenues and to expand his house. He would like to have a small house there to rent out.  

Jean Claude would also like to find a better place for raising animals. For his family, he would like to ensure the well-being of his children and their education, as well as to raise the family’s living standard.

loans.use: Renovating the house; buying metal sheets, wooden boards, and nails

loans.name: Las Palmeras Group

texts.es:
EL grupo “LAS PALMERAS “se formo hace 3 años  la Sra. Marciala es parte de el, como socia  ella se siente feliz pues ha visto como su vida ha mejorado antes de ingresar al grupo trabajaba vendiendo medias lo hacia caminando de mercado en mercado y realmente era agotador  pero logro ahorrar algún dinero y decidió montar una pequeña bodega en su domicilio, al principio como todo negocio con muy pocas cosas pero con muchas ganar de trabajar así fue consiguiendo lo que hoy en día tiene, una bodega formal que tiene por nombre “ BODEGA MARTHA”  la que esta surtida de muchos productos vende de todo desde productos de pan llevar  hasta abarrotes ,pollo y también tiene una vitrina donde ofrece algo de ropa  su máximo sueño es seguir creciendo y lograr tener un negocio mucho mas grande, el préstamo que recibirá  será de gran ayuda  por que tiene que cambiar sus vitrinas que se han deteriorado  con el tiempo y el uso con ese dinero comprara sus vitrinas nuevas también algo de  útiles de librería por la época escolar que se avecina, La Sra. Marciala  realmente esta progresando mucho debido al empeño que le pone a cada cosa que hace.

* La Sra Marciala esta vestida con blusa negra.
texts.en:
The group “Las Palmeras” (The Palm Trees) was formed three years ago. Sra. Marciala is part of this group. As a member, she is happy to see how much her life has improved since joining the group. She started working by walking from market to market to sell her goods. The work was quite exhausting, but it enabled her to save some money so that she could open a small grocery store in her home. At first her business had very little, but with much work she was able achieve what she has today. Her store is formally named “Bodega Martha” (Martha’s Grocery Store) and is stocked with many products including bread, groceries, chicken, and other items. She also has a display case from which she offers clothes. Her greatest wish is to continue growing so that she can have a larger business.

The loan she will receive will be a great help so that she can replace her display cases since they have worn out over time. She plans to buy new display cases and some school supplies since the start of the school year is approaching. Sra. Marciala has really made much progress due to the effort she puts in each day.

*Sra. Marciala is the woman wearing a black blouse.

loans.use: Purchase display cases & school supplies to sell

loans.name: Bernandita

texts.en:
Bernandita B. is from the village of Lancangan, Mahinog, Camiguin Province. She is 58 years old. Bernandita is married and has two adult children. 

To make a living, Bernandita owns and operates a specialized retail store, selling gasoline and motor oils in various containers in the local community. Bernandita has been engaged in her business for over two years and earns approximately 10,000 PHP a month.

In 2010, Bernandita joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her business and living situation. Bernandita has successfully repaid a previous loan of 8,000 PHP from HSPFI. This previous loan was used to to purchase additional inventory and for working capital.

Bernandita is requesting a new loan of 11,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase additional products to sell like stocks of gasoline. This will be the third loan taken out by Bernandita from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the loan to improve and expand her business. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is an accredited partner of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional stocks of gasoline

loans.name: Rogelio

texts.es: El Sr. Rogelio Martínez Rodríguez surtirá mercancía para su negocio ya que argumenta que el giro de este es la electrónica por lo cual ve en el crédito una buena opción de inversión debido a que  tendrá mercancía disponible  para  sus  clientes y  así aumentaran considerablemente sus  ingresos.
texts.en: Sr. Rogelio Martínez Rodríguez will restock his business with merchandise due to the turnover of electronics.  The loan is a good investment option for him because he will have merchandise available to his customers so that he can increase his income significantly.

loans.use: Purchase electronics to sell

loans.name: Lolita

texts.en:
Lolita C. is from the village of Aplaya, Jasaan, Misamis Oriental. She is 37 years old. Lolita is married and has 4 school-aged children. To make a living, Lolita owns & operates a sari-sari (variety) retail shop, selling canned goods, snack foods, shampoo, soap and detergents in the local community. Lolita has been engaged in her business for over 8 years and earns approximately 16000 PHP a month frommthese activities.

In 2009, Lolita joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Lolita has successfully repaid a previous loan of 17000 PHP from HSPFI. This previous loan was used to purchase additional inventory & to fund working capital. 

Lolita is requesting a new loan of 20000 PHP, which will be used to purchase additional canned goods, detergents and beverages to sell. This loan will be her 6th loan from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated to improve/expand her business. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase additional products to sell in her store

loans.name: Soeurn

texts.en: Soeurn S. is a woman who earns a living by growing rice crops and different kinds of vegetables on her own farmland in Kompong Cham province. In addition to her farming business, she also sells a few fish to the neighbors for a daily profit. Her husband works in the field with her, and he is also a district policeman. They are blessed with six children. Five are single and one is married and lives independently in their own house. Soeurn S. is seeking a loan to dig a well for irrigating her rice and vegetable crops.

loans.use: to dig a well for irrigating her rice and vegetables crops

loans.name: Michael

texts.en:
Michael is a 30-year-old farmer from Sto. Niño, South Cotabato. He is still single and hopes to have his own family someday.

Michael has been growing rice for six years. He sells his harvest to the market. Michael works hard to grow his business and have his own savings. He hopes for his business to be stable for his future family.

This loan will be used to purchase fertilizers and other farm inputs.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizers and other farm inputs

loans.name: Yolanda

texts.es:
A la vivienda de la señora Yolanda le está haciendo falta el piso de concreto al frente y el Vitro piso en el interior de la casa. 
  Esta solicitando un préstamo para poder comprar el material que es cemento y el vitro piso y pagarle a la persona que se encargara de la mejora. 
Planea pagar el crédito con el sueldo que recibe de su trabajo en una  en una compañía de limpieza de ropa como gerente. Este es el ingreso que tiene para Ella y su pequeño hijo que tiene bajo su responsabilidad ya que es madre soltera.
texts.en:
Yolanda's house doesn't have concrete flooring at the entrance and it doesn't have tiling in the interior of the house.

She requests a loan to purchase materials, including cement and tiles, and to hire a person to carry out the renovation. 

She plans on repaying her loan with the wages she earns from her employment as a manager of a dry-cleaning business. This is the income that she earns for herself and for her small son who is in her care. She is a single mother.

loans.use: to install flooring in her house.

loans.name: Sant Yalla Group

texts.fr:
Le groupe Sant Yalla a été créé le 15 Novembre 2006. Il est composé de dix femmes qui font toutes le petit commerce. Elles vivent dans le même quartier.

Madame Safiètou (debout à l’extrême gauche) est responsable du groupe. Elle a deux enfants, est mariée. Elle est âgée de 42 ans et a en charge sa belle sœur et beau père.

Elle vend des légumes dans son quartier. Elle a en ses actives quatre années d’expérience.

Avec ce nouveau prêt elle compte renforcer son chiffre d’affaire.

Elle désire aider son mari dans la prise en charge de la scolarité des enfants et de ses beaux parents.
texts.en:
The Sant Yalla was created on November 15, 2006. It is made up of ten women all living in the same neighborhood who operate small sales businesses.

Madame Safiètou (standing at the far left) is the leader of the group. Forty-two years old, she is married and the mother of two children. She also takes care of her sister-in-law and father-in-law. She sells vegetables in her neighborhood, and she has four years of experience.

With this new loan, she plans to boost her sales. She would like to help her husband to pay for the children's schooling and take care of his parents.

loans.use: to buy vegetables to sell.

loans.name: Luis Alberto

texts.es:
Luis Alberto tiene 28 años, Es casado vive con la esposa y los hijos, vive en el Cantón Ventanas Provincia de los Ríos. 

Los miembros de la V.R.C. SEÑOR DE LA SALUD, se encuentra ubicada en el Recinto Soloma, perteneciente al Cantón Echeandia, esta ventanilla se dedica a labores agrícolas de ciclo corto siembra de maíz y arroz

se dedica a la agricultura la siembra de maíz y arroz, las compras las realiza en Ventanas y las vende en las ferias de todos los días en especial  la de los domingos.

Solicita el crédito para la compra de semillas, fertilizantes y abonos.  Con el apoyo del crédito le ayudaría económicamente para suplir sus necesidades. Enfrentar desafíos como plagas y enfermedades en los cultivos  y la variación del clima. Su sueño es comprar un terreno.

Le gusta hacer deporte.
texts.en:
Luis Alberto is 28 years of age. He is married and lives with his wife and their children. He lives in the Ventanas Canton in the province of Los Ríos. 

He is a member of the communal bank Señor de la Salud [Lord of Health], located in the Soloma precinct belonging to the Echeandia canton. This bank centers on agricultural work focusing on the short-growth-cycle crops of corn and rice. He earns his living growing corn and rice. He makes his purchases in Ventanas and sells his crops at the daily outdoor markets and especially on Sundays. 

He is seeking the loan for buying seed, fertilizers and compost. The loan will supply him with the economic support he needs. He faces challenges such as pests and plant diseases in his crops and the variability of the weather. His dream is to purchase a plot of land. 

He likes to play sports.

loans.use: to buy seeds, fertilizers and compost.

loans.name: Gina

texts.en:
Gina is a 30-year-old woman with three children. She has had a sari-sari (variety) store for five years. She sells items like soft drinks, sugar, and tinned sardines to the people in her community. She earns about 6000 PHP per month from the store.

Gina will use her loan to buy more items to sell such as soft drinks, detergents, spices, etc. Gina hopes to expand her business in the future. She also hopes to be able to sustain her children's education.

loans.use: to buy more items to sell such as soft drinks, detergents, spices, etc.

loans.name: Rizk

texts.en:
This Kiva borrower is a 49-year-old married man living with his wife and three school-aged children. He is from Lebanon. 

He has been working as a mechanic for over 25 years. In 1991, he opened his own car repair shop. He specializes in repairing vehicle body-work. He provides his customers with top quality services and has two full-time employees helping him with the work. 

He has obtained his first Kiva loan and has been a very good client with punctual repayments. Today, he is requesting to borrow $1200 from Kiva partner Ameen s.a.l. to purchase additional tools for his business. He is confident that his work will continue to be successful in the coming years.

loans.use: to purchase additional tools needed for his business

loans.name: Digna Viviana

texts.es:
En el cantón Rocafuerte se  reúnen cada quince días las socias del Banco Comunal Mujeres Organizadas. Este lugar se lo conoce por sus deliciosos dulces que preparan los lugareños y que son reconocidos en todo el país.

La señora Viviana tiene 31 años de edad y mantiene una relación de unión libre de la cual ha procreado tres hijos de 12, 5 y 2 años, los mayores  estudian en colegio y  escuela. Su marido es profesor de un colegio de la ciudad. Está en el Banco Comunal desde el inicio, es la actual tesorera del banco y le gusta porque sus compañeras son muy responsables y le facilitan su labor como tesorera.

Ella para ganarse algo propio y con el fin de lograr un mejor futuro para su familia hace seis años empezó con su negocio de imprenta y papelería, después aumento lo que es  trabajos en computadoras, en su negocio también vende útiles escolares, libros y otros materiales que los estudiantes utilizan para su aprendizaje. Trabaja de lunes a sábado desde las 6h30 hasta las 21h00, en esto  le ayudan su mamá, su hermano y su esposo cuando este está desocupado, también realizan trabajos de mantenimiento de computadoras en su local.
 
Este crédito es para comprar más útiles escolares, papel, tinta, entre otras cosas.
 
Sus sueños son seguir adelante con su negocio y darles lo mejor a sus hijos.
texts.en:
Every two weeks, the members of the 'Mujeres Organizadas' community bank meet in Rocafuerte canton.  This place is known for the delicious sweet treats that the locals make.  They are well known throughout the country.

Viviana is 31 years old and lives with her common-law husband.  She has three children aged 12, 5 and 2.  Her eldest are in high school and elementary school.  Her husband is a teacher in a school in the city.  Viviana has been a member of her community bank from the start and is currently the bank's treasurer.  She likes it because her fellow members are very responsible and they make her job as treasurer easier.

In order to earn her own money and achieve a better future for her family, six years ago Viviana started her own printing and stationery business.  She then also added a service typing documents on a computer.  In her business she also sells school supplies, books and other materials that students use in their studies.  She works from Monday to Saturday, from 6.30am to 9.00pm.  Her mom and brother help her in her business, as does her husband when he has time free.  They also do computer maintenance work on their premises.

Viviana will use this loan to buy more school supplies, paper, ink, etc.  Her dreams are to continue to get ahead in her business and to provide her children with the best.

loans.use: to buy school supplies, paper, ink, etc.

loans.name: Cesar Antonio

texts.es:
Cesar hombre trabajador tiene a sus hijos estudiando en la primaria, que sean profesionales son las metas de alcanzar. Su  profesión es albañil y trabaja por cuentas propias desde hace tiempo, también tiene un pequeño negocio de alquiler de video juegos que le genera un ingreso mas.  Como proyecto es el mejoramiento poco a poco de la infraestructura de su casa. Para dejarle a sus hijos tenga comodidad y seguridad. 
Con el préstamo comprar materiales de construcción: cemento, arena, bloques, piedras canteras, estribu, tablones de madera, hierro, alambre de amarre entre otros materiales de construcción. ofreciéndole a sus hijos proteccion ante tantos disturbios que existen.
texts.en:
Cesar is a hardworking gentleman. His children attend elementary school and want to achieve their goal of becoming professionals. Cesar is a mason by trade and has been self-employed for some time. He also has a small business renting out video games as a source of extra income. His plans include gradually improving the infrastructure of his house so that he can provide his children comfort and security.

With this loan, Cesar will buy construction materials such as cement, sand, blocks, quarry stone, braces, wooden planks, iron, wire, and other items. This will provide protection for his children since there are disturbances that occur in the area.

loans.use: to purchase materials for building a security wall around his home.

loans.name: Fausto's Group

texts.es:
Fausto's Group está conformado por 5 personas: 3 Hombres y 2 Mujeres de los cuales Fausto es el presidente.

Fausto tiene 34 años vive en Urcuquí cerca de Ibarra con sus padres, es soltero no tiene hijos, se describe como una persona trabajadora, alegre y con el ánimo para salir adelantes.

Trabaja en la crianza de cerdos solo por 2 años, es la primera vez que solicita crédito a FODEMI, el crédito que solicita es para la compra de crías de cerdos blancos ya que estos son de buena calidad; gracias a este préstamo ayudaría a que su negocio crezca y así aumentarían sus ingresos y mejoraría la calidad de vida de su familia.

Su sueño es tener su propia casa y que su negocio siga crecieno y así poder distribuir sus cerdos a las grandes empresas; también su sueño es casarse y tener un hijo.
texts.en:
Fausto’s Group is made up of five people: three men and two women.  Fausto is group President.

Fausto is 34 years old and lives in Urcuquí near Ibarra with his parents.  He’s single and has no children.  He describes himself as a hardworking, cheerful person with the drive to get ahead.

He has been working raising pigs for just two years.  This is his first loan request to FODEMI.  The loan he’s requesting is to buy litters of white piglets because they are of good quality.  Thanks to this loan he’ll be able to help his business grow and thus to increase his income and improve his family’s quality of life.  His dream is to own a house and that his business continues to grow in order to sell his pigs to large firms.  He also dreams with getting married and having a son.

loans.use: to buy litters of white piglets because they are of high quality.

loans.name: Ikhtiyor

texts.ru:
Ихтиёр воспитанный, умный и добросовестный человек. Он женат и отец 3 детей. Более 10 лет Ихтиёр занимается купля продажей сухофруктов. Он покупает сухофруктов из местных рынков, а затем отправляет в Россию, чтобы продать и получить прибыли. А также он занимается приготовлением шашлыка и скотоводством. Ихтиёр хочет расширить свой бизнес и получит максимальной прибыли. Он хочет, устроит своих детей в хороших школах и университетах, чтобы они стали образованными и воспитанными людьми. Ихтиёр запрашивает займ 1500$ США для покупки сухофруктов и мясо. Он заранее благодарит всех кредиторов за поддержку и поощрение. 

More about Tajikistan and IMON International

Tajikistan is known for its rich history, which includes a key post along the Silk Road and the end of Alexander the Great's rule. It has also produced great thinkers, philosophers, scientists and poets, including Rudaki, Avicenna, Ferdowsi, Omar Khayyam, Jomi, and Rumi. The country is home to communities that still speak the ancient Sogdian language, epic mountain passes, and a civilization that dates back to the 4th millennium BC. And, even today, it is a complex mixture of the Islamic faith, Soviet culture, New West culture and Central Asian traditions.

But Tajikistan is also the poorest of the former Soviet republics. The civil war, which ignited soon after its independence from the U.S.S.R., further damaged the already weak economy. In addition, 93% of the country is mountainous and only 7% of the land is arable. These conditions have resulted in high levels of unemployment and have forced hundreds of thousands to seek work in other countries, mainly Russia. While the people of Tajikistan are working to improve its agricultural production and manufacturing sector, nearly two-thirds of the population still live in abject poverty.

IMON's History

Since December 2007, IMON International has worked closely with Kiva and Kiva lenders to ensure that poor and low income clients represent a viable business proposition. Funds raised through Kiva have already been distributed to thousands of IMON International's clients and will continue to provide thousands more with permanent access to the varied financial services they need. To learn more about IMON International's work, please visit: www.imon.tj
texts.en: Ikhtiyor is a well-mannered, smart and conscientious person.  He is married and is a father of three children.  Ikhtiyor is involved in buying and selling dried fruits.  He buys dried fruits from local markets and then sends them to Russia in order to sell and make profits.  He is also involved in preparing kebabs and animal husbandry.  Ikhtiyor wants to expand his business and maximize his profits.  He wants to place his children into good schools and universities, so that they grow up to be educated and well-mannered people.  Ikhtiyor is requesting a loan in the sum of $1500 for the purchase of dried fruits and meat.  He is grateful in advance to all creditors for the help and support.

loans.use: to purchase dried fruits and meat

loans.name: Gladys

texts.es: Gladys, de 31 años, vive en concubinato con José. Ambos tienen 2 hijos: Jair y Ángel; a los que cuida y alimenta en su casa propia ubicada en el caserío de Bellavista Huaracayo. Hace tal solo 9 años comenzó a dedicarse a la “agricultura”. Desde entonces alquila los terrenos agrícolas anualmente, donde siembra con la ayuda de sus esposo; alverja y demás hortalizas. Lo que más le gusta de su trabajo es estar en el campo “me siento tranquila”, afirma. Además cuenta que ella “nunca pierde”, pues cuando el precio de la alverja está bajo en el mercado, hace secar el grano; vendiendo después como semilla; donde obtiene un poco más del dinero invertido, ya que cada saco de semillas oscila entre los S/. 500 soles como mínimo. Su principal dificultad es no contar con terrenos propios, más aun tiene que gastar en el estudio de sus hijos. Por ello está pensando en ahorrar cada vez que pueda, para poder comenzar a comprar más terrenos agrícolas y de esa manera minimizar los gastos de arrendamiento. Ahora está pensando incursionar en la siembra de papa para esta temporada. Ella pertenece al banco comunal “Señor de Muruhuay”, y este es el tercer crédito con MFP, donde se siente segura, pues sabe que encontrará el apoyo que necesita. Razón por la que promete ser puntual en sus cuotas. Gladys de recibir su apoyo; invertirá el dinero solicitado en la compra de varios sacos de fertilizantes naturales y una bolsa de semilla de alverja para su próxima siembra.
texts.en: Gladys, age 31, lives with José. They have two children, Jair and Ángel. They care and provide for their children in their own home in the hamlet of Bellavista Huaracayo. Only 9 years ago she started farming. She leases her lands each year and plants with her husband's help. They sow peas and other vegetables. What she most enjoys about her work is being in the field; she says "I feel peaceful". She also says that she "never loses", because when the price of peas is low in the market, she dries the grain and sells it as a seed. This makes an earning of a little more than the invested money, since each bag of peas hovers around a minimum price of 500 soles. Her main difficulty is not having her own land, and having to pay for her children's studies. So, she plans to save at every opportunity in order to be able to buy more agricultural lands, thus minimizing the costs of leasing. She now plans to venture into sowing potato this season. She belongs to the “Señor de Muruhuay” communal bank, and this is her third loan with MFP. She feels secure because she knows that she will receive the support that she needs. For this reason she promises to be very punctual in repaying her quotas. Upon receiving your support, Gladys will invest the requested funds in the purchase of various bags of natural fertilizers and a bag of pea seeds for the next sowing season.

loans.use: to purchase a bag of pea seeds and bags of fertilizers.

loans.name: Jumelle Group

texts.fr:
JUMELLE est un regroupement de six femmes mariées qui ont en moyenne de 33 ans, 4 enfants et qui vivent majoritairement dans des  familles monogames dans la ville de Sikasso (3ème  région administrative du Mali). 
Elles sont à leur troisième prêt avec l’institution de microfinance Soro Yiriwaso afin de satisfaire le besoin de leurs clientèles et tous les deux prêts passés ont été remboursés sans aucune difficulté.
Madame  AMINATA,  fait le commerce de condiments alimentaires dans ce groupe de femmes  JUMELLE, elle est la troisième à gauche, en chemise rouge.
Elle compte acheter avec son  prêt, 3 cartons de cube magie, 25 kg de sel gemme, 50 kg d’oignons, 2 paniers de choux frais, 5 paniers de tomates fraiches, 10 boîtes de concentrées de tomates au grand marché de la ville de Sikasso et dans les villages avoisinants. Elle effectue sa vente au marché du quartier de Médine, en détail, au comptant et souvent à crédit à une clientèle essentiellement composée de femmes.
Elle  envisage réaliser un bénéfice mensuel moyen de 35 000 FCFA dont une partie est  utilisée  pour payer le prêt et son intérêt et l’autre pour son épargne.
texts.en:
Jumelle is a group of six married women who average 33 years of age with an average of four children each; the majority of them live in monogamous families in the town of Sikasso (Mali's third administrative region).

They are on their third loan from the microfinance institution, Soro Yiriwaso, with the objective of satisfying their customers' needs; the previous two loans were repaid without any difficulties.

Aminata trades in condiments in the Jumelle group and she is third from the left on the photo, wearing a red shirt.

With her loan she is planning to buy three cartons of Maggi stock cubes, 25kg of rock salt, 50kg of onions, two baskets of fresh cabbge, five baskets of fresh tomatoes and ten tins of tomato concentrate at Sikasso's grand market and in the neighboring villages. She sells her goods at the market in the Médine district, on a retail basis, for cash and often on  credit to a customer base made up principally of women.

She is expecting to make an average monthly profit of 35,000 FCFA, of which part will be used to pay off her loan and the interest and the rest saved.

loans.use: to buy condiments

loans.name: Martha

texts.es:
Martha, es originaria de Managua, pero habita en la ciudad de León, esta casada, tiene 39 años de edad, es madre de tres hijos de 11 ,9 y 2 años de edad respectivamente, ella es comerciante, es dueña de una pequeña pulpería. Empezó con este negocio por medio de una herencia antes se dedicaba a vender pollo pero después decidió poner su propia pulpería, su esposo la ayuda atender el negocio después del trabajo.
Ella esta solicitando el préstamo para  comprar productos tales como arroz, frijoles, azúcar, aceite, huevos, leche, pan, cosméticos, frutas, verduras, enlatados. El crédito le ayudaría a adquirir estos productos en mayor cantidad y tener más mercadería que ofrecer a sus clientes. Ella desea en lo futuro tener una distribuidora de productos alimenticios varios. Su meta próxima es lograr darles a sus hijos una carrera universitaria.
texts.en:
Martha is originally from Managua, but she lives in León. She is married, 39 years old, and is the mother of three children who are 11, 9, and 2 years old, respectively. She is a shopkeeper; she owns a small grocery store. She began this business through an inheritance. Before, she sold chicken, but afterwards she decided to open her own grocery store. Her husband helps her take care of the business after work.

She is requesting the loan to buy products such as rice, beans, sugar, oil, eggs, milk, bread, cosmetics, fruit, vegetables, and canned goods. The loan would help her acquire a larger quantity of these products and to have more merchandise to offer her customers. She wants, in the future, to have a distribution company for various food products. Her next goal is to provide her children with a college education.

loans.use: to buy products such as rice, beans, sugar, oil, eggs, milk, bread, cosmetics, fruit, vegetables, and canned goods.

loans.name: Purcita

texts.en:
Purcita is 58 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married with seven children. 
Purcita has a seafood shop where she sells products like squid and octopus. She has had this business for 10 years. She has requested a loan of PHP 15,000 to buy more seafood like squid and octopus to sell.
Purcita has been a member of HSPFI since 2010. In the future, Purcita hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy seafood products like squid and octopus.

loans.name: Martha

texts.es: Martha, de 30 años de edad, es una mujer decidida, alegre y emprendedora. Convive con su pareja y sus dos menores hijos en su casa propia, inmuebke que lograron comprar con mucho esfuerzo. El trabajo que realiza Martha, es la venta de raspadilla (esencia de frutas con hielo), en un puesto ambulante ubicado al frente de un centro educativo. Por tal razón es muy concurrida, ya sea por transeúntes y colegiales. Tiene tres años dedicándose a esta actividad, y en el que cuenta con el apoyo de una chica para atender a la clientela. Lo que le gusta de su actividad es que le permite tener un ingreso económico que ayuda con los gastos del hogar, sin embargo, cuando el clima no es favorable, la venta disminuye. Pero no se desanima y le gusta lo que hace, porque sabe que será recompensado. Este seria el crédito número nueve con la institución MFP. Por tanto espera el apoyo de cada uno de ustedes. Con el dinero solicitado, piensa mejorar su negocio, comprando una maquina para hacer raspadilla.
texts.en: Martha, 30 years of age, is a determined, happy and enterprising woman.  She lives with her spouse and her two minor children in her own home, a property that they managed to purchase through a lot of work.  Martha makes shaved ice confections (fruit essences with ice) in a mobile stand located in front of an educational center.  She gets a lot of traffic, from both passersby and students.  She has been doing this for three years and has a young lady helping her take care of the customers.  She likes her work because it gives her income that helps with the expenses of her home, however when the weather is not favorable her income decreases.  She does not despair and likes what she does and knows that she will be compensated.  This is her ninth loan with MFP and she is hoping for everyone's support.  With the loan money she plans to improve her business by purchasing a machine to make shaved ice.

loans.use: to purchase a ice shaving machine.

loans.name: Yurik

texts.ru:
Юрику 51 лет , родился и живет в  городе Капан. Имеет высшее образование,окончил Ереванский педагогический институт. В 1988 году женился и живет с женой. Имеет сына 22 лет который служит в армии,дочке 19 лет учится  на третьем курсе Ереванского лингвистического института ,по специальности преподаватель иностранных языков. Жена Юрика работает в военкомате города Капан.
Юрик  с 2006года  занимается дистрибютерской деятельностью . У Юрика контракт с фирмой который производит натуральньные соки, мороженое, печенье, кондитерские изделия ,мясные полуфабрикаты,котлеты и т.д. Все эти продукты и соки Юрик покупает оптом и доставляет из Еревана и оптом продает в  магазинах городов Капан,Каджаран,Агарак и Мегри. Для своего бизнеса Юрик  имеет склад и холодильные камеры у себя дома. 
Юрик  работает почти без выходных и уже имеет постоянных клиентов в этих городах, которые долгие годы предпочитают оптом покупать и в своих магазинах перепродавать товары которые привозит Юрик из Еревана. 
Благодаря выручке от своего бизнеса Юрик содержит семью и платит за учебу дочери .
Юрику нужен кредит 1.000.000 армянских драмов для покупки новых продуктов для Новогодней  и Рождественской продажи
texts.en:
Yurik is 51 years old. He was born and lives in the town of Kapan. He has higher education and graduated from the Pedagogical Institute of Yerevan. In 1988 he got married and now lives with his wife. He has a 22 year old son who is now serving in the army. His daughter is nineteen and she is studying in her junior year at the Yerevan Institute of Linguistics with specialty as a teacher of foreign languages. Yurik's wife works in the military recruitment office in the town of Kapan.

Yurik has been in the distribution business since 2006. He has a contract with a firm which manufactures natural juices, ice cream, cookies, confections, meat products, cutlets and etc. Yurik buys all these products and juices in wholesale, delivers them from Yerevan and then sells them in wholesale to the stores in towns of Kapan, Kadjaran, Agarak and Mergi. Yurik has storage and refrigerators in his house for the business. 

Yurik works almost without any days off and already has many regular customers in these towns who for many years prefer to buy in wholesale what Yurik brings from Yerevan and then sell in their own stores. Thanks to the profit from his business Yurik can support his family and pay for his daughter's education. Yurik needs a loan in the amount of 1,000,000 Armenian dram to buy new products for the New Year and Christmas sales.

loans.use: to buy new products for Christmas and New Year sales.

loans.name: Kevina

texts.en:
Kevina is 38 years old, married and a mother of five children living in Karuguuza, Uganda. She has no other dependents and lives with seven family members. Her family goal is to educate her children up to university.

For the past 15 years, she has been operating a retail shop. She faces the challenge of customers who don't pay her back after buying on credit, however she is optimistic that her business will grow and start dealing in wholesale. Kevina intends to use the loan to buy beer and soda to sell.

loans.use: to buy beer and soda to sell.

loans.name: Ekua

texts.en:
Ekua is a fishmonger at Watreso near Abura. She has done this for one year now. 

Ekua is married to a farmer and has two children. She uses her income to assist her husband in paying utility bills. 

She will use her loan to buy more fish. With her new profit, she will expand her business.

loans.use: to buy more fish.

loans.name: Ma. Susan

texts.en:
Ma. Susan is well known in her community as a "jolly and responsible person." She is 49 years old and married to Efren.  They have three adult-aged children. Her spouse works as a farmer. Ma. Susan is busy with her sari-sari store, a community-based store where she can sell different products.

Ma. Susan is requesting a loan of PHP 50,000 to purchase a variety of products that she can display in her store like drinks, spices, coffee and different vegetables. Ma. Susan hopes that someday she can give quality living conditions to her family.

loans.use: to purchase products such as drinks, spices, coffee, and vegetables for her store.

loans.name: Manuel

texts.en:
Manuel is 33 years old and serves as both father and mother to his two children. He was separated from his spouse, but according to him, though he was sad, he still became strong despite what had happened to their relationship. His two children motivate him to improve his crop production. He grows rice and sells it to traders in their village. He usually earns about P15,000 each harvest season of April and November.  His income was just enough to cover all their expenses, especially for school fees, so he needs to make improvements in his output.

He is now asking for a loan of P15,000 to buy farming inputs needed, such as fertilizers and pesticides.  Manuel would like to keep generating a good income from his business so that someday he will provide a better life for his family.

loans.use: to buy farming inputs needed, such as fertilizers and pesticides

loans.name: Lilian

texts.en: Lilian 26 years old, married, and has two children, ages three and six years. She describes herself as an honest and visionary woman. She sells clothes to residents in her home area. Her business involves movement from one place to another as she sells to customers, and this challenges her. She will be using the loan of Kes 20,000 to buy clothes to sell. Lilian's goal and hope is to run a boutique in the next five years.

loans.use: To buy more clothes for selling.

loans.name: Gregoria

texts.es:
La socia se sigue dedicando al negocio de venta de golosinas,ella vende chupetes,chicles,galletas y gaseosas,ella vende en forma ambulatoria desde las 8:00 a.m hasta las 6:00 p.m,por medio de este pequeño negocio la socia saca adelante a sus hijos,el sueño de la socia es tener un tienda de abarrotes.La socia solicita el credito para comprar galletas,caramelos,gaseosas y chupetes al por mayor.

La socia está feliz por el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con los pagos de su cuota.
texts.en:
Gregoria continues working in her business of selling candy.  She sells lollipops, gum, cookies, and soft drinks.  She sells in an itinerant manner from 8:00 a.m. until 6:00 p.m.  It is through this small business that she gets her children ahead.

Her dream is to have a grocery store.

She is requesting the loan to buy cookies, candy, soft drinks, and lollipops wholesale.

She is happy about the loan, and she pledges to make her payments on time.

loans.use: to buy cookies, candy, soft drinks, and lollipops wholesale.

loans.name: Rose

texts.en:
Rose is a 30 year old business lady with grocery, where she sells assorted vegetables.  She supports five member of her family. She has been in this business for the past 5years and earns a monthly income of Kshs 9000. 

She has requested for a loan of Kshs 52,000 that would help her purchase more groceries.  The profit she gets would enable her to expand her business. Rose’s dream is to educate herself to a higher level.

loans.use: To add more stock to her grocery store.

loans.name: Rosemarie

texts.en:
