Ana María invertirá el préstamo  en la compra de material escolar como cuadernos, hojas y demás.
texts.en:
The "Estrellas" (Stars) communal association, that is part of the Panamericana focal center, has 10 members. The woman are involved in the following businesses: sweatshirt sales, potato and dehidrated potato sales, sale of vegetables, school supplies and clothing; some provide public transportation services. One of the members, Ana María V., 48, has been a member for a year; she was invited to join by a girl friend. She sells school supplies and her highest sales occur at the beginning and half way through each year. During the rest of the year, sales are regular. She has her business in the 16 de Julio market and she has various customers. Ana María will use the funds to buy school supplies, such as: notebooks, paper, etc.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy school supplies.

loans.name: Alma Doris

texts.es: Alma Doris C. D. A. D. 46 años D. edad, resiD. en Soyapango, ubicado el departamento D. San Salvador. Vive junto a su esposo el cual se dedica a trabajar como empleado para una empresa privada, junto a sus dos hijos D. 14 y 4 años D. edad, quienes estudian y junto a su madre la cual se dedica a los quehaceres del hogar y a ayudarle con el cuidado D. los niños. Alma posee un puesto ambulante D. tostadas D. plátanos, yuca, los cuales se preparan con limón, chile y sal. Este negocio es ambulante debido a que ella trabaja en conjunto con una feria, la cual se va moviendo D. pueblo en pueblo en donD. se estén celebrando las fiestas patronales del lugar. Alma solicita un préstamo a través del cual pueda comprar mayor cantidad D. yuca y plátanos, así mismo comprar aceite para freírlos y todos los aderezos que necesita. D. esta manera es como Alma se ha ganado la vida durante muchos años, es por ello que desea poder invertir un poco más en el negocio y así aumentar sus ventas.
texts.en:
Alma Doris C. D. A. is 46 years old. She lives in Soyapango, located in the district of San Salvador. She lives together with her spouse, who works as an employee for a private company. She also lives with her two children, ages 14 and 4, who are in school, and with her mother, who does the housework and helps her care for the children. Alma owns a street stand for fried plantains and yuca, which are prepared with lime, chili, and salt. This business is mobile, requiring that she work jointly with a fair which moves from village to village, in which the patron saint festivals of the region are celebrated. Alma is requesting a loan through which she can buy a larger quantity of yuca and plantains, as well as buy oil to fry them and all of the seasonings she needs. Alma has maD. a living in this way for many years, and it is for that that she wishes to be able to invest a little more in the business and so increase her sales.

Translated from Spanish by Erin K., Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of plantains, yuca, and limes.

loans.name: Iyad

texts.en:
Iyad is a 36-year-old single man living with his mother and sister. He helps his mother with the family expenses after the death of his father.

Iyad has owned a carpentry shop for the past eight years and produces all types of wood products upon request of his clients. Today, Iyad is requesting $1,000 to purchase additional wood to be able to present a variety of products to his customers and to increase his income.

Iyad is certain that, with the help of the loan requested, he will be able to develop his business in the coming years.

loans.use: To purchase additional wood

loans.name: Group For Used Shoes

texts.en:
Solomon G. is the leader of a group of five borrowers called 'Group For Used Shoes'. He is 40 years old, single, and has three children who range from 5 to 17 years old. He was only able to attend school through 12th grade due to poverty.

For four years, he has been selling used shoes on Mechlin Street downtown Monrovia, Liberia.  He sells in a friendly manner which keeps customers returning.  He plans to use his 9,000 Liberian dollar portion of this 42,800 Liberian dollar group loan to buy more used shoes.  His goal is to grow his business and to continue to support his children so that they can have a better future.

In the photo that accompanies this profile, Solomon is the one holding the sign.

loans.use: To buy more used shoes

loans.name: God Is Able Group

texts.en:
Marthaline L., who is holding the sign, is the leader of a group of five borrowers called God Is Able. She is 35 years old, married and has four children who range from 4 to 19 years. She cares for two siblings. She is also a nursing student.

For 12 years, she has been selling palm oil at the Redlight Market in Paynesville, Liberia. She started selling with 1,500 Liberian Dollars and now has 20,000 Liberian dollars as working capital.

She plans to use her 12,000 Liberian Dollars portion of this 53,000 Liberian Dollars group loan amount to buy more palm oil.

Her goal is to grow her business and to continue to support her children so that they can have a better future. She describes herself as a God-fearing woman who likes to take good care of her children.

In the photo that accompanies this profile, group member Edith is inset at lower right because she was absent during interview.

loans.use: To buy more palm oil.

loans.name: Jaquilyn

texts.en: Jaquilyn M. is from the village of San Jose. She is 22 years old, is married, and has two infant children. Jaquilyn owns and operates a general store, selling a variety of different products in the local community. She has been engaged in her business for over four years and earns approximately 3,500 PHP a month. In 2009, Jaquilyn joined ASKI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities. She has successfully repaid a previous loan of 5,000 PHP from ASKI. This previous loan was used to purchase additional products to sell. Jaquilyn is requesting a new loan of 10,000 PHP which will be used to purchase new items to expand her product offering. This loan will be her second from ASKI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve and expand her business. About ASKI: ASKI is one of the most successful microfinance institutions in the Philippines. It has twenty-one branches covering the Central and Northeastern areas. Its clients are mostly of farmers, fisherfolk and small entrepreneurs. *Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase new items to expand her product offering

loans.name: Susita

texts.en:
Susita M. is from the town of Banga. She is 54 years old. Susita is married and has nine children. While some of her children have already finished college, she still has kids who go to school. Susita owns & operates an agricultural business, planting and harvesting rice for sale. She works hard to sustain her family and her children's education.

Susita joined CEVI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities. She has successfully repaid a previous loan from CEVI. Susita is requesting a new loan of 15,000 PHP which will be used to purchase fertilizers, such as manure, and other farm inputs. This loan will be the sixth loan taken out by Susita from CEVI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated to pay her children's tuition fees.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizers and other farm inputs

loans.name: Salvacion

texts.en: Salvacion C. is a 51-year-old married woman who supports her family by engaging in a general store business. She lives in Purok Antolanga, Barangay Tinongan, Isabela, Negros Occidental, with her husband, Romeo, and their two children who are 19 and 28 years old. Salvacion has been a member of NWTF-Project Dungganon since 2000 and has improved her living conditions with the help of her loans from NWTF and through her own efforts. By working hard in her general store business, she is gradually making her family more economically stable. She now earns an average monthly income of Php 6,000. Salvacion is now borrowing Php 17,500 so that she can use it as an additional working capital for her general store. This will be her 14th loan from NWTF-Project Dungganon. Her previous loan of Php 17,000, which she paid off well within its term, was just another step in her journey towards economic freedom. Salvacion aspires to elevate her family’s living conditions and ensure their future wellbeing by following the “Dungganon” way. About NWTF: In a world full of challenges, Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation (NWTF), is making a difference in the lives of thousands of women through Project Dungganon (a Hiligaynon word that means Honorable). Through the alleviation program, NWTF is empowering these women to progress out of earning less than $1 a day to achieving realities that surpass even their dreams. They have taken a life path that will ultimately make them Dungganon - a title of esteem that is bestowed to a member of a community who has earned the respect through a lifetime of hard and honest work.

loans.use: To use as additional working capital for her general store

loans.name: Sainoding

texts.en:
Sainoding R. is from the village of San Roque, Barinaut, Iligan City. He is 22 years old and single. To make a living, Sainoding owns and operates a business venture in the retail sector running a sari-sari (variety) retail shop. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from selling both food & daily use products in the local community. Sainoding has been engaged in his business for over a year and earns approximately 8,500 PHP a month from these activities.

In 2010, Sainoding joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve his living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Sainoding has successfully repaid a previous loan of 5,000 PHP from HSPFI. This previous loan was used to to purchase additional products to sell. Sainoding is requesting a new loan of 8,000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional inventory & working capital. This loan will be the second loan taken out by Sainoding from HSPFI. He plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to further improve his business. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional inventory & working capital

location.town: San Roque, Iligan City, Lanao del Norte

loans.name: Julienne

texts.en:
Julienne is 25 years old and has 3 children who range from the age of 2-12 years.  All of the children are in school apart from the youngest.  Her husband is a businessman.

Julienne has a shop which contains sugar, Vaseline, salt, etc. She has done this business for 12 years and she aims to have a wholesale shop. She is requesting a loan to increase the number of items she sells in her store.

loans.use: Purchasing items to sell in her store

loans.name: Rodel

texts.en:
Rodel D. is from the village of Namnama. He is 35 years old, married and has 2 infants. To make a living, Rodel owns & operates a transportation business. The main source of income for the business comes from providing motorcycle transport in the local community. Rodel has been engaged in his business for over 6 years and earns approximately 3500 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2009, Rodel joined ASKI to gain access to financial services to help improve his living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Rodel has successfully repaid a previous loan of 7000 PHP from ASKI. Rodel is requesting a new loan of 7000 PHP which will be used to repair a transport vehicle used in the business. This loan will be Rodel's 3rd loan from ASKI. He plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand his business.

About ASKI: ASKI is one of the most successful microfinance institutions in the Philippines. It has 29 branches covering the Central and Northeastern areas. Its clients are mostly of farmers, fisherfolks and small entrepreneurs. *Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to repair a transport vehicle used in the business

loans.name: Maria Del Socorro

texts.es: La señora Maria del Socorro se dedica a la venta y destace de cerdo. Pues no es el primer crédito que solicita ya que tiene cierta experiencia para mejorar su negocio. Ella siempre ha sido una mujer muy emprendedora por lo que le gusta luchar y sacar a sus hijos adelante, pues su negocio ha crecido con el paso del tiempo. Este crédito es para  mejorar su negocio y comprar cerdos. Ella sueña con obtener una pulpería, ya que así ganaría más ingresos para su familia.
texts.en:
Señora Maria del Socorro earns her living by selling pork. As this isn’t her first loan, she has some experience using money to improve her business. She has always been an enterprising woman so she enjoys the daily struggle and helping her children make their way in the world. Her business has grown over the years. Maria will use this loan to improve her business and buy pigs. Her dream is to own a grocery store as this would provide a greater income for her family.

Translated from Spanish by Jane Agg, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: working capital

loans.name: Anonymous

texts.en:
This Kiva borrower is a 36-year-old married man and the father of three school-aged children. He is an experienced construction worker. He is especially talented at completing woodwork and gypsum board projects. He has been working from the past 15 years in this occupation. And he started working independently in his business back in 2000. He works hard to satisfy all alone the demands of his family. 

Today, he is requesting to borrow US$ 1200 from Kiva partner Ameen s.a.l.  to purchase more wood for his work on his newest project. In the future, he is planning to expand his business by opening a construction office and working with some construction entrepreneurs.

loans.use: to purchase more wood

loans.name: Lydia

texts.en:
Lydia N. is 17 years old and lives in the town of Kireka in the Kampala East region of Uganda. She is single and has no children. Lydia has a business of making charcoal stoves, which she has done for two years.         

To help expand her business, Lydia has requested a loan of 200,000 Ugandan Shillings from BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to purchase more clay soil.  

With the help of the loan from BRAC, Lydia hopes to generate greater profits and pay school fees for her siblings and pay for food. In the future, Lydia hopes to go back to school and own a retail shop. 

Lydia is a member of BRAC’s Empowerment and Livelihood for Adolescents (ELA) program, which has helped her prospects for the future by teaching her about computers and providing counseling and guidance.

loans.use: More clay soil for making charcoal stoves

loans.name: Loice

texts.en:
Loice M. is 35 years old. She is married to Francis Ngugi, and has been blessed with one child.

Loice operates a Mpesa store and sells gas-filled cylinders in Mtwapa, Mombasa.  She has been in business for the last six years and has done very well. She is involved with KADET and is now requesting her second loan, which she intends to use to add working capital to her Mpesa business. She will use the anticipated profit to boost her gas-selling business.

In the future Loice hopes to open a big store.

loans.use: to add working capital to her business

loans.name: Nahila

texts.ar:
: ناهله في عمر 36 سنة غير متزوجة تعمل في مجال الملابس والايشاربات النسائية ناهله متعلمة وصاحبة طموح كبير تحب عملها وتعمل فيه
منذ اكثر من 7 سنوات هي تحب التجارة وتريد ان تتطور وان تبني لها عائلة وتكون عائلتها ذات مستوى معيشي مريح تلقى دائما دعم كبير من عائلتها لتطوير عملها 
تريد من خلال طلب قرض لها من المجموعة الى شراء بضاعة جديدة للمحل وزيادة البضاعة بمناسبة الاعياد ليس لديها اي صعوبة في التطور فهي مجدة ونشيطة
texts.en: Nahila, 36, is single. She works in the women's clothing and scarves business. She is educated and highly ambitious, with a passion for her work. Nahila has been working in this business for more than seven years. She likes trade and wishes to develop her business. Nahila wishes to build a family of her own with a good standard of living. She enjoys huge support from her family to develop her business. Nahila wishes to get a loan from A. Majmoua to buy new stock for her shop and to increase the current stock for it is now feast time and thus a selling season. Being active and a hard worker, Nahila can easily manage to develop her business.

loans.use: To buy new stock for her shop during the selling season and develop her business

loans.name: Doris Gabriela

texts.es:
Doris Gabriela B. M. tiene 20 años. Vive en Unión Libre  vive con el compañero y los hijos, vive  en el cantón de Ventanas en la Provincia de Los Ríos. Tiene 2 hijos.
 
Los miembros de la V.R.C. El LA UNION se encuentra ubicada en el recinto Aguas Frías, perteneciente al cantón Ventanas, esta ventanilla se dedica a labores agrícolas de ciclo corto siembra de maíz, arroz y fréjol, esta actividad llevan mucho tiempo haciéndolo.

Doris se dedica a la agricultura especialmente ala siembra de maíz, arroz y fréjol desde hace 2 años. Compra sus productos en Ventanas y los vende en la feria de Ventanas y en el mismo recinto.

Solicita el crédito para la comprar de insumos agrícolas y fertilizantes para los cultivos. Con el apoyo del crédito le ayudaría económicamente para suplir sus necesidades. Enfrentan desafíos como las plagas y enfermedades y la variedad del clima. Su sueño es tener dinero para la educación de sus hijos y construir la casa.
Le gusta hacer deporte salir a caminar con la familia
texts.en:
Doris Gabriela B. M. is 20 years of age.  She lives in Unión Libre with her companion and children.  She lives in the Ventanas canton in the Province of Los Ríos. She has 2 children.
 
The members of the V.R.C. El LA UNION are found in the Aguas Frías region, belonging to the Ventanas canton.  This branch is dedicated to agricultural workers who grow crops with a short growing cycle such as corn, rice and beans.  This activity requires a great deal of time.  

Doris has been dedicated to agriculture, especially the growing of corn, rice and beans for 2 years.  She buys her products in Ventanas and sells them in the Ventanas market and in the same area.  

She requests the loan to buy agricultural supplies and fertilizer for her crops.  The support of the loan will help her economically to supply her needs.  She faces challenges such as plagues, diseases and changes in the climate.  Her dream is to have money for the education of her children and to build a house.  She likes to play sports and go for walks with the family.

loans.use: To buy agricultural supplies and fertilizer for the cultivations.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase a water tank.

loans.name: Felicien

texts.en:
Felicien is 31 years old and single. He has three years of experience in tailoring and selling handmade clothes. Felicien makes different types of clothing including clothes for wedding ceremony rentals. His business is open daily from seven in the morning through nine at night. 

Felicien’s loan will help him to buy different colors and quantities of cloth and thread to boost sales and maximize profit.  The loan he requested via Vision Finance Company will improve his well-being. In the future, Felicien has plans to build a house.

loans.use: to buy different colors and quantities of cloth and thread

loans.name: Kuy

texts.en:
Kuy S. presently weaves bamboo baskets for sale. He sells his finished products in and around his community. He makes over 50 sets of baskets before selling out. He also orders baskets from the other villagers and sells them, to make additional income. His wife helps him to buy the raw materials and in weaving the baskets. 

Kuy S. and his wife use his old motor bike to pick up the finished products. Unfortunately, this existing motorcycle had broken down during use. Because does not have enough savings to buy a new motorbike, Kuy S. has decided to look for lenders on Kiva. Kuy S. is a 25-year-old married man blessed with two school-aged children.

loans.use: To buy a motor bike to replace the broken one.

loans.name: Reyes Carvajal Group

texts.es: El Banco D. Emprendimiento Reyes Carvajal es un banco que se fundo en la zona que tiene el mismo nombre al sur D. la ciudad D. la paz, es una zona que esta situada sobre un pequeño cerro, al cual solamente ingresa una línea D. minibuses. El banco D. emprendimiento esta compuesto por 8 socias las cuales se dedican a diversos trabajos para poder sobresalir adelante, tal es el caso D. la presidenta, la Sra. Daría quien se dedica a la venta D. comida en la parada D. minibuses D. su misma zona, ella vive con el esposo ya que sus hijos son mayores D. edad y ya tienen  sus propias familias. La Sra. invertirá el préstamo para el aumento D. mercadería en su kiosco comprar abarrotes como arroz, aceite, papa, etc.  Y así poder generar mayores ingresos para su familia, es un apersona muy trabajadora y esta agradecida con la institución por el apoyo brindado.
texts.en: The "Emprendimiento Reyes Carvajal" bank is a bank that was founded in the zone that has the same name in the south of the city of La Paz. It is a zone that is located on a small hill, which is only accessible by a line of small buses. The enterprising bank is maD. up of eight members which do various jobs to get ahead in society. This is also the situation of the president, Mrs. Daría, who sells food at the bus stop in her own area. She lives with her husband. Her children are older and already have their own families. She will invest the loan by purchasing merchandise for her kiosk such as rice, oil, potatoes, etc. In this way, she will be able to generate a greater income for her family. She is a very hard-working person and is thankful to the institution for the support it offers.

loans.use: Purchase groceries

loans.name: Diana Roxana

texts.es:
La señorita Diana, es socia del banco comunal Mujeres Del 2000, del Distrito de Calleria, Departamento de Ucayali, tiene 22 años de edad, es soltera y lleva trabajando con los préstamos de Manuela Ramos desde hace un año, éstos préstamos le han servido para poder aumentar su capital.
Ella se dedica a la venta de productos de belleza por catálogo, productos como Esika y otros, le va muy bien porque sus clientes son puntuales con sus pagos.  Acaba de terminar la carrera de educación y está en busca de trabajo, pero seguirá con su negocio.
Con este nuevo préstamo de S/.1,500.00 nuevos soles comprará 2 colonias agu, 2 talcos, 3 cremas para mano y cuerpo, una crema para depilar, 3 perfumes para damas, 1 perfume para caballero, 2 colonias refrescantes.
La señorita Diana tiene ganas de crecer en su negocio y espera que todo lo vaya bien y pueda a ayudar a su madre económicamente y poder estar más tranquila.
texts.en:
Diana is a member of the communal bank Mujeres Del 2000 (Women of 2000), in the District of Calleria, Ucayali state. She is 22 years old and single.  She has been working with loans from Manuela Ramos for one year.  These loans have helped her increase her capital.  She sells beauty products through a catalog, such as Esika and others.  Her business is going well because her customers are punctual with their payments.  She just completed her Education degree and is looking for work, but she will continue with her business.  

With this loan of 1,500.00 new soles, she will purchase 2 Agu baby colognes, 2 talcum powders, 3 hand and body creams, one hair removal cream, 3 ladies perfumes, one men's cologne, and 2 refreshing colognes.

Diana wants to grow her business and hopes that everything goes well so that she can help her mother financially and be more relaxed.

loans.use: To purchase 2 Agu baby colognes, 2 talcum powders, 3 hand and body creams, one hair removal cream, 3 ladies perfumes, one men's cologne, and 2 refreshing colognes.

loans.name: Linda

texts.en:
Linda V. is from the village of Wadya, Banisilan, Cotabato. She is 42 years old. Linda is married and has 3 school-aged children. To make a living, Linda owns & operates a sari-sari (variety) retail shop. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes from buying and selling daily use products such as shampoo, soap, canned goods, snack foods & breads in the local community. Linda has been engaged in her business for over 12 years and earns approximately 7500 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2007, Linda joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Linda has successfully repaid a previous loan of 15,000 PHP from HSPFI. This previous loan was used to to purchase additional inventory and as working capital. Linda is requesting a new loan of 15,000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional products to sell like canned goods & snack foods. This will be the 12th loan taken out by Linda from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand her business. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is an accredited partner of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and reaches out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase additional products to sell like canned goods & snack foods

loans.name: Josefa

texts.es:
Josefa, de 53 años, vive en su casa que es propia al lado de sus 3 hijos mayores, su yerno y sus 4 nietos, juntos y con muchas ganas de alcanzar el progreso habitan en un barrio populoso ubicado en la  zona norte de la ciudad.  

Desde muy joven se dedica a la venta de comida y refrescos oriundos  del norte del Perú. Aprendió observando como su madre mezclaba los diferentes ingredientes para obtener exquisitos potajes, y luego que pasaron los años, instaló su propio negocio en un mercado mayorista de la zona donde vive; aunque el local es alquilado. Dice que el trabajo es tranquilo, pues ya tiene clientes fijos, lo que le permite obtener ganancias diarias,  de esta manera logro sacar  adelante a sus 3 hijos; y en la actualidad la menor le ayuda  en la venta de comida. Lo que no le gusta es que hace algunos meses reubicaron a los comerciantes del mercado, pero a pesar de esta dificultad tiene muchos comensales. Y como es una mujer muy emprendedora para mas adelante tiene planeado ampliar su negocio e implementarlo con mejores utensilios para ofrecer un mejor servicio a sus comensales. 

Josefa tiene planeado invertir el dinero solicitado en la compra de ingredientes que necesita al por mayor, ya que desea aumentar la cantidad de platillos que ofrece al día, así espera mejorar sus ganancias.

Es el segundo crédito que tiene con MFP, y promete cumplir puntualmente con el pago de sus cuotas, pues no quiere decepcionar a todas las personas que hicieron posible el dinero que le permitirá continuar trabajando.
texts.en:
53-year old Josefa lives in her own home with her three adult children, son-in-law, and four grandchildren. All have a great desire for a better future. They live in a densely populated neighbourhood in the north part of the city.

Ever since she was young, Josefa has earned her living by selling the traditional food and drink of northern Peru. She learned by watching how her mother mixed the different ingredients resulting in delicious soups. Then the years passed and eventually Josefa started her own business in a wholesale market in the area where she lives. She rents a stall there. The work is peaceful as she has regular clients giving her steady income with which to support her three children. Her youngest now helps her sell food.

One problem has been that a few months ago the market stallholders were relocated but in spite of that, there were still many visitors to her stall. As Josefa is an enterprising women, she is planning to expand her business in the future and equip it with better cooking utensils so she can provide her customers with better service.

This is her second loan with Kiva partner MFP and she promises to make the repayments punctually as she doesn’t want to disappoint all the people who made donations to allow her to continue working in her business.

loans.use: to buy ingredients

loans.name: Bayanjargal

texts.en: Bayanjargal, 21, is single and lives with his mother and his siblings in Zavhan province of Mongolia. They live in a ger, a Mongolian nomadic housing tent, on a small plot of land. His mother is unemployed. One of his brothers attends a college, while the other two brothers attend a local secondary school and a kindergarden respectively. Bayanjargal began driving a taxi in 2006. His father passed away last year, and he is now responsible for his family. He is a hardworking and modest person. He says, "I am the one who is responsible for the family now. My father was a driver and mechanic. From now on, I will continue his work, as I learned a lot from him. I am trying hard to increase my profit because I will pay the tuition fees of my brothers and repay the bank loans." He is requesting a loan of 500,000 MNT to purchase spare parts for his car.

loans.use: To purchase spare parts

loans.name: Benijean Donal

texts.fr:
Benijean est un client de Hope Congo age de 28 ans , marie et père de 2 enfants dont l'age varie entre 4 et 8 ans.
Prenant conscience de sa charge, il ouvre un stand d'alimentation ou il vend des produits de première nécessité comme le lait, bougie , savons, pains et  conserves.
Ayant déjà bénéficié de deux cycle de prêts ,il a rembourse sans trop de difficultés et a fait des épargnes considérables.
Pour ce troisième prêt, il compte élargir son stand en achetant des cartons de lait en poudre et écrémé, des cartons de bougies, de conserves, des bidons d'huile et tous les produits de première nécessité.
Pour le futur il pense ouvrir une boutique d'alimentation et avec ses bénéfices il pense améliorer les conditions de vie de sa famille et prendre en charge la scolarité de ses enfants.
texts.en:
Benijean is a client of Hope Congo. He is 28 years old, married, and the father of two children, 4 and 8 years of age.

Aware of his responsibilities, he opened a food stand where he sells staples such as milk, candles, soap, bread, and canned goods. 

He received two previous loans. He repaid them without difficulty and boosted his savings considerably. With this third loan, he plans to expand his business by purchasing cartons of powdered milk and skimmed milk, boxes of candles, canned goods, cans of oil, and all other essential goods.

His goal for the future is to open a food store and use the profits to improve the living conditions for his family, and to support his children’s education.

loans.use: to buy boxes of canned goods, cartons of powdered milk, boxes of candles

loans.name: Mujeres Exitosas Group

texts.es:
Este Comité se formó gracias a la Señora María Esther Q. R., domiciliada en la cuidad de Villarrica, ella invitó a sus amigas y encantadas aceptaron conformar el Comité de Mujeres Rurales nombrando al Comité "Mujeres Exitosas".
Las integrantes del comité se dedican a la artesanía, que es un trabajo que heredaron de sus padres y va pasando de generación en generación.
Ellas confeccionan hermosas prendas de vestir como ser: camisas, manteles, y todo tipo de bordados en ao poi. También se dedican al comercio de esas artesanías.
Este grupo es un grupo muy unido y solidario, ya que las señoras constantemente hacen actividades para ayudarse entre todas.
Con la ayuda que le ofreció la Fundación Paraguaya, este comité logró mejorar sus ingresos ya que solicitaron un crédito para invertir en sus negocios, para de esta forma mejorar sus condiciones de vida y la de su familia.
Como es el caso de la sra. María Esther, quien es la que más antigüedad tiene en el rubro de la artesanía y lo hace solamente para mejorar el nivel de vida de sus hijos, más que la de si misma, ella es una mujer emprendedora y muy sacrificada que tiene la esperanza en que Kiva la ayudará.
texts.en:
This committee was formed thanks to María Esther Q. R. who lives in Villarrica.  She invited her friends to form the Committee of Rural Women called “Mujeres Exitosas” (Successful Woman).

The members of the committee are artists, an art that they learned from their parents, passed from generation to generation.

They make beautiful clothing like shirts, aprons, and all types of embroidery in ao poi.  They also sell these items.  This group is very united and the women constantly work together to help one another.

With the help of Fundación Paraguaya, the members of this committee were able to improve their incomes after they requested a loan with which to invest in their businesses.  This allowed them to improve their families’ living conditions, as is the case for María Esther, who has been an artist the longest and does it only to improve the quality of life for her children as well as for herself.  She is an enterprising woman who makes lots of sacrifices and hopes that Kiva will help her.

loans.use: to buy arts and crafts supplies

loans.name: Graciela

texts.es:
Graciela tiene 53 años de edad, ella es viuda con 03 hijos a su cargo.  Vive en casa propia con sus hijos,  dicha casa está ubicada en el caserío Guaraguaos Alto en el distrito de Tambogrande del departamento de Piura.  Graciela vive en la parte rural de este distrito, pero solo cuenta con servicio de luz.

Graciela se dedica a la crianza de ganado ovino(ovejas), vacuno(vacas), porcino(chanchos)y a la agricultura, esta actividad la realiza desde hace 10 años.  Cuenta con corrales apropiados y espaciosos.  Los ovinos y porcinos cuando alcanzan tamaño y peso ideal los comercializa en el mercado local. Las vacas de producen leche la cual vende diariamente. Complementariamente cuenta con  terrenos agrícolas, en el cual cultiva mango.

Graciela esta solicitando un préstamo a Edpyme Alternativa de 2500 nuevos soles, para la compra de alimentos balanceados para sus animales y la implementación un corral para los chanchos.

Graciela, es una clienta nueva para Edpyme Alternativa, sin embrago ya ha manejado distintos créditos, con un buen historial crediticio, ha demostrado su responsabilidad y puntualidad en sus pagos.
texts.en:
Graciela is 53 years old, widowed, and has three dependent children. She and her children live in their own home located in the village of Guaraguaos Alto in the District of Tambogrande, Department of Piura. Graciela lives in the rural section of the district and the only service she receives is electricity.

She earns her living by farming and raising animals such as sheep, cows, and pigs. Graciela has been in this business for 10 years. The animals are kept in their respective pens and have plenty of space. When the sheep and pigs have reached the ideal size and weight, they are sold at the local market. The cows produce milk which she sells on a daily basis. To complement raising animals, Graciela also has farmland on which she grows mangos.

Graciela is requesting a loan from Edpyme Alternativa in the amount of 2500 PEN in order to buy balanced feed for her animals and to build a pig pen. Even though Graciela is a new client of Edpyme Alternativa, she has managed different loans in the past. She has a good credit history and has demonstrated that she is responsible and prompt with her payments.

loans.use: to purchase balanced feed for her animals and materials to build a pig pen.

loans.name: Marisol Del Socorro

texts.es:
Marisol, nació en la capital Managua, pero actualmente vive en León lleva 20 años de vivir en este departamento, esta casada, tiene un hijo, ella se dedica a vender  ropa nueva, carteras, zapatos, lleva en esta actividad tres años. Cuando ella inicio fue con capital propio antes su esposo  tenia una panadería en la cual ella lo ayudaba a atender ese negocio pero después  lo quitaron, su esposo decidió poner un gym y ella decidió vender ropa , zapatos, perfumes, así fue ganado clientela poco a poco hasta hoy en día que tiene clientes fijos . Aunque ella solo pudo estudiar hasta tercer año de secundaria ha sabido salir adelante con lo poco que ha aprendido, y no quiere que su hijo pase por la situación de pobreza que vivió ella pues desea que se prepare, tenga una carrera profesional 
Ella solicito el préstamo para comprar inventario nuevo como ropa, zapato, carteras , pailas ollas ,vasijas alusivas al día de la madre, ya que ella considera una temporada buena para el comercio. Con esta inversión espera mejorar las ventas, incrementar su ganancias, hacer nuevos clientes.
Ella desea ampliar su negocio, planea poner una tienda de ropa en su casa. Su meta próxima es ahorrar para poder ayudar a su hijo, apoyarlo para su graduación.
texts.en:
Marisol was born in the capital city, Managua, but currently lives in León. She has lived in the region for 20 years. She is married with one child. She sells new clothes, handbags and shoes. 

She has been in this line of business for three years. She started out with her own capital. Her husband used to have a bakery and she helped him with the business. When they quit, her husband decided to open a gym and she started to sell clothes, shoes and perfumes. She slowly gained new customers and today she has a stable client base. Although she was only able to study up to her junior year at high school, she has managed to make do with however little she learned. She doesn't want her son to live in poverty, which she experienced, and so she would like him to study and have a career. 

She is requesting the loan to buy new stock such as clothing, shoes, handbags, pots, pans and vases for Mother's Day, which she considers a good time of the year for trading. With the investment she hopes to improve sales, increase profits and win new customers. 

She would like to expand her business and is considering opening a clothing store at home. Her next goal is to save up so as to be able to help her son graduate.

loans.use: to buy new stock, such as clothing, shoes and handbags.

loans.name: Judith

texts.es: Judith es una mujer emprendedora de 40 años, está casada con Marino de 40 años, ambos tienen 5 hijos, pero viven solo con dos de ellos, Fiorela de 9 y Medaly de 3 años, en su casa propia ubicada en el pueblo de Pian. Desde hace 3 años se dedica a la venta de menestras, máchica y 7 semillas (harina típica de la zona andina de Perú, en donde se concentra gran cantidad de vitaminas). Como todos los días ella sale a vender sus productos en su tienda, ubicada en el centro del pueblo. Lo que más le gusta su trabajo es la venta de estos productos porque le parece muy rentable, es por eso que decidió hace un año llevar sus productos a la capital de su país para poder vender; como mujer ambiciosa también cultiva cebada con su esposo, quien se dedica al cuidado de sus sembríos; ayudándole cuando dispone de tiempo. Para el futuro está hermosa familia piensa incrementar su capital para poder aumentar sus ganancias y de esa manera brindarle una mejor vida a sus hijas, a las que quieren ver desarrolladas y con un nivel de educación superior a ellos. Además de invertir en la mejora de su pequeña casita. Ella pertenece al banco comunal “Sarita Colonia”, y este es el décimo crédito con MFP, donde espera tener el apoyo financiero para poder concretizar sus objetivos. Por otro lado se compromete una vez más a cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas, como en anteriores créditos que tuvo. Además le agrada ser parte de su banco comunal porque todos sus integrantes son personas responsables y muy solidarias. Judith, invertirá el dinero solicitado en la compra de insumos para la realización de la harina que vende; asimismo comprará varios sacos de abono orgánico para sus sembríos de cebada.
texts.en:
Judith is an entrepreneurial 40 year-old woman who is married to 40 year-old Marino.  They have five children but only live with two of them: 9 year-old Fiorela and 3 year-old Medaly.  They live in their own home, in the village of Pian.

For three years, Judith has been selling mixed veg, 'máchica' (roasted cornmeal) and seven grain (a typical flour from the Andean region of Peru which contains a lot of vitamins).  Every day, she goes out to sell her products in her store which is located in the center of the village.    What she most enjoys about her work is selling these products because it is very profitable.  For this reason, one year ago she decided to take her products to the capital city to sell.  As an ambitious woman, Judith also grows barley together with her husband who looks after the crops, helping him when she has time.

In the future, this beautiful family is thinking of increasing their capital so that they can increase their profits and thereby provide their daughters with a better life.  They want to see their daughters progress and gain a university-level of education.  Judith would also like to invest in making improvements to her small home.

Judith is a member of the "Sarita Colonia" community bank and this is her tenth loan from MFP, from whom she hopes to gain financial support so that she can achieve her goals.  On her part, she pledges once again to make her repayments on time as she has with her previous loans.  Judith enjoys being a member of her community bank because all the members are responsible people who are very supportive of each other.  She will invest the money she has requested in buying supplies for making the flour that she sells.  She will also buy several sacks of organic fertilizer for her barley crop.

loans.use: to buy supplies for making flour and also sacks of fertilizer

loans.name: Byambagerel

texts.en: Byambagerel is 35 years old and lives with her brother-in-law and daughter in a house in the Sansar area, Ulaanbaatar, the capital city of Mongolia. Her daughter, age 5, attends kindergarten and her brother-in-law manages a taxi service business. She conducts a meat trading business with the help of her older two sisters at a rented stall at a trading center. She started her business after her secondary school graduation and gained much experience. With 10 years of business operation she has been able to stabilize her business and build a strong customer base. She is a diligent and responsible woman who is planning to expand her business in the future. She says, "I am receiving loan many times from Xacbank, one of the famous banks in Mongolia. I understood that if I use my loan wisely I can improve both my business operation and living condition. In the future I want to have my own apartment using the loan money carefully." She is requesting a 1,500,000 MNT loan to purchase meat for her business.

loans.use: To purchase meat

loans.name: Enedina

texts.es: Enedina es una madre D. familia, vive en compañía D. su hijo y su esposo en su casa que es propia. ElL. siempre ha buscado oportunidades D. desarrollo para sus hijos, es así que decidió radicar en L. zona urbana D. su distrito y acudir a sus terrenos durante L. época D. siembra y cosecha. Nunca ha dejado D. cultivar L. tierra, pues es lo que más domina y eso le permite tener ganancias. Por otro lado su esposo trabaja y D. las ganancias que obtiene también lo deriva para los gastos familiares. Lo que más cultiva es el maíz  y después lo hace secar al sol y lo desgrana para venderlo a mayor precio y por kilos en el mercado central D. su ciudad. Parte D. su trabajo selecciona algunos granos para ser utilizando como semilL. y así volver aumentar su productividad. Con más D. 11 años D. experiencia que tiene en L. agricultura tiene deseos D. seguir adelante con esta actividad del cual disfruta y por ello desea intensificarse. Es L. segunda vez que tiene un crédito con MFP, recuerda en aquel momento en que decidió  formar parte del grupo, han demostrado cada uno D. sus integrantes el ser puntuales en el pago D. sus cuotas. Asimismo considera que cada préstamo es una oportunidad que le permite afrontar con éxito L. inversión que hace en L. agricultura. Con el crédito que solicita, lo invertirá en L. compra D. sacos D. abono orgánico para su próxima campaña D. siembra.
texts.en:
Enedina is a mother who lives with her son and husband in their own home.  She has always looked for ways to make progress for the sake of her child.  She decided to live in the urban area of her district and tend to her farmland during sowing and harvesting seasons.  Enedina has never neglected her land.  This is her most dominant business activity and it allows her to make profits. Her husband works and they use the profits that he makes to cover their family expenses.  

Enedina mostly grows corn and, after she has dried it in the sun and separated the kernels, she sells it for a good price, by the kilo, in the central market in her town.  As part of her work, she selects some grains to be used as seed and thereby increases her productivity.

Enedina has more than 11 years experience in farming.  She has a desire to get ahead in this business that she enjoys and, for this reason, she would like to intensify her work with her crops.  This is the second time that she has requested a loan from MFP.  She remembers the time that she joined her group.  Each one of the members of her group have shown themselves to be punctual in making their loan repayments.  Enedina sees each loan as an opportunity to successfully invest in her farming.  She will invest the loan that she has requested in buying sacks of organic fertilizer for her upcoming sowing season.

loans.use: to buy sacks of organic fertilizer

loans.name: Huy

texts.en: Mrs. Huy, 43, is a married woman and the mother of ten children.: seven of them are married and living independently while the other three are single and work in different jobs. Her husband, Seng (47), sells chickens next to his house and makes around $1.25 every day. She is an energetic and determined woman who has worked hard to earn enough money to feed all her children since they were very young. Mrs. Huy is applying for this loan to purchase a motorbike for her husband to use to pick up chickens; to buy seed and fertilizer so that the family can grow crops; and also to buy additional chickens to sell. Mrs. Huy and her husband are shown together in the photo.

loans.use: to purchase a motorbike for her husband to use to pick up chickens, to buy seed and fertilizer, and  to buy additional chickens

loans.name: Pasión Group

texts.es:
La A.C. “PASIÓN” iniciará su primer ciclo en Pro Mujer, como parte del Centro Senkata, está compuesta por diez integrantes y está dirigida por una mesa directiva encabezada por la señora Graciela. Los negocios que las integrantes de la asociación comunal llevan adelante son variados entre ellos tenemos: venta de gorro y chalinas, venta de mantas de vicuña y alpaca, producción de mantas, venta de comida, venta de sombreros, costura de deportivos, costura de enaguas.

La señora Graciela  indica que este es el primer ciclo que trabaja con Pro Mujer, ingresando por invitación. En la actualidad ella tiene un negocio de venta de chicharrones en los pueblos que viene trabajando hace treinta años atrás, aprendo este oficio de su mamá. 

El crédito que ahora sacará es para aumentar su capital (compra de carne y maíz) que comprará de la Ceja y posterior a la elaboración de sus productos la comercializará en los pueblos. Esta forma de trabajo le permite generar recursos para apoyar en lo posible a su familia pues ella es casada  y tiene cinco hijos.  

Cuando se le consulta qué le gusta de Pro Mujer, ella responde que le gusta el consultorio y credito.
texts.en:
The "Pasión" communal bank will start its first cycle with Pro Mujer, as part of the Senkata Center.  It is composed of ten members and is directed by a board headed by Graciela.  The communal bank's members run a variety of businesses.  Among them we have: sales of caps and scarves, sales of vicuña and alpaca blankets, blanket production, food sales, hat sales, sewing athletic clothing, and sewing slips.

Graciela indicates that this is her first cycle with Pro Mujer, having been admitted by invitation.  Currently, she has a business selling chicharrones (pork rinds) in the towns.  She has been doing this work for twenty years, learning it from her mother.

The loan that she will now receive is for increasing her capital (the purchase of meat and corn), which she will buy in La Ceja, and afterwards for making her products, which she will sell in the towns.  This form of work allows her to generate resources to support her family as much as she can, since she is married and has five children.

When she is asked what she likes about Pro Mujer, she says she likes the office and the loan.

loans.use: to purchase corn and meat

loans.name: German Jose

texts.es: Germán comenzó su negocio hace tres años, cuando su esposa ya no pudo trabajar y se pensionó a través del seguro social, el señor labora una temporada de 6 meses de zafra en el ingenio san Antonio, y con sus ahorros y liquidación de pago puso un pequeño negocio donde vende refrescos, golosinas, gaseosas, jugos y otros productos  en su casa, luego se instaló a vender en un colegio de sus comunidad, con las utilidades logro comprar un triciclo taxi para transportar sus productos de sus ventas. Ahora solicita el crédito para la compra de llantas, asientos, aceites entre otros.
texts.en: Germán started his business three years ago when his wife was no longer able to work and went on social security.  He works during harvest time for six months at Ingenio San Antonio (a sugar estate in N.).  Using his savings and salary payment, he opened a small business at his house where he sells refreshments, sweets, sodas, juices and other items.  He then started to sell at a school in his community and with his profits, he was able to buy a tricycle taxi to transport his products to sell.  He is now requesting a loan to buy tires, seats, oils and other items.

loans.use: to buy tires, seats, oils, and other items.

loans.name: Susanna

texts.en: Susanna runs a small cafe-restaurant in the city.  Susanna would like to improve the cafe's condition and increase the quality of services for her clients. With the requested loan Susanna plans to purchase chairs and tables, as well as renovate the cafe.  With the help of this loan Susanna will be able to meet the demands of her clients and also attract new ones.  Susanna will develop her business and ensure a brighter future for her family.  Susanna lives together with her parents and cousin.

loans.use: to pay for furniture and renovations for her cafe

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy apples, grapes, bananas, potatoes, güisquiles, and cassava for his business.

loans.name: Reika

texts.en:
Reika is 22 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married with children. 

Reika has a retail shop where she buys & sells dried fish per kilogram. She has had this business for two years. She requested a loan of PHP 5,000 to buy stock of dried fish in different kinds.

Reika is a new member of HSPFI.  In the future, Reika hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy stock of dried fish in different kinds.

loans.name: Nieves

texts.es:
Nieves es socia del Banco Comunal “Nueva Generacion 2000” en el distrito Ilave, en el departamento Puno y tiene 22 años. Ella y su pareja tienen a una hija de un año.
Se dedica a la venta de ropa, telas, gorros y medias. Además su pareja fabrica balleta (tela artesanal) que ella también vende. Fue idea de su madre, quien también pertenece a Manuela Ramos, de establecer el negocio y empezó hace dos años con un capital de S./ 200.00. El nuevo préstamo de S./500.00 lo invertirá en la compra de lana para fabricar más balletas. 
Su sueño es tener su casa propia y ampliar el negocio un poco más. Con Manuela Ramos le gusta mucho las actividades como por ejemplo los talleres de producción.
texts.en:
Nieves is a member of the communal bank “Nueva Generacion 2000” in the district of Llave in the department of Puno. She is 22 years old and she and her partner have a 1 year old daughter.

She sells clothes, fabrics, hats and socks. In addition, her partner makes balleta (a traditional cloth) which she also sells. It was her mother's idea, who is also a member of Manuela Ramos, to set up the business and she started 2 years ago with a capital outlay of S./200.00 (PEN). She will invest the new loan for S./500.00 (PEN) in the purchase of wool to make more balletas.

Her dream is to have her own house and expand her business a little more. At Manuela Ramos, she loves the activities such as the workshops

loans.use: to buy wool.

loans.name: Ester

texts.en: Ester is 54 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married with 4 children. Ester has a shop that sells canned goods, snacks and beverages. She has had this business for 5 years. She requested a loan of PHP 15,000 to buy canned goods, snacks and beverages. Ester has been a member of HSPFI since 2010. In the future, she hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy canned goods, snacks and beverages.

loans.name: Sandra Patricia

texts.es: Sandra Patricia tiene 40 años, es docente de una escuela primaria tiene que levantarse temprano todos los días para realizar su trabajo. Sandra tiene sueños personales uno de ellos es proporcionarle mejoras a su vivienda. Ella quería realizar estas mejoras desde hace cuatro años, el motivo por el cual no podía realizarlas fue que tenía que suplir las necesidades de su familia. Tiene 1 hijo de 17 años, que está a su cargo. El motivo del crédito es para la compra de bloques, zinc, cemento, arena.
texts.en: Sandra Patricia is 40 years old. She is a teacher at a primary school and has to get up early every day to go to work. Sandra has personal dreams, one of which is to make improvements to her house. She has wanted to make these improvements for the last 4 years but was unable to as she had to take of the family's needs. She has a son who is 17 years old for whom she is responsible. The reason for the loan is to buy cement blocks, zinc, cement and sand.

loans.use: to buy cement blocks, zinc, cement and sand.

loans.name: Lack

texts.en:
Lack (pictured with her loom) is single and lives with her parents and brothers and sisters in a village across the Mekong River, about 15 kilometers from Phnom Penh City. 

Lack is a silk weaver. Her parents are farmers. She is requesting a loan of $900 to continue her weaving business by buying silk material.

loans.use: to buy weaving material for her weaving business

loans.name: Ever

texts.es:
El Joven Ever tiene 19 años de edad, es soltero y vive con su madre en la ciudad de Carapeguá. Como proviene de una familia humilde y con ganas de salir adelante empezó a trabajar como ayudante mecánico desde que era niño.
Ahora a los 19 años de edad ya tiene su propio taller mecánico de moto, el cual ha podido montar gracias a su esfuerzo y sacrificio. Hoy en día  ya tiene una buena clientela formada y necesita comprar más herramientas así como una compresora de aire. Gracias a su trabajo y esfuerzo ahora está ampliando su taller y así podrá mantener su buena clientela.
Solicita el préstamo para la compra de la  compresora de aire que necesita, pues le será de mucha ayuda en su negocio.
texts.en:
The young Ever is 19 years old, single, and lives with his mother in the city of Carapegua. Since he comes from a humble family and has the urge to get ahead, he began working as an assistant mechanic when he was a child.

Now, at 19, Ever already has his own motorcycle repair shop, which he has developed, thanks to his efforts and sacrifice. He also has a good customer base and needs to buy more tools, including an air compressor. Thanks to that hard work and effort, he is presently expanding his workshop and that should help maintain his good clientele base.

Ever is requesting the loan to buy the air compressor he needs, because it will be a great help in his business.

loans.use: to buy an air compressor he needs that will be of much help in his business.

loans.name: Delfina

texts.es:
La socia pertenece al banco comunal “PEROLNIYOC DE URUBAMBA”; El banco está ubicado en el distrito de Urubamba, perteneciente a la provincia de Urubamba y departamento de Cusco.

La socia es la Sra. Delfina; ella tiene 30 años de edad y es soltera; La socia alterna sus actividades diarias con el negocio de agricultura, ella siembra maíz, la socia también se dedica a trabajar como docente secundaria en el distrito de Urubamba, por medio de este negocio la socia saca adelante a sus hijos, la socia quiere ampliar y mejorar el negocio de agricultura. La socia solicita el préstamo para comprar maíz al por mayor y fertilizantes para las tierras de cultivo. 

 La socia está feliz por el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con los pagos de su cuota.
texts.en:
The member belongs to the “PEROLNIYOC DE URUBAMBA” communal bank. The bank is located in the Urubamba district, belonging to the province of Urubamba and the department of Cusco. 
This is Mrs. Delfina. She is 30 and single. She alternates her daily chores with agriculture. She sows corn. She also works as a secondary school teacher in the Urubamba district. She is getting her children ahead through her business. She wants to expand and improve her agriculture business. She is requesting this loan to buy corn wholesale, as well as fertilizers for her farmland.

She is happy to have this loan and promises to repay her quotas on time.

loans.use: to buy corn wholesale, and fertilizers for her farmland.

loans.name: Ricardo

texts.en:
Ricardo is married with four children.  He is 54 years old and lives in Romarate, Aurora, ZDS: Philippines.

To earn a living Ricardo operates a business venture, planting and harvesting corn to sell in the local community.  He has been in business for three years. Each month, he earns 3,000 PHP doing this type of work.

He has requested a loan of 20,000 PHP to purchase fertilizer such as manure. Ricardo has been a member of GDMPC for three years. In the future, Ricardo hopes to expand his business to continue to meet daily needs.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizer such as manure

loans.name: Frontbek

texts.ru: Фронтбек 69-летний пенсионер, женат, воспитал пятерых детей.  В поисках средств дохода для своей семьи, в 1998 году Фронтбек начал свой бизнес в откорме и перепродаже скота. Благодаря упорству и настойчивости Фронтбека, начатое с суммы в 1,000 сом (KGS) хозяйство,  сегодня приносит около 6,000 сом (KGS) в месяц от продажи молочных  и мясных продуктов. В целях дальнейшего увеличения поголовья скота, Фронтбек обратился в компанию «Бай - Тушум и Партнеры» за кредитом в сумме 30,000 сом (KGS) на покупку дойной коровы. Доходы от кредита Фронтбек планирует вложить в дальнейшее увеличение количества домашней скотины.
texts.en: Frontbek is a 69 year-old married retiree, who raised five children.  In search of a source of income for his family, Frontbek started his own business of fattening up and reselling livestock in 1998.  Thanks to his persistence and tenacity, the business that was started with a sum of 1,000 som (KGS), now yields about 6,000 som (KGS) per month from sales of dairy and meat products.  In order to further increase livestock headcount, Frontbek requested a loan in the sum of 30,000 som (KGS) from the "Bai-Tushum and Partners" company to purchase a dairy cow.  He plans to invest the profits from the loan into further increasing his livestock quantities.

loans.use: to purchase a dairy cow

loans.name: Silvia Dinora

texts.es: Silvia Dinora  de 34  años de edad, vive en casa de su hermana desde hace 19 años junto con sus tres hijos dos de los cuales se encuentran estudiando. Silvia Dinora  lleva muchos años dedicándose al negocio. Gracias a su dedicación y disciplina ha logrado mantener activa una pequeña tienda dentro de su hogar de habitación. Ella  es una mujer ejemplar ya que ella sola ha logrado sacar adelante a sus hijos y sigue trabajando para darles lo mejor. El lugar de ubicación de su negocio es muy estratégico, se encuentra en una zona muy concurrida y de fácil acceso por el momento cuanta con muchos clientes,  pero ella es una mujer emprendedora y quiere surtir su tiendita para que sea más atractiva y los cliente la prefieran mas además quiere aprovechar esta temporada navideña ya que es cuando más se vende. Esto la ha hecho tomar la decisión de solicitar este crédito a INTEGRAL para comprar variedad de artículos de tienda como: golosinas, detergentes, azúcar, arroz, frijoles, aceite, papel, pan dulce y de mas artículos que logren a traer a mas clientes. Con esto espera cumplir su sueño de ver su tienda surtida y contar con muchos clientes que la prefieran por tener  todo lo necesario. Además  espera lograr mayores ganancias que le permitan acceder a una mejor oportunidad de  vida.
texts.en:
Silvia Dinora, age 34, has lived in her sister’s house for 19 years.  She lives with her three children; two of them go to school.  Silvia Dinora has devoted herself to the business for a lot of years.

Thanks to her dedication and discipline she has managed to actively maintain a small store in her home.  She is an exemplary woman because she alone has managed to get her children ahead.  She continues working in order to give them the best.

The location of her business is very strategic.  It is in a very busy zone with easy access, and she now has a lot of customers.  However, she is an enterprising woman.  She wants to stock her small store so that it will be more attractive, and so that the customers will prefer her store.  Also, she wants to take advantage of the Christmas season because that is when she sells the most.

This has made her decide to request this loan from Integral.  She will use the loan to buy a variety of products for her store.  She will buy things like sweets, detergents, sugar, rice, beans, oil, paper, sweet breads, and others that manage to bring more customers. 

By doing this she hopes to fulfill her dream of seeing her store stocked and having a lot of customers who prefer her because she has everything they need.  Also, she hopes to get greater income, which would allow her access to a better life opportunity.

loans.use: to buy sweets, detergents, sugar, rice, beans, oil, paper, and sweet breads, etc.

loans.name: Chantha

texts.en: Chantha, 25, is married and resides with her husband, her mother and three children in Prey Veng Province, Cambodia. She is a distiller. Her husband is a rice farmer. Due to the small amount of agricultural yield that she gets every year, Chantha requests a loan of USD 1,000 to purchase more farmland to grow rice in order to get a high yield. In the future, she would like to run a grocery store at home to generate more income to support the family and send her children to a good school.

loans.use: to purchase more farmland to grow rice

loans.name: Douglas

texts.en:
In his ambition to get ahead, Douglas yearns for a great opportunity to show his abilities and provide for his household. 

For the last 16 years, Douglas has been selling eggs and milk from his farm, as well as engaging in other small businesses to take care of his family. He enjoys selling his farm produce. "I've grown up farming, and selling produce to generate income for my family. I always look forward to selling my produce at the market," he states. Typical of smallholder rural farmers in Kenya, he leads a low income lifestyle. But he wants to changes this. 

Douglas is seeking a loan to purchase a dairy cow. His biggest challenge has always been raising capital to purchase inputs and expand his agribusiness enterprise. By purchasing a dairy cow, he will have an alternative source of income that will be sufficient for repaying the loan. Cows produce milk every day, providing a more regular and predictable income. 

Douglas has promised to name the cow he will acquire. He is very optimistic that his cow will be productive and full of health. He has already set aside land for growing fodder. "I am too committed to diversifying to divert funds to other projects. My highest monthly expense is family related... but I am focused on increasing my income so I will not be tempted to spend a Kiva lender's hard-earned money on consumables." 

Your loan will go a long way in helping Douglas boost his income levels and elevate his family's quality of life. With this loan, you will support a man who is full of life and spirit for his family!

loans.use: To purchase a dairy cow.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To add on stock.

loans.name: Awagasi

texts.en:
A woman of 35 years, with five children, Ms G. Awagasi is an illiterate women who specializes in traditional healing, the secret to her profession is the knowledge of pharmaceutical herbs that she inherited from her parents. Many of these herbs are not found where she lives. She must travel very far , sometimes for hours outside the country to find what she needs. This is why she is asking for a loan for $600.00 which will be re payed over twelve months. She has shown herself to be very dynamic and strong, and has proved herself responsible with her re-payments of previous loans.

Translated from French by Kiva Volunteer, Kristin Connor

eune femme de 35 ans avec cinq (05) enfants, Madame G. Awagasi est une femme illettrée spécialisée dans la pharmacopée traditionnelle, le secret de la vertu pharmaceutique des herbes qu’elle a hérité e ses parents. Beaucoup de ses herbes ne se trouvent pas sur place. Il faut voyager très loin quelques fois hors du pays pour s’en procurer. C’est pourquoi elle sollicite un crédit de $600 à rembourser en 12 mois. Signalons qu’elle est très dynamique et rigoureuse et a toujours fait preuve d’un très bon comportement lors du remboursement de ses crédits antérieurs.

loans.use: The sales of traditional pharmaceutical herbs.

loans.name: Mobil

texts.en: Mobil M. lives in the Beylagan region. He is 42 years old, and is married, with four children. Mobil has his own tire-repair service. He applied for credit to the Normicro Beylagan Branch in 2007 and was able to buy some equipment for his repair service.

loans.use: To buy equipment

loans.name: Sroam

texts.en: Mrs. Sroam P. works with her husband in Siem Reap Province fishing. She is 24 years old, and she and her husband currently have one child that they support. Her husband works mostly as a fisherman, but also works part time as a construction worker when the fishing is bad in the Tonle Sap Lake. This loan will be used to purchase a new fishing net and small wooden boat for Mrs. Sroam P..

loans.use: To purchase fishing net and boat

loans.name: Catarina

texts.es:
CATARINA is 31 years old and she is married and has 2 children. Her husband works as a construction worker. She works as an artisan making table clothes, clothing and napkins, all hand embroidered. She goes out and sells them to the tourists and other people in the streets of San Cristobal. She belongs to the group Escuela 3 along with Mrs. Maria J. Hernandez who is also an artisan and sells her merchandise in Zinacatan to the tourists. They will both invest their loan in buying fabric and embroidery floss.

Translated from Spanish by Ana Escalante, Kiva Volunteer.

CATARINA , tiene 31 años , casada , 2 hijos , su esposo trabaja en la construcción como albañil. Ella trabaja como artesana confeccionando manteles, prendas de vestir, servilletas todas bordadas y las sale a vender por las calles de la ciudad de San Cristóbal entre los turistas que visitan la zona y gentes del pueblo. Pertenece al grupo Escuela 3 junto con doña Maria Jiménez Hernández, también artesana que vende sus productos (manteles y servilletas) en Zinacantan a los turistas. Ambas invertirán sus préstamos comprando telas e hilos para bordar.

loans.use: ARTESANA

loans.name: Josefa Aquino

texts.en:
Josefa is 57 years old and married with six children. Her husband is a building worker. With the first loan she obtained from our organization, she made sewing machine repairs and invested in the purchase of cloth. She fabricates mosquito nets in her community, and she sells them in the capital. She managed her business judiciously and even repaid the loan before the due date of her payment. 

Currently, Josefa is short of some raw materials to continue production. She will invest the loan requested in the purchase of thread, cloth, oil for her sewing machine, needles, and so forth. Given the loan, Josefa will increase her sales volume and will better help her husband bear all the expenses of their large family.

loans.use: To purchase raw materials such as thread, cloth, needles, and oil for her sewing machine, in order to continue producing her mosquito nets.

loans.name: Gulsara

texts.en: Gulsara D. owns a food stand, conveniently located at the Spitamen food market in Tajikistan. She sells a variety of groceries but specializes cookies and sweets. She has grown her business and developed strong relationships with loyal customers. She urgently needs a loan to be able to meet the increased demand, for food and sweets in her community, caused by the holiday season.

loans.use: To grow her food supply

loans.name: Guillermo Villega

texts.es:
Since he was 17 years old Mr. Guillermo E. (known as don Memo) has worked at the sale of watches and jewelry in the city of Managua, specifically in the markets of the capital. He began his business with an investment of US $300 with which little by little, over the years he has managed to better the economic situation of his business.

He is married and with the responsibility of supporting his three children who require much of his support as they are school aged. It is necessary to point out that Mr. E. has successfully completed 14 loans with Ceprodel in the past two years and they have benefitted his business greatly in that they have increased his sales and therefore his earnings.

Translated from Spanish by Pax Bobrow, Kiva Volunteer.

Desde hace 17 años el señor Guillermo E. (conocido como don Memo) se dedica a la venta de relojes y prendas en la ciudad de Managua específicamente en los mercados de la capital. Su negocio lo comenzó con una inversión de U$ 300 por lo que a través de los años ha venido mejorando poco a poco la situación económica de su negocio.

Es casado y con la responsabilidad de mantener a sus tres hijos que necesita mucho de su apoyo por estar en la etapa escolar. Es necesario destacar que el señor E. ha realizado 14 créditos con Ceprodel desde hace dos años y le han sido de mucho beneficio para su negocio ya que han incrementado sus ventas y por ende sus utilidades.

loans.use: Purchase of merchandise - Compra de mercadería

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Expand his business and add more inventory

loans.name: Nancy

texts.es:
Nancy Álvarez F., a member of the communal bank, "Flor del Mani" is a native of the province of Moyabamba, in the district of Soritor. She sells perfume items, jewelry, and cosmetics from a variety of brands, including Esika, Avon, and Unique. Nancy has to travel a lot in order to make this business a good source of income. She lives in the district of Soritor, in the province of Moyabamba, in the San Martin department.

WIth a loan of US$350, which she will repay in six months, she will buy diverse items from these brands when they go on sale in the season in order to have stock and in order to vary her products. In this way, she can satisfy the tastes of her customers who regularly visit her when they want to buy something for a particular occasion, either for themselves or for a good gift.

Nancy is 30 years old and has two sons. She is content because she has her husband's support. She prefers her business because it allows her to be close to her family. Her goal is to repair and furnish her living room in order to have a home business, so that she can rest from the long walks she makes almost every day.

Translated from Spanish by Katrina H, Kiva volunteer.

La señora Nancy Álvarez F., socia del banco comunal “ Flor del Maní” es natural de la provincia de Moyobamba, distrito de Soritor, ella se dedica a la venta de artículos de perfumería, joyería y cosméticos de las diferentes marcas como Esika, Avon, Unique, ella tiene que recorrer mucho para hacer de esta actividad una buena fuente de ingresos, vive en el jr. Ricardo Palma No 583 del distrito de Soritor, provincia de Moyabamba, departamento de San Martín.

Con el préstamo de S/. 1000.00 el cual pagara en 6 meses, comprará diversos artículos de estas marcas que salen en ofertas en esta temporada para tener en stock y variar sus productos para así satisfacer los gustos de sus clientes quienes le visitan constantemente cuando quieren adquirir sus productos para cualquier ocasión, ya sea para ellos o para un buen regalo.

Tiene 30 años y 2 varones, esta contenta por que cuenta con el apoyo de su esposo, ella prefiere esta actividad por que le permite estar al lado de su familia, su meta es arreglar y acondicionar su sala para tener su negocio en casa, para así descansar un poco de las caminatas que da casi todos los días.

loans.use:
A Loan that will invest in products for her business

El prestamo lo invertira en la compra de productos para su negocio

loans.name: Esperanza

texts.es:
Esperanza is a working mother who fulfills her duties with the same passion with which she operates her general store. She leaves her shop once a month in order to visit the big markets in her city and purchase the products that her customers have requested. She relies on the support of her beloved daughter, who looks after the shop during her mother’s absence. Esperanza wishes to boost her sales by means of increasing her capital with the aim of contributing to the dreams of her beloved daughter and husband.

Translated from Spanish by Elizabeth Casian, Kiva Volunteer.

ESPERANZA, es una trabajadora madre de familia que desempeña con la misma pasión con la que atiende su hogar en su pequeña bodeguita, mensualmente abandona su espacio de trabajo para acudir a las grandes ferias de su ciudad a comprar lo necesario para abastecer las peticiones de sus clientes y para que el lugar no este desatendido cuenta con la importante ayuda de su querida hija.Tiene deseos de incrementar sus ventas a través de un incremento de su capital de trabajo con el objetivo de contribuir con los sueños de su querida hija y esposo.

loans.use: Increase capital to boost sales

loans.name: El

texts.en: El S. is 44 years old. She farms rice in her home province of Kampong Cham. This is a hard profession and her profits only come out to US$1 per day of work. She has known work in the fields all her life, however, as she has been farming since 1979. Her husband, Sang Chea, is the local barber. He earns US$2 per day. Of their four children, only one is married. Two of the older unmarried children contribute to the family income. One is a garment factory worker, earning US$80 per month and the other works in construction, earning US$3 per day. She wants to support her husband in his unique trade by buying him better tools to use for cutting hair. Barbers in the provinces rarely have more than a comb, a flat razor, and a pair of rusty scissors. With more modern tools he will attract much more business than he does now.

loans.use: To buy barber tools.

loans.name: Gloria Elizabeth

texts.es:
Gloria started her business to improve the lives of her and children, and give her children a good education as a single mother. She began five years ago selling fried food and coconuts from her house, and little by little increased her sales. Now she has a small grocery store with a great variety of products.

Now Gloria is applying for a six month US $600 loan to invest in merchandise for her store. She would like to add gift products in her store. You can make it possible with your support.

Translated from Spanish by Nathan, Kiva volunteer.

Gloria inició el negocio por salir adelante por si misma, a sus 2 hijos y brindarles educacion, como madre soltera.Comenzó hace cinco años vendiendo frituras y cocas en su casa hast que poco a poco empezo a vender mas mercancia hasta poder tener su tienda de abarrotes bien surtida.

Ahora ella solicita un prestamo por US $600 que pagara en 6 meses para comprar mercancia ya que quiere vender algunos regalos, y articulos tipo merceria. Con tu apoyo esto sera posible.

loans.use: Invest in merchandise for her small grocery store

loans.name: Lort

texts.en:
Mrs. Lort A., 42, is a widow who lives in Siem Reap, Cambodia, the home to the country’s famous Angkor Wat temples. Since 2000, she has worked to support her family by weaving and selling baskets in her local markets. She has five children, one of whom is married. One of her children also helps support the family by working in a restaurant.

Mrs. Lort would like to borrow $1,000 in order to purchase land and grow vegetables on it. She believes this is a good new business opportunity, and also a way to help feed her family in a more affordable manner.

loans.use: To purchase land to grow vegetables

loans.name: Uwimana

texts.en:
Greetings from Ruhengeri in Rwanda! V. is 28 years old and is married with three children and four adopted orphans from the 1994 genocide.

In 2003, V. started her business of selling agricultural produce in different local markets in the area. V. has a plan of expanding her business to other local markets in the country. She is requesting a loan of 500,890 RWF to be repaid in 8 months.

loans.use: Expand her business to other local markets

loans.name: Soy

texts.en:
This the second time for Mrs. Soy P. to ask for a loan to improve her living conditions. She is a farmer in Ra village in Kampong Chhnang Province. Her husband, Mr. Nak Nan, is a construction worker and pig breeder who raises two pigs. Mrs. Soy P. is 45 and the mother of six children, two of whom are employed in a garment factory while another one is a construction worker. The remaining three are attending school.
