Although this family has different business activities, they still live in an old house and poor conditions. In order to improve her standard of living, Mrs. Soy P. decided to ask for a loan to add to her savings to build a new house for her family. Previously, Mrs. Soy P. had obtained a loan to buy pigs for breeding. She has fully paid it back.

loans.use: To ask for a loan to add to her savings to build a new house for her family.

loans.name: Paulina

texts.en:
Paulina A. manufactures palm oil for sale at Braman in Cape Coast. Paulina has received no formal education. She is married and has 7 children. Her husband is a farmer.

Paulina has been manufacturing palm oil for sale since 2004. She is responsible for helping her husband in the payment of the children's school fees and utility bills. Her loan will be used to buy more palm fruit for the production of palm oil. She hopes to use the new profits from her business to help her husband in the renovation of their family house.

loans.use: to buy more palm fruit for the production of palm oil

loans.name: Dominga

texts.es:
Doña Dominga tiene 57 años D. edad, estudió hasta el quinto año D. primaria, es casada y madre D. 09 hijos D. los cuales 02 son menores D. edad. Vive en el Jr Tacna Nº 456, distrito D. Ilave, provincia El Collao, Puno, y es una D. las socias fundadoras del Banco Comunal “San Miguel” en Ilave. 

En un inicio con el préstamo D. S/. 300 compró gelatina, galletas y bolsas D. caramelos. Nos cuenta que desD. muy joven se dedica a la venta D. gelatina en el mercado D. Ilave y a los 14 años D. edad tuvo su primer hijo por lo que no  pudo continuar sus estudios, entonces se dedicó a la venta D. gelatina y golosinas.

Con este préstamo D. S/. 1,000, el cual será cancelado en 03 cuotas, comprará 10 bolsas D. gelatina, 05 cajas D. leche, 01 un saco D. azúcar, etc.

Su mayor deseo es seguir trabajando hasta que sus 02 hijos menores sean profesionales.
texts.en:
Dominga is 57 years old and she went to school up to graD. 5. She is married and she is the mother of 9 children, of whom only 2 are still minors. She lives in Jr Tacna Nº 456, in the district of D. Ilave, within the province of El Collao in Puno. She is a founding member of the community bank "San Miguel" in Ilave.

She started with a loan amounting to S/.300 and with the funds she purchased gelatins, cookies, and bags of caramels. She says that since she was a young girl she has been selling gelatins in the markets of Illave, and when she was 14 years old she had her first son. she could not keep going to school so she decided to start selling gelatins and sweets.

With this loan, amounting to S/.1000 (repaid in a term of 3 months), she will purchase 10 bags of gelatin, 5 boxes of milk, and 1 sack of sugar, etc.

Her greatest dream is to be able to keep working until her two youngest children become professionals.


Translated from Spanish by Erika Lindig, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase bags of gelatin, milk, sugar, etc.

loans.name: Khoeun

texts.en: Mrs. Khoeun K. is a 38-year-old mother of three in Pang Ror village in Takeo Province. She is a farmer who owns one-hectare field for cultivating rice to earn her living. In her plantation, she faces a problem of infertile soil which adversely affects her crop. In order to solve this problem, she is seeking a loan to buy fertilizers to make her field more productive. Her husband, Mr. Un Mean, is disabled. Of her three children, two are tailors while the other stays at home to handle housework.

loans.use: To buy fertilizer to turn around her infertile field

loans.name: Thich Thi

texts.vi: Chị Nguyễn Thị Thích năm nay 42 tuổi, chị tham gia Quỹ tình thương từ năm 2007. Trong suốt 7 năm tham gia Quỹ  chị Thích  sử dụng vốn để đầu tư vào chăn nuôi và trồng trọt. Bên cạnh đó gia đình chị còn đầu tư mua máy say sát để sát gạo phục vụ cho nhu cầu của bà con địa phương. Hiện taị với mức thu nhập 6.000.000đ/ tháng từ chăn nuôi, say sát  cuộc sống của  gia đình  chị Thích đang ngày càng được cải thiện hơn. Vòng vốn tới chị xin vay mức vốn 15.000.000đ để đầu tư mua thóc về sát thành gạo bán nhằm tăng thu nhập cho gia đình.
texts.en:
Mrs. Thich Thi N., 42 years old, has been participating in the Fund since 2007. In the 7 years of participating in the Fund, Mrs. N. used the loan to invest in her livestock and tree farming ventures. Besides that, her family also bought a milling machine to grind rice as a service for the local townspeople. Currently with an income of 6,000,000 VND/month from raising livestock and grinding rice, the family's quality of life is gradually improving. In this round of funding she would like to borrow 15,000,000 VND to invest in buying harvested rice to process into edible rice in order to increase the family's income.

Translated from Vietnamese by Chi N., Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: to buy raw harvested rice to process into edible rice

loans.name: Mary

texts.en: Mary Diana A. is 36 years old. She is married and has one child, a girl. Currently, she says her child is in the basic school. She lives with her family in Konongo in the Ashanti Region of Ghana. She says her husband works with the local bank in her community. She deals both in charcoal and maize. She buys bags of charcoal and maize from the local charcoal burners and maize farmers in the surrounding villages. She sells to retailers in her community, mostly to food vendors. Mary has been in business for eight years. It is her dream to buy bags of charcoal and maize and to be able to trek to other towns to supply them. She wants a loan to help her realize this dream. She says she desires to sponsor her child to study to the tertiary level.

loans.use: To buy bags of charcoal and maize

loans.name: Shah Tahoos

texts.en: Shah Tahoos is the son of G. M.. He lives in Kabul, Afghanistan. He is married and lives in a big family of nine members. He is the only one who works. He works in a car part shop and earns money. Most of the time it is very difficult for him to pay for all the expenses in the house. He wants to take out an individual loan of 50,000 Afghani for the term of 12 months to go ahead and expand his business.

loans.use: buying the essential things for his car parts shop

loans.name: Jocelyn

texts.en:
Mrs. Jocelyn A. is 39 years old. She is married to a chainsaw operator, who also makes chairs out of  native materials. They have three children and they presently live in Jimenez, Misamis Occidental.

It was never Jocelyn's ambition to become a fish vendor but due to financial problems of her parents she was not able to finish college.  Such life experience made her realize that she needs to do her part to help make ends meet and  to be able to send their children in school and have a descent life.  These eagerness urged her to be in the business. Lack of financial assistance is a problem then.  A relative informed her of the services of PMPC. Without hesitation she grabbed the opportunity and became a bonafide member enjoying the benefits such as the insurance and savings services. Now she is requested for her third loan to be used to increase her working capital for her fish vending business.

Her earnest desire is to have a bigger stall to display the fish in order to sell a wider range of products and have plenty of customers.

loans.use: Additional capital for fish vending

loans.name: Janeth

texts.en:
Janeth O. and her husband Dexter are blessed with three children: Diether, Sharla Mae, and Fhenilyn, all currently in primary school. They live harmoniously in the rural village of Sta. Lucia, Bagabag, Nueva Vizcaya. Dexter and Janeth have great ambitions for their children, so they are doing the best to provide for their needs.

Janeth is a door-to-door sales rep for products from Natasha and MSE. She also sells frozen products and electronic load (prepaid cards). Her income isn’t enough to satisfy the family’s basic needs and cover her children’s education, so she is hoping to improve her business by acquiring additional products to sell. She has requested a loan of 6,000 PHP that will be amortized weekly. Janeth says that joining this loan program will greatly help her improve her business.

loans.use: Business Capital

loans.name: Josephine

texts.en:
Greetings from Josephine N. in Kabuga, Rwanda!  Josephine is requesting her first loan from Vision Finance Company so that she may increase her stock of shoes at her market stall.  She opened her stall eight months ago and works from 8:00 am to 6:00 pm every day.  She earns approximately $60 in profit each month.  With her increased profits, Josephine intends to reinvest in her business so that it may continue to grow.  

Josephine is thirty-two years old, married, has seven children and cares for two other dependents.  Her children's ages are twelve, ten, seven, five and three, and she has eight-year-old twins.  The orphans for whom she cares are twelve and one month, respectively.  

Josephine is requesting a loan of $900 to be paid back on a monthly basis over an eight month period.

loans.use: To buy more shoes to sell.

loans.name: Señor De Huanca Group

texts.es:
El banco comunal “SEÑOR D. HUANCA”, cuenta con 14 miembros, entre varones y mujeres, este banco se encuentra en la ciudad del Cusco, en una D. las oficinas centrales D. la organización Arariwa, en el distrito D. Huanchac.

Los socios D. este banco, se dedican a diferentes actividades, resaltando en un número mayor el D. las jóvenes mujeres que desean el préstamo para cubrir sus estudios superiores, otro porcentaje, lo requiere para poder implementar sus negocios, tales como restaurante y tiendas D. abarrotes, y préstamos personales.

Los socios del banco SEÑOR D. HUANCA, valoran el préstamo otorgado y se comprometen a pagar el total D. la deuda en el tiempo programado.
texts.en:
The village bank “SEÑOR D. HUANCA" has 14 members, both men and women. The bank is located in the city of Cusco, in one of the central offices of the organization Arariwa, in the Huanchac district. The partners of the bank engage in different activities, highlighted by a large number of young women who want a loan to cover expenses for higher education. The other percentage require a loan to be able to implement their businesses, from restaurants to grocery stores, also personal loans. The partners of bank SEÑOR D. HUANCA value the loan, and agree to pay the total debt in the time scheduled.

Translated from Spanish by Erin Hopkins, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To pay for studies, to implement businesses.

loans.name: Nurullo

texts.ru: Нурулло мужчина 43 лет . который торгует на центральном продовольственном рынке Паншанбе города Худжанда. Он закупает товар с местных колбасных цехов.Его товар очень разнообразный и качественный.У него много постоянных клиентов , которые покупают у него колбасы.Нурулло получив первый займ установил витрину холодильник и увеличил свой оборотный капитал, за что благодарен инвесторам за финансирование.
texts.en:
Nurullo is a 43 year old man who sells on the central produce market Panshab in the town of Khudjand. He buys the merchandise from the local sausage processing shops. He has many varieties and his product is high quality. He also has many regular customers who buy the sausages from him. Nurullo used his first loan to install a window case and a refrigerator and has increased his working capital and he is very thankful for the lenders for their support.

Translated from Russian by Elena Fedorchuk, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Sales of sausages

loans.name: Ladu

texts.en:
Ladu V. sells tea at a restaurant and is requesting a loan to stock up on more sugar and powdered milk to continuously make tea to sell. She is 21 years old and single. In the future, she wants to use the extra profits for opening up a bigger restaurant.

BRAC's holistic approach to poverty alleviation and empowerment of the poor encompasses a range of core programs in economic and social development, health, education, and human rights and legal services which are delivered through an extensive network of village organizations.

BRAC has become one of the world's largest NGOs as a measured by the scale and diversity of its interventions. In 2007, BRAC started operations in Southern Sudan. The micro-finance program, which is targeted towards returning war refugees, has already formed 418 village organizations with more than 14,000 women members.

loans.use: stock up on sugar and powdered milk to make tea to sell

loans.name: Mohamed

texts.fr: MOHAMED S. est un enseignant de profession et loge au quartier cité senghor de thies avec sa femme et ses enfants;il a un batiment qu'il veut finir avant l'hivernage c'est pour cela qu'il sollicite ce pret
texts.en:
MOHAMED S. is a teacher by profession and is staying in the Cité Senghor district of Thies with his wife and children. He has a building he wants to finish before the off-season. This is why he's requesting a loan.

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: CONSTRUCTION

loans.name: Seoung

texts.en:
Mr. Seoung V., 43, is a villager of Ang Krong District of Siem Reap Province. He is married man with two teenage children. One of his sons works in construction and provides his income to help meet his family’s daily foods needs. 

His wife, Lim Sovann (shown in the picture), age 40, is a vegetable seller.  

Mr. Seoung V. plants vegetable and fruit crops on a plot of land behind his house. He sells his mature crops two months after he begins growing them. 

He is requesting a loan to purchase a motor to help reduce the family’s daily travel costs.

loans.use: Purchase a motor

loans.name: Eshmatkhoja

texts.en: P. Eshmatkhoja is 50 years old, married and, together with his wife, they have four children. Eshmatkhoja runs the family business, which is a convenience store that sells all kinds of much-needed items like oil, sugar, tea, coffee macaroni and many others. He's been doing this business for more than nine years. Eshmatkhoja says that the business is going very well and is generating good earnings. And now he's planning on selling larger quantities of all kinds of drinks like soft drinks, juices and beer, since in summer demand for cold drinks will rise considerably. The loan he's requesting well help him to meet this goal. More about Tajikistan and IMON International Tajikistan is known for its rich history, which includes a key post along the Silk Road and the end of Alexander the Great's rule. It has also produced great thinkers, philosophers, scientists and poets, including Rudaki, Avicenna, Ferdowsi, Omar Khayyam, Jomi, and Rumi. The country is home to communities that still speak the ancient Sogdian language, epic mountain passes, and a civilization that dates back to the 4th millennium B.C. And, even today, it is a complex mixture of the Islamic faith, Soviet culture, New West culture and Central Asian traditions. But Tajikistan is also the poorest of the former Soviet republics. The civil war, which ignited soon after its independence from the U.S.S.R., further damaged the already weak economy. In addition, 93% of the country is mountainous and only 7% of the land is arable. These conditions have resulted in high levels of unemployment and have forced hundreds of thousands to seek work in other countries, mainly Russia. While the people of Tajikistan are working to improve its agricultural production and manufacturing sector, nearly two-thirds of the population still live in abject poverty. IMON's History Since December 2007, IMON International has worked closely with Kiva and Kiva lenders to ensure that poor and low income clients represent a viable business proposition. Funds raised through Kiva have already been distributed to thousands of IMON International's clients and will continue to provide thousands more with permanent access to the varied financial services they need. To learn more about IMON International's work, please visit: www.imon.tj

loans.use: To purchase larger quantities of all kinds of drinks

loans.name: Annaliza

texts.en:
Annaliza M. is 42 years old and married to Renato, who is 47 years old and her business partner. She is a native of the island vilage in the town of Binangonan, Rizal province in the Philippines. The island is sorrounded by lake and there are mountains on the island.

In 2004, Annaliza joined ASHI (Ahon Sa Hirap, Inc.), an MFI and Kiva partner in the Philippines, with hope to rise above poverty. Her previous loans were carefully spent on her business making kaing (large basket made from bamboo) as her primary business. The business runs smoothly and returns good proceeds for her family. A portion of her loans also went to her secondary business of reselling charcoal.

Now on her fifth loan, she is requesting a loan of 23,000 pesos as additonal capital for her kaing making business and also for her secondary business. The loan wil be used to pay for 100 pieces of bamboo, 10 rolls of binder, and for transportation expanses. Also, a portion of the loan will go to her secondary business, the resale of charcoal, as addtional capital.

She is hopeful that she can earn more income to save for her and her husband's future since they have no children. She still has hopes of having a child.

loans.use: To pay for supplies to make baskets from bamboo, plus transportation costs

loans.name: Adjoa Dope Abbam

texts.fr: Cette dame vend depuis 2007 à Lomé une boisson locale très appréciée de la population dénommée « sodabi ». Ce commerce lui permet de se prendre en charge et de subvenir aux besoins de son enfant. Elle souhaite avoir un crédit de WAGES pour faire de nouvelles commandes et répondre à la demande de plus en plus croissante de sa clientèle. Ce prêt lui permettra d’acheter 30 gros bidons de « sodabi ». Cette femme n’est pas mariée.
texts.en:
Since 2007, this woman has been selling a much appreciated local drink that people call "sodabi".  This business allows her to support herself and to provide for her child.  She wishes to obtain a loan from WAGES to order anew and to respond to the continually growing demands of her customers.  This loan will enable her to buy 30 huge drums of "sodabi".  This woman is not married.

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy drums of a local beverage

loans.name: Norah's Group

texts.en:
N. Norah is the leader of her lending group in Jinja. She is a 39-year-old businesswoman involved in brewing waragi (a distilled spirit) in Mawutu village in Jinja. Before starting out in the brewing business nine years ago, Norah was a housewife. She decided to start her business in order to alleviate her poverty. With a small amount of capital she bought drums and pipes for brewing. Although she is still in business, Norah is faced with the challenge of some of her customers not wanting to pay their bills.

Norah is able to make 100,000/= in weekly profit and this helps to pay her children's school fees and general upkeep expenses. She ensures that she makes quality drinks for her consumers and her dream now is to expand her business further by putting in more capital. She also hopes to build a family house and educate her children to university level. Out of her seven children, one is at university, one is in secondary school, three are in primary school, one is in the nursery section while the last-born is still a baby and not yet in school. Norah is requesting a loan to buy sukaali gulu, a kind of sugar used in the waragi brewing business.

loans.use: To purchase sukaali gulu, a kind of sugar for making waragi

loans.name: Amparo

texts.en:
65-year old Amparo N. is living in Surallah, South Cotabato. With rice farming business, she was able to provide her family enough for food clothing and other basic needs.  She’s married and has 6 children.  She has 1 and 3/4 hectare rice field with farm machinery and a sari-sari store which her family get the source of income.

She is requesting a loan of Php 10,000 from Community Economic Ventures, Inc. to buy farm supplies and pay the use of hand tractor for her farm.

loans.use: Financing

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase additional stock of her business.

loans.name: Estrellita

texts.en:
Estrellita S. is from the town of Canunan, Guipos, Zamboanga del Sur. She is 45 years old, is married, and has one adult child.

Estrellita owns and operates a food sector, making and selling food in the local community. She has been engaged in her business for over three years and earns approximately 15,000 PHP a month.

In 2008, Estrellita joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities. She has successfully repaid a previous loan of 10,000 PHP from PMPC.

Estrellita is requesting a new loan of 10,000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional products to sell. This loan will be her 3rd from PMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve and expand her business. 


About PMPC:
Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC) is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model.

loans.use: To purchase additional products to sell

loans.name: Daniel

texts.en:
Mr. K. is a 23-year-old gentleman married to Christine Kazungu. They have a child by the name Sarah Zawadi. He and his family reside in Mtopanga, an estate within Mombasa. His business is in a busy residential area where he sells clothing materials, and he also does tailoring, mainly school uniforms. 

Mr. K. was introduced to KADET by existing clients, and he is happy to be associated with this name. He plans to purchase materials and sundries to facilitate the expansion of his business. 

Mr. K.'s future hopes are to venture into the business of supplying clothing materials and shifting from small scale tailoring. He would like to be a major brand tailor.


About KADET:
The Kenya Agency for the Development of Enterprise and Technology (KADET) is dedicated to economically empowering its clients by providing financial services to improve living conditions of micro-entrepreneurs and their children across Kenya. KADET is the micro-finance subsidiary of World Vision Kenya. Obtain more information on KADET from the website: www.kadet.co.ke

loans.use: To purchase materials and sundries

loans.name: Leonardo

texts.es:
A la vivienda del señor Leonardo L. le está haciendo falta la barda trasera de la casa, pero en este momento no cuenta con el dinero necesario para poder comprar el material ya que el se encargara de realizar la mejora. 
Solicita el préstamo ya que desea la seguridad de sus tres pequeños hijos. 
El señor Leonardo es empleado de una  compañía de trasportes en el departamento de chofer de un camión, con este ingreso planea pagar el crédito ya que los gastos familiares los se encargara su esposa la señora Rosalía García con las ganancias que obtiene en la venta de comida en una escuela. 
La persona que aparece en la foto es la señora Rosalía ya que el señor Leonardo se encontraba en su trabaja el día de la visita.
texts.en:
At the home of Sr. Leonardo L., there is no fence at the back of the house. He does not have the money at the moment to buy the materials needed to complete this improvement. Therefore, he is requesting a loan so that he can provide security for his three small children.

Sr. Leonardo is employed as a truck driver for a transportation company. His salary will be used to repay this loan. His wife, Sra. Rosalía García, already covers the family expenses from her earnings selling food at a school.

Sra. Rosalía is the person who appears in the photo, since Sr. Leonardo was at work on the day of our visit.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Finish the installation of a fence behind the house

loans.name: Ngandu Kigombya Group, Mukono

texts.en:
N. Immaculate is 33 years old and single with 2 children with the eldest in senior four vacation. She has a retail shop in Ngandu that she has been running for 6 years and her major challenge at the moment are the defaulters that do not pay for the goods taken or even those that make very late payments. 

She is able to make 105,000 Ugandan shillings (about $54 US) as profits a week. She hopes to make more money to be able to build a house for her children and stop renting. She also works very hard to ensure that her children’s school fees do not become a problem since she does not have anyone else to turn to apart from her loans. Immaculate needs a loan to be able to restock her business with more goods.

loans.use: Restocking her retail shop with more goods.

loans.name: Jesús

texts.es: Jesús de  41 años, vive felizmente casado con su esposa Francisca de 38 años, y con sus 2 hijos Juliana de 19 y Joel de 15 años, juntos habitan una acogedora vivienda que es  propia y esta  ubicada en un tranquilo pueblo  de la sierra del Perú.Desde hace 5 años se dedica  a la agricultura de papa (tubérculo peruano), maíz, alverja y habas en sus tierras , con la ayuda incondicional de su esposa y sus suegros, cuenta que lo que más le gusta es sembrar alverja porque la puede cosechar en poco tiempo y comercializarlas en el mercado de la ciudad o en sus propios terrenos hasta donde llegan los mayoristas; Jesús tiene muchos deseos de progresar en la vida, es por eso con esa mente positiva trabaja sin descanso porque quiere que su familia tenga una buena calidad de vida, y esta seguro que lo logrará porque la agricultura le genera buenas ganancias económicas; para el  futuro tiene pensado sembrar alverja en mayor cantidad para venderlas en la capital,donde este vegetal  es muy  requerido por los habitantes.Es la sexta vez que tiene un préstamo con MFP y dice será responsable en sus pagos como siempre, además esta contento de trabajar en su banco comunal, que esta compuesto de personas muy  trabajadoras.Con el dinero del préstamo comprará sacos de abono, bolsas de semilla de alverja de diferentes  variedades para mejorar la cosecha siguiente, con el dinero restante desea adquirir una cabeza de ganado.
texts.en:
Jesús is 41 years old and happily lives with his 38 year old wife Francisca and their 2 children: Juliana, 19 and Joel, 15. Together they live in a cozy home they own and is located in a tranquil town in the mountains of Peru. He has been growing potatoes, corn, peas and beans for 5 years with the help of his wife and in-laws. He says that what he most enjoys is planting peas because they can be harvested within a short period of time and sold in the city market or from his own land where the wholesalers come. Jesús has many wishes to improve his life, so with this positive mindset he tirelessly works because he wants his family to have a good qualify of live and he is sure he will be able to achieve it because farming generates good income. For the future he is planning to grow peas is a greater quantity to sell in the capital, where this vegetable is in high demand. This is the sixth time he has a loan with MFP and he says he will be responsible with his payments as always. In addition he is happy to work with his communal bank which is made up of very hard-working individuals. With the money from the loan he will buy sacks of fertilizer, bags of pea seeds of different varieties to improve his next harvest, and with the rest of the money he wishes to acquire a head of cattle.

Translated from Spanish by Cindy Kendall, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy fertilizer and seeds to improve the productivity of his land

loans.name: Abulfat

texts.en:
Abulfat H. is 45 years old and lives with his wife and their six children.

Abulfat has been breeding cattle for more than 20 years and he is trying to improve the breed in order to increase his prices. He invests time and money in the feed and medicines that the animals require. He enjoys this work, especially getting milk from his cows, which his wife sells in local markets.

Abulfat keeps going thanks to the help and enthusiasm of his children, who, along with his wife, help him care for the animals. Abulfat needs a loan of 1,600 AZN to buy more calves to expand his business. With your help, this will be possible.

loans.use: To purchase three calves and fodder

loans.name: Mary Jane

texts.en:
Mary Jane A. is from the village of Caputol, Aloran, Misamis Occidental. She is 36 years old, married, and has three school-aged children. To make a living, Mary Jane owns and operates a business venture in the services sector. The main source of income for the business comes from providing habal-habal motorcycle services to the local community. (A habal-habal is a motorcycle with an extended seat that carries 2-6 passengers.) Mary Jane is just starting this business.
In 2010, Mary Jane joined Kiva partner GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. She is requesting a loan of 10,000 PHP, which will be used to repair her transport vehicle in order to improve her business. This loan will be her first from GDMPC. Mary Jane plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to financially support immediate members of her family.

About GDMPC
GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To repair her transport vehicle

loans.name: Samwel

texts.en:
Samwel K. N. is a 32-year old married man. He and his wife have one child, who attends school. For the past ten years, Samwel has operated a barber shop. He also earns extra income by charging batteries. 

Samwel is a member of Faulu Kenya and his life has really changed since he started saving his money with the MFI. In addition to saving money, he has also learned how to manage his business by keeping records. Through Faulu Kenya, Samwel has requested a Kiva loan of 20,000 Kenyan shillings (KES). He plans to buy a battery charger and a smoothing machine, and he hopes to open another business in a populated area so that he can attract more customers.

loans.use: To buy a battery charger and a smoothing machine.

loans.name: Peaceful Business Group

texts.en:
Anna K. is the leader of a group of five borrowers called Peaceful Business. She is 40 years old, married, and has three children who range from 15 to 20 years old.  She did not have the opportunity to go to school due to poverty.

For 15 years, Anna has been selling foodstuffs such as rice and onions at the Harbel Market. She says she provides good customer service which keeps customers returning. Anna plans to use her 4,000 Liberian dollar portion of this 20,000 Liberian dollar group loan to buy more rice and onions.  Her goal is to grow her business and to continue to educate her children and build them a house.

In the photo that accompanies this profile, Anna is the one holding the sign.

About LEAP:
The Local Enterprise Assistance Program (LEAP) is Liberia's largest and oldest continuously operating micro-finance institution with 13 branches acR. the country.  Founded in 1994, the non-profit organization has survived periods of civil war and severe socio-economic hardship.  LEAP seeks to help rebuild post-conflict Liberia through its group and individual loans to micro- and small-scale entrepreneurs, and puts emphasis on lending to women.

loans.use: To buy more rice and onions.

loans.name: Maria Dolores

texts.es: Maria Dolores tiene 42 años, por lo que su actividad económica es una pulpería además de tener este negocio también vender ciertos productos de mercadería en general. Hace más de 27 años que se dedica a este negocio, ella ofrece todo tipo de productos de consumo diarios, Maria tiene 2 hijos de 9 7 años ella se hace cargo de ellos, por lo que se preocupa por brindarles la oportunidad de estudiar. El financiamiento que solicitan es para capital de trabajo que será destinado para la compra de granos básicos, detergentes, golosinas, juegos, pan y sopas. Sueña con incrementar su inventario para su negocio.
texts.en:
Maria Dolores, 42, has a small grocery store; she also sells general merchandise. She has been in this line of work for over 27 years and offers all sorts of daily use items. Maria has two children, who are 9 and 7 years of age, and who are under her care; she strives to provide them with the opportunity to go to school. She will use the funds to buy stock inventory items, like: basic grains, detergents, sweets, juices, bread and soups. She dreams with increasing her store's inventory.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy stock inventory merchandise.

loans.name: Tonny

texts.en: Mr. K. Tonny is 40 years old. He is married with three children and lives in Lungujja-Kosovo as a permanent resident. He has a retail shop and he has been operating it for over two years. He is using the loan to purchase retail stuff like cups, saucepans, spoons, forks, plates, basins, and so forth. He expects to own a large super market supplying utensils and even create opportunities for others.

loans.use: To purchase cups, saucepans, spoons, forks, plates, basins, and so forth,

loans.name: Nguyễn's Group

texts.en:
H. Nguyễn Thị (20203980031) is a 47-year-old woman living in the town of Yên Phong - Bắc Ninh.  H. is the group leader of a 5-member group loan offered by SEDA.  While each member of the group receives an individual loan, they all are responsible for paying back the loans of their fellow group members if someone is delinquent or defaults.  The official name of this borrowing group is Thượng Thôn (6).

H. is married and has 2 adult children.  To making a living, H. owns & operates a business venture in the agriculture sector raising livestock.  While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes from raising cattle for sale.  H. has been engaged in this business for over 10 years and earns approximately 3.000.000 VND a month from these activities.

H. joined SEDA to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. She is now requesting a loan of 5.152.000 VND which will be used to invest in expanding the business.  The loan will be the 1st loan taken out by the borrower from SEDA.  H. plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand her business.

About the Other Borrowers in the Group:

1.  Nghiêm Thị H. (20202980032) is a 42-year-old woman who is requesting a 5.152.000 VND loan to support her business in the agriculture sector raising livestock.

2.  Nguyễn Thị Mơ (20202980033) is a 41-year-old woman who is requesting a 5.152.000 VND loan to support her restaurant business.

3.  Nguyễn Thị T. (20202980034) is a 26-year-old woman who is requesting a 5.152.000 VND loan to support her recycling services.

4.  Nguyễn Thị H. (20202980035) is a 37-year-old woman who is requesting a 5.152.000 VND loan to support her business in the agriculture sector raising livestock.

About SEDA:

The mission of SEDA (Center of Small Enterprise Development Assistance) is to provide microfinance services to the low-income and disadvantaged people in rural areas of Hanoi and the Northern provinces of Vietnam.


*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in Vietnamese while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.


H. Nguyễn Thị (20203980031) là 47 tuổi nữ.  Cô ấy sống ở thành phố Yên Phong - Bắc Ninh.  H. là trưởng nhóm của nhóm vay gồm có 5 các thành viên.  Mặc dù mỗi thành viên trong nhóm nhận được từng khoản vay cá nhân, nhưng tất cả họ đều chịu trách nhiệm hoàn trả lại khoản vay của các thành viên trong nhóm của mình nếu một người nào đó trễ hạn hay không trả được nợ..  Tên chính thức của nhóm vay này là Thượng Thôn (6).


Trong khi không pH. chỉ có các pH. thức tạo nên thu nhập, mà nguồn thu nhập chính của công việc kinh doanh chủ yếu từ chăn nuôi gia súc để bán.  H. thực hiện công việc kinh doanh này trong hơn 10 năm.  Từ các hoạt động này, H. kiếm được khoảng 3.000.000 VND.  H. đã tham gia SEDA để có thể tiếp cận với các dịch vụ tài chính giúp cải thiện  sinh hoạt và khả năng tham gia vào các hoạt động kinh doanh của cô ấy/ anh ấy.  0    Cô ấy hiện đang đề nghị một khoản vay mới là 5.152.000 VND.


Khoản vay sẽ là 1st khoản vay của người vay từ SEDA.


Về Những Người vay khác trong Nhóm:


1.  Nghiêm Thị H. (20202980032) là 42 tuổi nữ.  Cô ấy đề nghị khoản vay là 5.152.000 VND.  Khoản vay này sẽ được sử dụng để hỗ trợ công việc kinh doanh trong lĩnh vực nông nghiệp.  Mục đích chính của việc kinh doanh là chăn nuôi gia súc.


2.  Nguyễn Thị Mơ (20202980033) là 41 tuổi nữ.  Cô ấy đề nghị khoản vay là 5.152.000 VND.  Khoản vay này sẽ được sử dụng để hỗ trợ công việc kinh doanh trong lĩnh vực thực phẩm.  Mục đích chính của việc kinh doanh là kinh doanh nhà hàng.


3.  Nguyễn Thị T. (20202980034) là 26 tuổi nữ.  Cô ấy đề nghị khoản vay là 5.152.000 VND.  Khoản vay này sẽ được sử dụng để hỗ trợ công việc kinh doanh trong lĩnh vực dịch vụ.  Mục đích chính của việc kinh doanh là cung cấp dịch vụ tái chế.


4.  Nguyễn Thị H. (20202980035) là 37 tuổi nữ.  Cô ấy đề nghị khoản vay là 5.152.000 VND.  Khoản vay này sẽ được sử dụng để hỗ trợ công việc kinh doanh trong lĩnh vực nông nghiệp.  Mục đích chính của việc kinh doanh là chăn nuôi gia súc.


Về SEDA:

Nhiệm vụ của SEDA (Trung Tâm hỗ Trợ Phát Triển các Doanh Nghiệp Nhỏ) là cung cấp các dịch vụ tài chính vi mô cho những người có thu nhập thấp và kém may mắn trong các vùng nông thôn tại Hà Nội và các tỉnh phía Bắc Việt Nam


*Lưu ý: Để phát huy tối đa hiệu quả & giảm chi phí, khoản vay này đã được thông báo bằng biểu mẫu để có thể được Kiva tự động biên dịch. .  Do việc biên dịch thủ công các danh mục rất tốn kém, nên Kiva đã tạo biểu mẫu này cho phần Field Partner (Trường Đối Tác) cho phép họ tiếp tục thông báo các khoản vay bằng  Vietnamese trong khi cung cấp thông tin có chất lượng & chính xác cho người cho vay Kiva.

loans.use: to invest in expanding the business

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: buy spare parts

loans.name: Empty Bags Sellers Group

texts.en:
James P., who is holding the sign, is the leader of a group of five borrowers called "Empty Bags Sellers". He is 48 years old, married and has three children who range in age from 3 to 11 years. He cares for one sibling. All of his children are attending school.

For three years, James has been selling empty bags at the Redlight Market in Paynesville, outside of Monrovia, Liberia. He started his business with 2,000 Liberian dollars (LRD) and now has 4,000 LRD as working capital. He plans to use his 5,000 LRD portion of this 25,000 LRD group loan to buy more empty bags. James describes himself as an elder with good character. He hopes to grow his business and move into the sale of general goods. He wants to make more profit, build a house and be able to continue to support his family.

loans.use: To buy more empty bags

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: To purchase baby livestock to raise and sell in the future

loans.name: Anita

texts.es:
Anita es una joven madre de familia, tiene 20 años de edad y vive junto a su menor hija, su esposo trabaja en el puerto de Paita. Ellas residen en el caserío El Porvenir del distrito de Tambogrande, un distrito cuya principal actividad es el cultivo de frutas. Pertenece a la provincia de Piura en la región del mismo nombre, ubicada a más de tres horas de la ciudad de Chiclayo, capital de la región Lambayeque.

Se dedica a la venta de productos de belleza y cosméticos por catálogo, ella cuenta con un grupo de clientes que le compran sus productos con frecuencia, mientras más pedidos le realizan obtiene mas puntos de parte de la empresa que le provee los productos y por consiguiente obtiene mayores ganancias. Por este motivo se esfuerza por obtener cada vez mas clientes.

Anita desea contar con un capital estable para adquirir mas productos y contar con un stock fijo de cosméticos que permita a sus clientes adquirir los productos que necesitan rápidamente y no esperar hasta fin de mes, que es cuando le entregan los pedidos. Por ello ha solicitado a Edpyme Alternativa un crédito de 400 nuevos soles que le ayuden a conseguir su meta.

Anita es una mujer activa, distribuye su tiempo entre el cuidado de su familia y en su trabajo. Su mayor anhelo es lograr que su familia tenga una mejor calidad de vida. En la imagen nos muestra las boletas de pedido que recibe de la empresa que le provee de productos.
texts.en:
Anita is a young mother who is 20 years of age and lives with her young daughter and her husband who works at the port of Paita. They reside in the village of El Porvenir in the district of Tambogrande where the main business activity is fruit production. This district lies in the province and region of Piura and is located more than three hours away from the city of Chiclayo, the capital of Lambayeque region.

Anita sells beauty products and cosmetics through catalogs. She has a group of customers who buy products from her frequently. As she gets more orders, she receives more points from the company that provides her with products and is able to generate more revenue. For this reason, she strives every time to gain more customers.

Anita wants to have a stable source of capital so that she can acquire more products and have a fixed stock of cosmetics so that she make them available to customers who need them immediately and cannot wait up to a month to receive their orders. For this reason, she is requesting a loan from Edpyme Alternativa in the amount of 400 PEN to help her continue with her goal.

Anita is an active woman who divides her time between caring for her family and her work. Her greatest wish is to see her family have a better quality of life. In the photograph, she is holding up the order forms that she receives from the company that provides her products.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Increase her stock of beauty products

loans.name: Benkadi 1 Group

texts.fr:
Les dix  membres du groupe Benkadi 1 sont des femmes mariées qui ont une moyenne d’âge de 42  ans et ont en moyenne 2 enfants. Elles vivent la plupart dans des familles polygames à Zambougou, un des villages de la préfecture de Dioïla, région de Koulikoro, 2ème région administrative du Mali.
Elles collaborent avec l’institution de microfinance Soro Yiriwaso dans le but de pouvoir mieux organiser leurs activités en début d’hivernage. 
Les spéculations cultivées sont entre autres l’arachide,   le petit mil, le maïs et le haricot. Elles sont à leur premier prêt de campagne avec l’institution.
Avec ce prêt, MAH F. compte acheter les intrants avant la hausse des prix, les petits équipements et payer les frais de labour pour entretenir environs 1,2 hectare d’arachide.
La production est vendue au niveau de la ville de Fana après les récoltes à une clientèle composée essentiellement de revendeurs venant des grandes villes. 
Elle compte réaliser un bénéfice de 25.000FCFA environs en fin de  campagne.
Les femmes du groupe Benkadi 1 se disent satisfaites de la collaboration avec Soro Yiriwaso et portent toute leur confiance pour le bon déroulement de la campagne hivernale avec l’aide de Soro.
texts.en:
The ten members of the Benkadi 1 group are married women with an average age of 42 and an average of two children. They mostly live in polygamous families in Zambougou, a village in the prefecture of Dioila, Koulikoro region (Mali's Second Administrative District). They work with Soro Yiriwaso with the goal of better organizing their activity as the rainy season begins. They grow peanuts, millet, corn and beans. This will be their first seasonal loan. With this loan Mah Fofanah will buy fertilizer before its price goes up. She will also buy small tools and will pay for hired labor to work about 1.2 hectares of peanuts. The harvest will be sold in Fana, basically to people who will resell it in large towns. The group members hope for an average profit of CFA 25,000 at the end of the season. The women of the Benkadi 1 group say they are happy to work with Soro Yiriwaso and are very confident of having a good rainy season with Soro's help.

Translated from French by Michael Briggs, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy fertilizer and small tools and pay hired help

loans.name: Eva

texts.en:
Eva L. is from the village of Dalipuga, Iligan City. She is 45 years old. Eva is married and has 3 adult children. To make a living, Eva owns & operates a sari-sari (variety) retail shop, selling both food & daily use products in the local community. Eva has been engaged in her business for over 10 years and earns approximately 4000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2009, Eva joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities. Eva has successfully repaid a previous loan of 8000 PHP from HSPFI. This previous loan was used to purchase additional products to sell. Eva is requesting a new loan of 8000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional inventory & working capital. This will be the 3rd loan taken out by Eva from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand the borrower's business. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional inventory & working capital.

location.town: Dalipuga, Iligan City, Lanao del Norte

loans.name: Aichatou

texts.en: Mrs. Aichatou Adboubari sells charcoal in the Agoé region of Lomé, Togo. She is married to a teacher and together they have four children. Madame A. is 38 years old and has been engaged in selling charcoal for about the last 6 years. This is a lucrative business in Togo as most families use charcoal to heat their cooking stoves. Despite having worked at this business for a long time, this will be Madame A.’s first time taking a loan from WAGES to fund her business. She has requested 300,000 CFA in order to purchase more stocks of charcoal.

loans.use: To purchase charcoal

loans.name: Redela

texts.en:
Redela C. is 51 years old and married. She  supports her family by operating 2 business ventures:  used clothing and ready-to-wear (RTW) businesses. She lives in Brgy. Tugas, Tanjay City, Negros Oriental. 

Redela has been a member of NWTF-Project Dungganon since 2006 and has improved her living conditions with the help of her loans from NWTF and through her own efforts. By working hard in her used clothing and RTW businesses, she is gradually making her family more economically stable. She now earns an average monthly income of 6400 PHP. 

Redela is now borrowing 19,000 PHP so that she can purchase more stock to sell. This will be her 7th loan from NWTF-Project Dungganon. Her previous loan of 18,000 PHP, which she paid off well within its term, was just another step in her journey toward economic freedom. Redela aspires to elevate her family's living conditions and ensure their future well-being by following the Dungganon way. 

About NWTF: 

In a world full of challenges, Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation (NWTF) is making a difference in the lives of thousands of women through Project Dungganon (a Hiligaynon word that means Honorable). Through the alleviation program, NWTF is empowering these women to progress from earning less than $1 a day to achieving realities that surpass even their dreams. They have taken a life path that will ultimately make them Dungganon--a title of esteem that is bestowed to a member of a community who has earned the respect through a lifetime of hard and honest work. Help NWTF continue its mission to help the poorest in the Philippines by clicking  the link to the NWTF Kiva lending team on Kiva.org to join our team.

loans.use: To purchase more clothing to sell

loans.name: Elma

texts.en: Elma M.'s main source of income comes from selling seafood products including fish and shrimp in her community. She is 53 years old, married and has one adult child. She is from the village of Guiwanon Panalsalan, Plaridel, Misamis Occidental. Elma has been in her business for over 10 years and earns approximately 5,000 Philippine pesos (PHP) a month. In 2010, Elma joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living conditions and enable her to engage in business activities. She has successfully repaid a previous loan of 5,000 PHP from GDMPC which was used to invest in expanding the business. Elma is requesting a new loan of 7,000 PHP which will be used to purchase new equipment and tools to expand the business. This will be her second loan from GDMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to supplement her family's income. About GDMPC: GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines. It has four branches and three unit offices covering the provinces of Zamboanga del Sur, Lanao del Norte and Misamis Occidental. Its membership is composed mostly of farmers, fisherfolks and small entrepreneurs. Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase new equipment and tools

loans.name: Dramane

texts.fr:
Monsieur Dramane G. est homme marié de 31 ans et père de 3 enfants. Il vit avec sa femme et son enfant dans le quartier Massablacoura de Bougouni (Région de Sikasso)
Monsieur Dramane G. a abandonné l’école dès son âge pour se consacrer aux activités génératrices de revenus. Après  des années activités  tous azimuts  sans succès, il finit par opter pour l’achat vente d’articles divers de boutique. Avec une expérience de plus de 2 ans, il maîtrise son activité.
Pour obtenir un fonds de roulement conséquent, il décide d’adhérer au programme crédit de Soro Yiriwaso avec qui il est à son premier prêt.
Il compte acheter avec son prêt divers articles pour la boutique. Il s’approvisionne à Bougouni et effectue sa vente dans sa boutique à une clientèle diverse et variée.
Il compte réaliser un bénéfice mensuel de 50 000FCFA qui sera utilisé pour subvenir aux dépenses de la famille et réinvestir dans les activités.
texts.en: Mr. Dramane G. is married and the father of three children.  He lives with his wife and children in the Massablacoura neighborhood in Bougouni (in the Sikasso region).  Mr. Dramane G. left school early in order to devote himself to revenue-generating activities.  After years of business attempts realized without success, he finally opted to buy and sell various items in a small shop.  With more than two years of experience, he has mastered his business.  In order to obtain a consistent working capital, he has decided to join Soro Yiriwaso's loan program, with whom this will be his first loan.  He intends to use his loan to buy various articles for his small shop.  He buys his stock in Bougouni and conducts his sales in his shop to a diverse clientele. He intends to earn a monthly profit of 50,000 FCFA which will be used to support his household expenses and to reinvest in his business.

loans.use: Buying various items for his shop

loans.name: Maximina

texts.es:
Maximina es socia del Bancomunal Arrieros, tiene 37 años, 2 hijos D. 6 y 4 años, los cuales están estudiando en inicial, Maximina se dedica a L. venta D. carne D. pollo, anteriormente vendía para otra persona pero al ver que el negocio era bueno decidió independizarse y tener su propio negocio, elL. lo logro gracias al préstamo que recibió D. Finca Perú, Maximina es socia D. Finca Perú desD. hace 6 años.
Maximina solicita su prèstamo para incrementar su negocio y realizar compras en cantidad al por mayor, Maximina agradece a L. voluntad D. Dios y a su trabajo porque siempre le ha ido bien en sus ventas; por ello aumenta cada vez más su capital. 
El sueño D. Maximina es tener su casa propia y que sus hijos sean profesionales.
texts.en: Maximina is a member of the Arrieros Community Bank. She is 37 years old and has two children, ages 6 and 4, who are in preschool. Maximina makes a living selling chicken. Previously she sold it for someone else, but seeing that it was a good business she decided to go independent and start her own business, which she did thanks to a loan from Kiva partner Finca Peru. Maximina has been a member of Finca Peru for six years. She is requesting this loan to expand her business and purchase chicken in bulk at wholesale. Maximina is grateful to God and her work because her sales have always gone well and increases her capital every month. Her dream is to have her own home and for her children to be successful.

loans.use: Purchase chickens at wholesale

loans.name: Stephen

texts.en: Stephen wants a loan to top up his money to buy a car for a transport business. He is married with four children. He is a taxi driver. Stephen lives in a semi permanent house in Kyenjojo, Uganda. He dreams of building a permanent house and educating his children so that they can have a bright future.

loans.use: To top up his money to buy a taxi

loans.name: Adama

texts.fr:
Natif de Safebougou, Monsieur Adama  C. est âgé de 41 ans, polygame et père de  7 enfants, il habite dans le quartier Médina coura de la préfecture de Koutiala (Région de Sikasso). 
Du a des problèmes sociaux il  n’a pas pu continuer  les études primaires, raisons pour la quelle il s’est intéressé aux activités génératrices de revenus auprès de son père. Après avoir mené plusieurs activités sans réussite, il finit par opter  l’achat vente des poissons fumés  il y a 14 ans. Les poissons fumés sont beaucoup prisés à Koutiala et sa notoriété est bonne.  
Pour pouvoir augmenter son fonds de commerce et renforcer sa capacité de vente, il décida de  rejoindre  l‘institution de microfinance Soro Yiriwaso il y a 2 mois. Il est à son premier prêt individuel. Monsieur Adama C. compte acheter, 5 paniers de poissons fumés  à Korientzé (Région de Mopti) auprès des  pêcheurs et effectue sa vente au  marché poisson de Koutiala  à une clientèle composée de femmes et d’ hommes, au comptant et à crédit. Il compte  réaliser un profit de 100.000FCFA par mois qu’il utilisera  pour  le remboursement des intérêts de Soro Yiriwaso, satisfaire ses besoins  et investir le reste dans son activité.
texts.en:
Mr. Adama C., a native of Safebougou, is 41 years old, polygamous and father to six children. He lives in the Medina Coura district of the prefecture of Koutiala (Sikasso region).

He did not continue beyond his primary school education because of social problems. For this reason he developed an interest in income-generating activities with his father. Having had several unsuccessful acitvities, he ended up turning to the purchase and sale of smoked fish fourteen years ago. Smoked fish is in great demand in Koutiala and he has a good reputation.

In order to increase his working capital and strengthen his sales capacity, he decided to join the microfinance institution, Soro Yiriwaso, two months ago. He is on his first individual loan. Mr. Adama C. is planning to buy five baskets of smoked fish from fishermen in Korientzé (Mopti region). He sells his fish at the fish market in Koutiala to a customer base made up of women and men, for cash and on credit. He is expecting to make a monthly profit of 100,000FCFA, which he will use to repay Soro Yiriwaso's interest, satisfy his needs and invest in his business.

loans.use: Purchase of smoked fish

loans.name: Dusabane Group

texts.en:
Theresie is 44 years old and married to a stone mason. She has five children who are between six and twenty-four years old. Two of her children attend school, but others have failed to continue due to lack of school fees. Theresie is a group leader of a borrowing group called Dusabane in Kinyarwanda which means share together in English. 

The group members all have different businesses at the marketplace which is not far from their residential places. Theresie sells a variety of items in her shop such as rice, maize flour, sugar, soft drinks, and many more. She has been doing this business for a period of eighteen years. Since her business is prospering, she decided to request this loan to add more merchandise to sell, and she believes that the profit from this business will be used to re-invest in her business, because she needs to expand her business to the extent of becoming a wholesaler in the future.

loans.use: To buy more items such as rice, maize flour and sugar to sell.

loans.name: Magdalena

texts.en:
Magdalena N. lives in the Nalukolongo neighborhood in the city of Kampala, Uganda.  She is married and has five children, all of whom are in school.  She also takes care of additional family members (elderly parents).  

Magdalena has a business selling charcoal.  She has been in this business for three months and she works 7 days out of every week. Magdalena sells her products at the market by means of retail.  Magdalena has requested a loan of 2000000 Ugandan Shillings from MCDT SACCO, which she will use to buy more bags of charcoal.  

The main business challenges for Magdalena include the rainy season and transportation. Her goals and aspirations for her business are to start selling wholesale only and to own a delivery van.  

Magdalena lives in a home that she owns.  She has access to electricity and piped water.  Her major monthly expenses include school fees, food, and medication.

loans.use: To buy charcoal to resell

loans.name: Luís

texts.es:
Luís C. P. tiene 48 años. Es soltero, vive con los padres y con los hermanos, vive en el cantón de Chillanes en la Provincia de Bolívar. No tiene hijos.

Los miembros de la V.R.C. JESUS DEL GRAN PODER, Comunidad de San Ramón esta ubicada en el cantón Chillanes, a 35 minutos de la Oficina en Chillanes, los miembros de esta ventanilla se dedican exclusivamente a la agricultura.

Luis se dedica a la agricultura a la siembra de maíz y fréjol. Las compras y ventas las realiza en el Cantón Chillanes en la feria de los días Domingos.

Solicita el crédito para la comprar de semillas, abonos y fertilizantes para que la producción sea de calidad. Con el apoyo del crédito le ayudaría económicamente para suplir sus necesidades. Enfrentan desafíos como las plagas y enfermedades y la variedad del clima. Su sueño es comprar un terreno para construir la casa.

Le gusta escuchar música romántica y salir al campo.
texts.en:
Luís C. P. is 48 years old.  He is single and lives with his parents and his siblings.  He lives in the canton of Chillanes in the province of Bolívar.  He does not have children.

The members of the community bank "Jesus del Gran Poder" meet in the community of San Ramón in the canton of Chillanes, 35 minutes from the Chillanes office. The members of this group all work in agriculture.

Luis dedicates himself to growing corn and beans.  He shops and sells each Sunday at the local fair in the canton of Chillanes.

He is requesting this loan to purchase seeds and fertilizers so that his crop is high quality.  The support of this credit will help him economically to meet his necessary expenses.  He faces challenges such as plagues, sicknesses, and a variable climate.  Luis' dream is to buy a plot of land to construct his own home.  He enjoys listening to romantic music and going out to the country.

loans.use: To buy seeds and fertilizers

loans.name: Burulbu Tashkokulova's Group

texts.en:
Burulbu T., 46 and married, is the leader of this group. Her husband works as an employee of the Social Fund Department. Together they have five children. The youngest is a daughter of sixteen who studies at school.

Three years ago with an initial investment of 15,000 KGS Burulbu started to breed cattle. By reselling cattle after fattening them, she earns 1500 KGS per month. With money she will receive from this loan she will buy more cattle. In the future, Burulbu wants to expand her business and improve the family’s living conditions.

About Mol Bulak Finance

This loan is being presented by Mol Bulak Finance, a young and ambitious, socially-focused MFI in Kyrgyzstan. Mol Bulak Finance is strongly committed to the principles of sustainable development on the basis of its “3-Ps” concept: People (building human capital and taking care of its customers and the society as well), Profit (to be profitable to grow larger) and the Planet (taking care of the environment). It is also the only MFI in Kyrgyzstan who delivers its services to customers 365 days a year.

To learn more about Mol Bulak and view a video presentation about the organization, please visit: http://www.kiva.org/about/aboutPartner?id=135

If you would like to support and learn more about Kyrgyzstan and micro-finance in Central Asia, please join our Lending Team—Supporters of Kyrgyzstan—at: http://kiva.org/team/kyrgyzstan Members will get special updates and news from the Kiva Fellows in Kyrgyzstan and Mol Bulak staff.

loans.use: To purchase cattle

loans.name: Nieves

texts.es:
Nieves, tiene 35 años de edad, tiene tres hijos y vive en la ciudad del Cusco, Perú. Nieves trabaja en la municipalidad del San Jerónimo en la área de seguridad ciudadana, ella patrulla a pie las calles, barrios y plazas del distrito de San Jerónimo de la ciudad del Cusco. Nieves requiere el préstamo para uso personal pues el dinero lo utilizara para hacer mantenimiento de su casa. 

Nieves pertenece al banco comunal “Caminemos Juntas” de la UMF Asociación Arariwa de la ciudad del Cusco, Perú.
texts.en: Nieves is 35 years old, has three children and lives in the city of Cusco, Peru.  Nieves works in the municipality of San Jeronimo in the area of public safety.  She patrols the streets, neighborhoods and plazas (squares) on foot in the district of San Jeronimo, in the city of Cusco.  Nieves requires the loan for her own personal use, she will use the money to do maintenance on her home.  Nieves belongs to the communal bank "Caminemos Juntas" ("We Walk Together") of the UMF Arariwa Association, in the city of Cusco, Peru.

loans.use: To do maintenance on her home.

loans.name: Luis Alfonso

texts.es: El Sr Luis labora como ayudante Valvulero es soltero  tiene tres personas  a su cargo, es el primer crédito que CEPRODEL le otorga, agradece la oportunidad que le dan con  este  desembolso porque si va a mejor su vivienda con compra de  materiales  de construcción bloque ,hierro, cemento, arena, clavo, estribo para un cuarto en la vivienda y solventar deuda pendiente que tiene.
texts.en: Luis works as an assistant Valve Installer.  He’s single and has three people in his care.  This is the first loan CEPRODEL has granted him.  He is grateful for the opportunity they give him with this disbursement because he will improve his dwelling buying building materials and supplies like: concrete blocks, iron rods, cement, sand, nails and braces for a room and pay off his current debt.

loans.use: To buy building materials and supplies for home improvement.

loans.name: Choeun's Group

texts.en:
This village bank loan consists of seventeen members located in Kandal Kaoh Touch village, Kandal province. Mrs. ChoeU. S., who was born in 1970, is the village bank loan group leader selected by the other members. She and her husband, Mr. Soa BunthoeU., are farmers who own a plot of land on which they grow spring onions, peanuts and different vegetables which they sell to support their family. Mrs. ChoeU. S.'s husband also earns his living by plowing other farmers' rice fields.

Mrs. ChoeU. S. would like to ask for a loan to buy spring onion seeds for growing. This couple has five children: one is a seamstress in a garment factory and the others are students who help their parents with the farming.

loans.use: to buy spring onion seeds

loans.name: Sonia

texts.es: Sonia tiene 42 años, vive con su esposo y sus 2 hijos en su casa propia. DesD. su niñez se ha dedicado a elaborar objetos artesanales, muy típica en su zona, como es el caso D. los mate burilado. Todo comenzó como un juego y ahora es una fuente importante D. ingreso y que ha sabido transmitir a sus hijos enseñándoles a elaborara este arte. Adicionalmente a esto su esposo se dedica a ofrecer el servicio D. transporte en su propia movilidad, D. esta manera aseguran los ingresos familiares. Sonia se siente muy contenta D. realizar con su trabajo, para ella es muy gratificante que luego D. una semana D. arduo trabajo en producir estos objetos, son llevados al mercado central D. su ciudad para ser comercializados. Por tal motivo, espera que en los próximos años aumente su producción. Es su  décimo crédito con MFP, esta muy contenta D.  saber que tiene un apoyo financiero ya que siempre ha demostrado  ser responsable en sus pagos, además  le agrada ser parte D. su banco comunal porque  todos sus integrantes son personas responsables y muy solidarias, agradece  a aquellas personas que serán gestoras del préstamo que solicita ya que le será  muy útil en el progreso D. su negocio. Con el crédito que solicita, lo invertirá en la compra D. mates o calabazas que es el insumo principal en la elaboración D. mates, asimismo desea pagar el mantenimiento D. su carro.
texts.en:
Sonia is 42 years old and lives with her husband and two children in a house that she owns. Since she was a child, she has maD. handicraft objects typical of her area, such as carved gourds. It all began as a game and it is now an important source of income that she has taught to her children. In addition to this, her husband works in transportation using his own vehicle. This is how they secure their family income. Sonia is very happy with her work and it is very gratifying for her that after a week of hard work in making the objects, they are brought to her city’s central market to be sold. This is why she hopes to increase her production in the upcoming years.

This is her tenth loan with MFP and she is very happy to know that she has financial support, as she has always proven to be responsible in her payments. In addition, she is pleased to be part of the communal bank because all of the members are responsible and very supportive people. She is grateful to all those who will fund the loan she is requesting because it will be very useful for her business’ progress. With the loan requested, she will invest in the purchase of gourds or squashes, which are the main items needed for making the gourds. In addition, she wants to pay for her car maintenance.

loans.use: To buy gourds and squashes for making more handicraft objects

loans.name: Urjinhand

texts.en:
Urjinhand, 49, is married and lives with her husband and two children in the Uvs province of Mongolia. Her husband works as an assistant for a car-repair workshop in the winter and does construction work in the summer time. Her son attends a college and her daughter goes to a local secondary school. 

Urjinhand began the retail trading of coal and firewood in 2003. In addition to her retail business, she operates a well to sell water to locals. She sells coal and firewood outside the well. A bag of coal costs 3,500-4,000 Mongolian tugriks (MNT) and wood costs 2,500-3,000 MNT. Her monthly income fluctuates between 100,000 to 200,000 MNT. 

She is a sociable and hardworking person and her family members support her business. She is requesting a loan of 500,000 MNT to purchase more coal and firewood for her business.

loans.use: To purchase more coal and firewood

loans.name: Ali

texts.ar: علي في عمر 36 سنة متزوج وله3 اولاد يعمل في بلاط المنازل والمحلات له في عمله 20سنة يحب دائما التطور يريد له ولعائلته العيش الجيد والتطور يسعى من خلال طلب قرض من المجموعة الى شراء مواد أولية ضرورية لتطوير عمله، بالإضافة إلى تحسين وصيانة المنزل و السيارة فهو يريد ان يمكن عائلته من العيش بشكل جيد في منزل يخلو بعض الشيء من الاساسيات فهو يعيش في منزل متواضع بسيط وبحاجة ماسة الى تطويره حتى يصبح آمن لعيش اطفال فيه علي نشيط محب لعائلته ويحب عمله ايضا ويحلم بتعليم اولاده بشكل متميز وجيد
texts.en: Ali is 36 years old and married with three children. He works laying tile for houses and shops and has been doing this for 20 years. He wants to secure a comfortable life for himself and his family. With this loan he hopes to improve and renovate his home and car as he wants his family to live in a house without lacking basic necessities. At the moment he lives in a simple house which is in dire need of basic work in order to be suitable and safe for children. Ali loves his family as well as his business and he dreams of being able to provide his children with a good and distinguished education.

loans.use: To buy necessary raw materials.

loans.name: Ali

texts.en:
Ali is a young man from Gaza city in Gaza Strip. Ali finished his school few months ago and started working recently. Ali's brothers helped him when he was a student and paid his tuition fees and school expenses.

Now that Ali is working, he wants to pay back his brothers, so he took out a loan from FATEN in order to have only one payment to make.

Ali appears in the picture here.

loans.use: to repay brothers who paid Ali's school tuition fees.

loans.name: Dorisa

texts.es:
La Sra. Dorisa, pertenece al Banco Comunal “Las Gaviotas II”, del Distrito de Tarapoto, Provincia de San Martin. Es soltera, tiene 47 años  y es madre de 03 hijos, de los cuales  las 2 mayores son mujeres y ya dependen de sí mismas, solo el menor de 10 años depende de ella y es estudiante del nivel primario. 

Desde muy pequeña tuvo afición por los negocios, es así que por iniciativa propia y junto a su hermana deciden dedicarse a la venta de gallinas desvisceradas, dada la enfermedad de su hermana cambian de actividad por la venta de frutas instalándose en su propia casa,  haciéndose de muy buena clientela por lo que se vieron en la necesidad de incrementar con abarrotes, verduras y otros productos de consumo diario. Al fallecer su hermana ella sola se hizo cargo del negocio.

Con este préstamo de S/. 1700.00 comprará paquetes de fideos, leche en caja y conservas de pescado, aceite  en variedad de marcas, verduras, frutas y artículos de higiene personal para continuar dando una mejor atención a sus clientes. 

Dorisa es mujer luchadora se siente muy animada  a continuar trabajando y esta muy agradecida con el Movimiento Manuela Ramos por ayudar a mujeres como ella a tener oportunidades de desarrollarse en el medio donde se desenvuelven.
texts.en:
Mrs. Dorisa belongs to the communal bank "Las Gaviotas II", in the district of Tarapoto, province of San Martin.  She is 47 years old, single and the mother of three children, two of which are independent.  The youngest one, age 10, is in primary school and is dependent on her.

From a very young age, she was always interested in business, so on her own initiative and together with her sister decided to sell chicken.  When her sister became ill they decided to change their activity and began selling fruit out of their home.  They established a very good customer base and had to increase their stock with groceries, vegetables and other daily consumption products.  When her sister passed away she was left alone with the business.

This loan, in the amount of 1,700 PEN, will be used to buy packages of pasta, cartons of milk, canned fish, several brands of oil, vegetables, fruit and personal hygiene products so she can continue to give her customers the best service possible.

Dorisa is a hard worker who is excited about continuing in her line of work.  She is very grateful to the Manuela Ramos Movement for helping women like herself to have the opportunity to get ahead in their businesses.

loans.use: To buy eggs, oil, detergent, sodas, etc.

loans.name: Domingo

texts.es: Domingo es un gran comerciante que vive en el municipio de Soledad, allí tiene un negocio donde vende bebidas, refrescos y ofrece servicios de juegos como billares y dominó, justamente de esta actividad deriva su nombre: “Billares Dominó”.  Domingo inició este esta actividad porque había tenido experiencia como administrador en ella, durante varios años en su pueblo natal.  Él cuenta que con este negocio se le “abrieron las puertas” y aprovechando las oportunidades del mercado se independizó logrando alcanzar muchas de sus  metas de crecimiento; en la actualidad está aplicando a su credikiva que es el primer financiamiento que hace a la Fundación Mario Santo Domingo,  con el cual comprará refrescos, gaseosas por cajas y bebidas, con tal de provisionarse y vender los fines de semana al detal y a negocios a los cuales se les terminan sus productos. Su mayor desafío es el poco capital con el que cuenta para expandirlo y la competencia, por eso siempre está adicionando a su servicios la venta de alimentos, que permanece variando con tal de atraer nuevos clientes y continuar generando utilidades para cubrir los gastos de su familia, conformada por su cónyuge y sus dos hijos en las edades de 10 y 12 años.
texts.en: Domingo is a great merchant and he lives in the municipality of Soledad. There he has a business where he sells drinks, soft drink and has games available, like billiards and domino. And this is where the name of the business comes from: "Billares Domino". Domingo started this activity because he had had previous administration experience, for several years in his birthplace. He says that it was through this business that "doors opened". He took advantage of the opportunities in the market, becoming independent and reaching many of his expansion goals. He is investing his Kiva loan, the first loan that he accesses through Fundacion Mario Santo Domingo (Kiva Field Partner), on the purchase of fruit juices, soft drinks by the box, and drinks. His goal is to supply himself and to sell in retail and to businesses who have sold out of the products. His greatest challenge is a limited capital to use for expansion, as well as the competition. For this reason he has added food sales which he can vary with the goal of attracting new clients and to continue generating an income for his family's expenses. His family is made up of his common-law wife and their two children, aged 10 and 12.

loans.use: to purchase juices, soft drinks, and liquor.

loans.name: Lorena Del Pilar

texts.es: Lorena Del Pilar tiene 44 años, su actividad es brindar el servicio de costura. Hace más de 6 años que tiene este negocio, ella inicio este negocio como un pasatiempo luego con el paso del tiempo fue que logro establecer su negocio. El motivo del crédito es para la compra de telas, tijeras, zipper, hilos, dedal entre otras herramientas necesarias para la elaboración de sus diferentes prendas.
texts.en: Lorena Del Pilar is 44 and she has a sewing business.  She has had this business for more than 6 years, and she started it as a hobby.  As time passed, she established it as her business.  She is requesting a loan to purchase fabric, scissors, zippers, thread, thimbles, and other tools that she needs to make her various garments.

loans.use: to buy fabric, scissors, zippers, thread, thimbles, and other tools.

loans.name: Nyakinoni Tukwatanise Group, Kihihi

texts.en:
Jesca is the leader of Nyakinoni Tukwatanise Group, Kihihi. She is 39 years old and married with four school-going children. She is a hard-working and very trustworthy person who has owned a drug shop offering human drugs at Katete trading centre for over 7 years. 

Jesca says that her customers are good and most of all, they come from around her operating area. She started saving from her salary as initial capital for the drug shop. Her dream is to educate her children and expand her clinic / drug shop. This is Jesca's loan and she needs to restock her drug shop with more tablets, cotton wool, injectables and so on.

loans.use: To restock her drug shop with more tablets, cotton wool, injectables and so on.

loans.name: Wilma Liliana

texts.en: Wilma is 22 years old and lives in Salcedo, in central Ecuador. She is married and lives with her husband and one son in their own house. She is hardworking and supports her family through the production of milk. Wilma began working in milk production because it was a family tradition. She is seeking her first loan to purchase a young bull. She hopes that this loan and the purchase of the bull will help her profitability in the future. Wilma's goal is to obtain more land to live and work on. In the photo, Wilma is pictured with a few of her other animals.

loans.use: to buy a young bull

loans.name: Amal

texts.en: Amal is a 29-year-old young woman who  is married and has five sons and two daughters. Amal has taken out a loan for $2,000 to pay the expenses of car insurance and licensing for her husband's taxi. Amal's husband is a taxi driver in the city of Rafah in Gaza Strip. He transports passengers in the city and to cities outside Rafah. The taxi is the only source of income for Amal's big family. Amal's husband is photographed here instead of his religious wife.

loans.use: to pay for her husband's taxi insurance and licensing.

loans.name: Norbertina

texts.es:
Norbertina está muy feliz y no es para menos un nuevo semestre en el cual su hijo le va  abonado a su meta y esto es gracias a los tres financiamientos con Kiva. Este es su cuarto financiamiento y nuevamente pagara ahora su octavo semestre universitario. “Le doy gracias a Dios ya que gracias a ello mi hijo está saliendo adelante, y pronto se convertirá en un profesional que aportará a su familia y a la sociedad.” Si usted quiere conocer la historia de Norbertina ingrese a los siguientes enlaces:

 http://kiva.org/lend/169823

 http://kiva.org/lend/218365

http://kiva.org/lend/268017
texts.en:
Norbertina is very happy because she is able to pay for a new semester for her son and move him towards his goal, thanks to the three loans with Kiva.  This is her fourth loan and she will use it to pay the eighth university semester.
“I thank God since because of  Him, my son is getting ahead and he will soon be a professional and contribute to his family and society”. 

 If you want to learn about Norbertina’s past loans, check out the following links:
 http://kiva.org/lend/169823

 http://kiva.org/lend/218365

http://kiva.org/lend/268017

loans.use: To pay the eighth semester at the university

loans.name: Roxana De Lourdes

texts.es:
