Roxana  de 46 años de edad, es soltera, vive en su casa propia, cuenta con todos los servicios básicos, ubicada en la zona urbana del distrito de San José que pertenece a la provincia de Chiclayo.  Esta zona se caracteriza por la actividad pesquera y turismo.

Desde hace unos años aproximadamente Roxana se ha dedicado a la venta de abarrotes (todo tipo de productos que se utilizan diariamente como: leche, arroz, aceite, azúcar, papel higiénico, atún, huevos,otros) útiles de escritorio y bebidas, su negocio lo ha colocado en su misma casa para su seguridad, con las ganancias por la venta de sus productos  trata de cubrir  todos sus gastos personales.

Para poder  implementar su negocio a solicitado un crédito a Edpyme Alternativa  de 1000 nuevos soles para comprar más mercadería, con el único ideal de que su negocio se amplie y tenga más productos para ofrecerles a sus clientes;  con el dinero que gane cubrirá su préstamo y sus obligaciones diarias.  Roxana es una persona dedicada y trabajadora que se preocupa por tener más comodidades en su casa y mejoras económicas.
texts.en:
Roxana is 46, single, and lives in her own house, which has all the basic services. It's located in the urban area of San José district, which is part of Chiclayo province. This area is known for fishing and tourism. 

Roxana has been selling groceries for several years. She carries all types of daily-use products such as: milk, rice, cooking oil, sugar, toilet paper, tuna, eggs, stationery, drinks, and other things. She has set up her store in her house for security. With her profits from selling her products, she tries to cover all her personal expenses. 

In order to carry on her business, she is applying to Edpyme Alternativa for a loan of 1000 nuevos soles to buy more merchandise. Her only wish is for her business to grow, and to have more products to offer her customers.

With the money she earns she will pay off her loan, and meet her daily obligations. Roxana is a dedicated and hard-working individual, who cares about having more home comforts, and being in a better financial position.

loans.use: To buy more merchandise for stocking her store.

loans.name: Kyzjibek's Group

texts.en:
Kyzjibek is the leader of this group. She is 32 and married to a taxi driver, whose monthly salary is about 6,000 soms. Together with her husband Kyzjibek is bringing up two daughters; the first daughter is at school and the second is not yet. 

In order to earn money Kyzjibek sews school uniforms. In this way she earns about 5,000 soms per month. She also breeds cattle for making additional money. With money received from this loan she wants to purchase a calf for breeding and materials for sewing school uniforms. In the future she wishes to open a sewing workshop. 

---Where Did This Loan Come From?---

This loan is brought to you by Mol Bulak Finance (MBF), a young, ambitious and socially-focused Microfinance Institution in Kyrgyzstan. 

MBF is strongly committed to the principles of sustainable development and upholds the triple bottom line – People (building human capital and taking care of its customers as well as society), Planet (keeping environmentally friendly) and Profit (earning revenue to expand autonomously). MBF is the only microfinance institute in Kyrgyzstan that delivers its services to customers 365 days a year. To learn more about MBF and view a video presentation about the organization, please visit: http://www.kiva.org/about/aboutPartner?id=135 

If you would like to support and learn more about Kyrgyzstan and microfinance in Central Asia, please join our Lending Team-Supporters of Kyrgyzstan – Mol Bulak Finance at http://kiva.org/team/kyrgyzstan. Members will get special updates and news from Kiva Fellows in Kyrgyzstan and from the MBF staff.

loans.use: to purchase a calf and fabrics for sewing school uniforms

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy bags of fertilizer

loans.name: Mwanasiti

texts.en:
Mwanasiti has operated a food stall business for the past six years, selling on a retail level to her neighbours and passers-by. She faces her primary business challenge in the high cost of transportation. She dreams of expanding her business in the future.

She and her husband have six children, three of whom still attend school. The family owns a house that has neither electricity nor piped water. Her greatest monthly expense is food for the family.

With her Kshs 20,000 loan, she wants to purchase bundles of wheat flour, maize flour, sugar, and washing detergents to offer for sale. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase bundles of wheat flour, maize flour, sugar, and washing detergents to offer for sale

loans.name: Mujeres Emprendedoras Group

texts.es:
El comité Mujeres Emprendedoras ha decidido formar parte del programa de Mujeres Emprendedoras de la Fundación Paraguaya. Este grupo es de la Ciudad de San Lorenzo, las integrantes fijaron como objetivo principal el crecimiento de cada una de ellas, no solo en lo económico, sino también en lo personal.
Las mismas son reconocidas en el lugar como mujeres muy trabajadoras y unidas.
La Sra. Elizabeth, presidenta del grupo, esta domiciliada en la ciudad de San Lorenzo, está casada, con 3 hijos, es una mujer muy emprendedora e innovadora. Su marido se dedica a la jardinería. Ella trabaja en 
la venta de bebidas, mediante el cual puede obtener las ganancias necesarias para poder cubrir los gastos que día a día surgen. Comenta que le va muy bien, por lo que le gustaría poder seguir con su negocio.
Solicita el crédito para la compra de cervezas, whiskys, energizantes y otros, con lo cual podrá abastecer su negocio.
texts.en:
The “Mujeres Emprendedoras” committee has decided to be part of Fundación Paraguaya’s Mujeres Emprendedoras program.  This group is from the city of San Lorenzo.  Each member’s success, not just economic but also personal, is the main objective the group has set for itself.  They are known in the location for being very hardworking, unified women.

Elizabeth is group President.  She lives in the city of San Lorenzo.  She’s married and has three children.  She’s a very enterprising, innovative woman.  Her husband’s a gardener.  She works selling beverages to earn profits needed to cover daily expenses that arise.  She comments that she does very well so would like to stay in business.  She’s asking for the loan to buy beer, liquor, energy drinks and others to stock her business.

loans.use: to buy beer, liquor and energy drinks.

loans.name: Rosemarie

texts.en:
Due to financial difficulty, Rosemarie helps her husband in planting root crops (taro) in their village to generate additional income. She is 43 years old and has four school-age children. They aim to continue sending their children to school for they want them to earn a degree and becomes professionals in the future. Due to the high cost of commodities and school fees, they need to increase their income to acquire their needs and finance the education of their children. 

In this regard, Rosemarie is asking for additional capital of P10,000 to buy seedlings and fertilizers for the maintenance of their root crop production. She hopes that through this loan, they will increase their production and their income and satisfy their family needs.

loans.use: to buy seedlings and fertilizers for the maintenance of their root crop production.

loans.name: Maria Luisa

texts.es: La señora María, de 38 años de edad, originaria de la ciudad de Granada madre soltera de 4 hijos,  de oficio comerciante, se dedica a dar servicios de publicidad y disco móvil. Inicio esta actividad con tan solo dos parlantes y un megáfono anunciando publicidad radio fónica, animando promociones de productos, fiestas, cumpleaños. La falta de trabajo y la responsabilidad de criar cuatro hijos, no era tarea fácil para ella tenían que buscar  la manera de salir adelante con su familia esto la motivo aun mas para ir mejorando cada dia así lo hizo . Hoy en día tiene una disco móvil que ella alquila para animar eventos familiares, como bodas, bautizos, quinceaños, graduaciones. Debido a su esmerada y amable atención a conseguido buenos clientes fijos, que la buscan a ella para que anime sus fiestas familiares, de esta manera entre música y parlantes es la manera que ella se gana la vida. Ella requiere el préstamo para comprar uno parlantes  estilo bajo, pues lo necesita para reemplazar unos que tiene ya que están viejos y no suenan bien, además necesita brindar un buen servicio con equipos en buen estado para cumplir con calidad a sus clientes. Le gustaría expandirse a los pueblos aledaños de la ciudad de Granada y en lo futuro comprar un vehículo para transportar sus parlantes y equipo de animación ya que actualmente paga para que la trasladen sus equipos de un lugar a otro y es costoso para ella. Ella nos dice que cualquier sacrificio vale la pena para sacar adelante a su familia.
texts.en:
María is 38 years old and from the city of Granada.  She is a single mother and has four children.  Her business is offering advertising services and a mobile disco service.  She started this business with just two speakers and a megaphone, announcing radio advertising, hosting product promotions, parties and birthdays.  A lack of work and the responsibility she had to raise her four children did not make life easy for her and she had to find a way to provide for her family.  This motivated her even more to continue improving every day and that is what she did.  She now has a mobile disco that she hires out to liven up family events such as weddings, christenings, fifteenth birthday celebrations and graduations.  Owing to her careful and kind service, she has managed to attract good regular customers who seek her out to liven up their family parties.  In this way, with music and speakers, she earns a living.  

María needs this loan to buy some short speakers as she needs to replace some that she currently has which are old and don't sound good.  She also needs to provide a good service with equipment which is in a good state of repair so that she can offer her customers good quality.  She would like to expand her business so that she can cover villages neighboring the city of Granada and, in the future, she would like to buy a vehicle for transporting her speakers and entertainment equipment as she currently has to pay for somebody to transport her equipment from one place to another and it is very expensive.  She tells us that any sacrifice is worth it so that she can get her family ahead in life.

loans.use: to buy some short speakers

loans.name: Harriet

texts.en: Harriet wants a loan to buy groundnuts and beans to resell. She lives in Masindi-Uganda, and is a single mother charged with the responsibility of taking care of her two children. She started four years back with capital of 200,000 but now her working capital is 6,000,000 shillings. She desires to educate her children and to be a big produce dealer having mills of her own.

loans.use: to buy groundnuts and beans for reselling

loans.name: Maximina

texts.es:
La Sra. Maximina es de Ciudad del Este, está casada con el Sr. Francisco hace varios años. Tuvieron la bendición de tener 5 hijos, todos ellos aun pesuños en edad escolar.
Maximina y su marido trabajan en la compra y venta  de artículos reciclados, se inició con un pequeño capital que tenía ahorrado de otro trabajo que  realizaba y ahora gracias al trabajo de ambos está logrando salir adelante.
Gracias al trabajo de los dos educan a sus hijos y compran todas las necesidades de su hogar, además ayudan a salvar al medio ambiente  Ella ha demostrado ser una persona muy responsable y honesta en sus compromisos.
En esta ocasión solicita el crédito para la compra de aluminio, cobre, plásticos y otros. Ella ya tuvo otros créditos con nosotros y cumplió en forma excelente con sus obligaciones.
texts.en:
Maximina is from Ciudad del Este and has been married to Francisco for several years.  They were blessed with five children; they are all still young and school aged.  Maximina and her husband work buying and selling recyclables.  She started with a small amount of capital that she had saved from another job she had and now, thanks to both their work, they are getting ahead.

Thanks to their joint efforts they are educating their children and buying what’s needed for their home while also helping to preserve the environment.  She has shown herself to be very responsible and honest with her commitments.

On this occasion she’s asking for the loan to buy aluminum, copper, plastics and others.  She’s had two previous loans with us and made her payments in an excellent way.

loans.use: to buy aluminum, copper, plastics and others.

loans.name: Luz Helena

texts.es: Luz Helena le fué muy bien con la inversión de su credikiva anterior y está aplicando a uno nuevo, porque va a aprovechar muy bien la temporada de Diciembre para aumentar su oferta, captar nuevos clientes y aumentar sus utilidades. Con su credikiva comprará tratamientos capilares, tintes, shampoo, en volumenes superiores a los que actualmente está comprando,; su inversión será exitosa porque ganará descuentos, la realizará en época de un gran desplegue comercial y de mucho dinero rotano por efecto de primas, bonificaciones que reciben los trabajadores de las empresas.
texts.en:
Luz Helena did very well with the investment of her prior Kiva loan and is applying for a new one because she wants to be very prepared for the December season to increase her offers, capture new customers and increase profits.  

She will use her Kiva loan to buy hair treatments, hair coloring and shampoo in larger amounts than she’s been buying.  Her investment will be successful because she’ll qualify for discounts and she’ll make it during a season of great commercial activity because a great deal of cash is circulating due to the bonuses and allowances workers get from their firms.

loans.use: to buy supplies for her beauty salon.

loans.name: Dorothy

texts.en:
Dorothy is a married woman with one child who is still too young for school.  She lives in a rental house that has electricity and piped water. Her greatest monthly expense is food for the family.

For the past three years she has operated a retail shop business, selling products in a shop to her neighbours and passers by.  Dorothy dreams of establishing a wholesale shop in the future.

With the KES 10,000 she wants to purchase stocks of wheat flour, maize flour, sugar and rice.  She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase stocks of wheat flour, maize flour, sugar and rice.

loans.name: Mavluda

texts.ru: Мавлюда мать троих взрослых детей, которой 55 лет. Мужа нет в живых, поэтому она живёт со старшим сыном и он вместе ведёт семейные расходы. Сын работает водителем маршрутного городского такси, а его жена занимается домашними делами и воспитанием детей. Мавлюда вносит маленькую лепту в семейные нужды внося хоть не большой но доход с продажи сезонных домашних шлёпанцев и тапочек. На запрашиваемый кредит она хочет завезти партию зимних тапочек.
texts.en: Mavluda is a 55 year-old mother of three adult children.  Her husband has passed away, and this is why she lives with her oldest son, and they manage family expenses together.  Her son works as a driver of a municipal set-route taxi, and his wife is involved in household work and raising children.  Mavluda brings in a small contribution to the family needs, contributing her small profit from the sales of house flip flops and slippers.  She wants to use this loan to bring in an inventory of winter slippers.

loans.use: to purchase an inventory of winter slippers

loans.name: Rosela

texts.en:
Rosela is from Sapang Dalaga, Misamis Occidental. She is 44 years old, married, and has three school-aged children. 

Rosela owns and operates a food stall where she sells snack foods in the local community. She has been in her business for over six years and earns 5,000 PHP a month. 

In 2010, Rosela joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities. She is requesting a loan of 30,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase additional products to sell. She plans to use the additional revenue generated to supplement her family's income.

loans.use: to purchase additional products to sell.

loans.name: Sopen

texts.en:
Sopen, 35, is married and resides with her husband and six children in Takeo Province, Cambodia. Nowadays, she’s basket producer, earning USD 2 per day. Her husband and one of her children are construction workers, earning USD 9.50 per day. Family monthly expenses for food are USD 30, utility expense is USD 6, and school fees for her children are USD 17. Other expenses come to USD 25. 

Sopen is requesting a loan of USD 1000 to purchase construction materials to build her house. This loan will help her have a nice house and good living conditions. In the future, she wants to improve her living standard by collecting baskets from other makers to sell at the market to get more income. Moreover, she wants to support her children to study more to become a teacher.

loans.use: to purchase construction materials to build her house.

loans.name: Gorette

texts.en:
Gorette is 55 years old. She is married with 4 children aged between 38 and 25 years; all of them are married. She sells beans and has been running a business for the past 4 years. 

With the loan, she would like to buy more beans to sell. She will use the profits from the business to reinvest in it and to improve her standard of living.

loans.use: to buy more beans to sell.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Improve on his business
